monster_instances.name: Aboleth

special_abilities.name: Amphibious
special_abilities.description: The aboleth can breathe air and water.

special_abilities.name: Mucous Cloud
special_abilities.description: While underwater, the aboleth is surrounded by transformative mucus. A creature that touches the aboleth or that hits it with a melee attack while within 5 ft. of it must make a DC 14 Constitution saving throw. On a failure, the creature is diseased for 1d4 hours. The diseased creature can breathe only underwater.

special_abilities.name: Probing Telepathy
special_abilities.description: If a creature communicates telepathically with the aboleth, the aboleth learns the creature's greatest desires if the aboleth can see the creature.

actions.name: Multiattack.
actions.description: The aboleth makes three tentacle attacks.

actions.name: Tentacle.
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 12 (2d6 + 5) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 14 Constitution saving throw or become diseased. The disease has no effect for 1 minute and can be removed by any magic that cures disease. After 1 minute, the diseased creature’s skin becomes translucent and slimy, the creature can’t regain hit points unless it is underwater, and the disease can be removed only by heal or another disease--curing spell of 6th level or higher. When the creature is outside a body of water, it takes 6 (1d12) acid damage every 10 minutes unless moisture is applied to the skin before 10 minutes have passed.

actions.name: Tail.
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 10 ft. one target. Hit:15 (3d6 + 5) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Enslave (3/Day).
actions.description: The aboleth targets one creature it can see within 30 feet of it. The target must succeed on a DC 14 Wisdom saving throw or be magically charmed by the aboleth until the aboleth dies or until it is on a different plane of existence from the target. The charmed target is under the aboleth’s control and can’t take reactions, and the aboleth and the target can communicate telepathically with each other over any distance. Whenever the charmed target takes damage, the target can repeat the saving throw. On a success, the effect ends. No more than once every 24 hours, the target can also repeat the saving throw when it is at least 1 mile away from the aboleth. The aboleth can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature’s turn. The aboleth regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

monster_instances.description: The Aboleth is a monstrous aberration with a grotesque body that is half-fish and half-humanoid. Its *pale white skin* is covered in slime, giving it an appearance of being **constantly dripping wet**. Its *large eyes* bulge from its head like *fleshy orbs*, casting a sinister glow over its surroundings. The creature's *huge mouth* is filled with sharp teeth that seem ready to tear apart anything that comes too close. In its hands, it holds a whip made from its own tentacles, which it uses to control its prey. Its *amphibious nature* allows it to move freely in both water and land environments.

additionals.title: Aboleth Society
additionals.content: The Aboleth are an ancient race of beings that have existed for millennia. They live in hidden underwater cities scattered throughout the world. These cities are filled with advanced technology that has been developed over countless generations of research.

additionals.title: Aboleth Intelligence
additionals.content: Aboleth are known for their vast intelligence and telepathic abilities. They have been studying the minds of other creatures for centuries, learning their secrets and using them to further their own goals.

additionals.title: Aboleth Life Cycle
additionals.content: The life cycle of an Aboleth is unique among creatures. They reproduce by releasing spores into the water which grow into new Aboleth over time.

monster_instances.name: Deva

special_abilities.name: Angelic Weapons
special_abilities.description: The deva's weapon attacks are magical. When the deva hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra 4d8 radiant damage (included in the attack).

special_abilities.name: Innate Spellcasting
special_abilities.description:
The deva's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 17). The deva can innately cast the following spells, requiring only verbal components:
At will: detect evil and good
1/day each: commune, raise dead

special_abilities.name: Magic Resistance
special_abilities.description: The deva has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

actions.name: Multiattack.
actions.description: The deva makes two melee attacks.

actions.name: Mace.
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) bludgeoning damage plus 18 (4d8) radiant damage.

actions.name: Healing Touch (3/Day).
actions.description: The deva touches another creature. The target magically regains 20 (4d8 + 2) hit points and is freed from any curse, disease, poison, blindness, or deafness.

actions.name: Change Shape.
actions.description: The deva magically polymorphs into a humanoid or beast that has a challenge rating equal to or less than its own, or back into its true form. It reverts to its true form if it dies. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying is absorbed or borne by the new form (the deva’s choice).  In a new form, the deva retains its game statistics and ability to speak, but its AC, movement modes, Strength, Dexterity, and special senses are replaced by those of the new form, and it gains any statistics and capabilities (except class features, legendary actions, and lair actions) that the new form has but that it lacks.

monster_instances.damage_resistances: radiant; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical weapons
monster_instances.description: The Deva is a *celestial being*, a guardian of justice and harmony in the mortal realm. Its *luminous form* is a testament to its divine nature, with **golden** wings spreading wide as it soars through the skies. The Deva's eyes hold a wisdom that transcends time, their *intense gaze* piercing through the veil of illusion that shrouds the world. Its *mace* is more than just a weapon; it is an instrument of justice, wielded with unerring precision against those who seek to disrupt the balance of good and evil. The Deva's **radiant** touch has the power to heal not only physical wounds but also *curses, diseases*, and other maladies that corrupt the soul. Its **innate spellcasting** abilities allow it to detect evil and good with ease, while its *magic resistance* ensures that it remains unscathed by many forms of arcane attack.

additionals.title: The Deva's Role in Celestial Hierarchy

content.title: The Deva's Role in Celestial Hierarchy
content.content: The Deva stands as a *pillar of justice* in the celestial hierarchy, acting as a *vanguard* for the forces of good. As a *protector of the innocent*, it is entrusted with the responsibility of maintaining the delicate balance between the realms of good and evil. The Deva's *divine lineage* and *unwavering loyalty* to its cause make it a formidable ally and a feared adversary to those who oppose the forces of good.

additionals.title: The Deva's Relationship with Other Celestials

content.title: The Deva's Relationship with Other Celestials
content.content: The Deva shares a *complex relationship* with other celestial beings. As a *member of the celestial hierarchy*, it is bound by a *code of honor* that dictates its interactions with other divine beings. While it may *alliance* with other celestials in times of need, it is ultimately *loyal* to its own *divine purpose*. The Deva's *unique abilities* and *insight* into the workings of the celestial realm make it a valuable *ally* and a *potential rival* to other celestial beings.

content.title: Legends of Divine Intervention
content.content: Throughout history, tales of *divine intervention* have been passed down through generations, recounting the *heroic deeds* of celestial beings like the Deva. These legends often depict the Deva as a *guardian angel*, *saving lives* and *restoring balance* in times of crisis. The *selflessness* and *courage* of the Deva in these stories serve as a *source of inspiration* for mortals seeking to emulate the *virtues* of the divine.

monster_instances.name: Planetar

special_abilities.name: Angelic Weapons
special_abilities.description: The planetar's weapon attacks are magical. When the planetar hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra 5d8 radiant damage (included in the attack).

special_abilities.name: Divine Awareness
special_abilities.description: The planetar knows if it hears a lie.

special_abilities.name: Innate Spellcasting
special_abilities.description:
The planetar's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 20). The planetar can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:
At will: detect evil and good, invisibility (self only)
3/day each: blade barrier, dispel evil and good, flame strike, raise dead
1/day each: commune, control weather, insect plague

special_abilities.name: Magic Resistance
special_abilities.description: The planetar has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

actions.name: Multiattack.
actions.description: The planetar makes two melee attacks.

actions.name: Greatsword.
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack:+12 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit:21 (4d6 + 7) slashing damage plus 22 (5d8) radiant damage.

actions.name: Healing Touch (4/Day).
actions.description: The planetar touches another creature. The target magically regains 30 (6d8 + 3) hit points and is freed from any curse, disease, poison, blindness, or deafness.

monster_instances.damage_resistances: radiant; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical weapons
monster_instances.description: The Planetar is a majestic celestial being, its body adorned with iridescent feathers that shimmer in hues of gold and silver. Its eyes hold an ethereal glow, radiating wisdom and compassion. Standing tall on legs of pure light, it wields a greatsword that seems to be forged from starlight itself. Its presence commands respect and reverence from all who behold it. The Planetar's aura is one of protection and healing, drawing those in need towards it for solace and guidance.

additionals.title: Celestial Court
additionals.content: In the celestial realms above, the Planetar holds a revered position among its kin. It serves as an emissary between the heavens and mortal realms, acting as a beacon of hope and justice.

additionals.title: Guardian of Life
additionals.content: The Planetar is often found defending sacred groves or temples dedicated to divine entities. It fiercely protects these sanctuaries from evil forces seeking to corrupt or desecrate them.

additionals.title: Awe-Inspiring Battles
additionals.content: Legend has it that in ancient times, Planetars fought alongside other celestial beings against powerful demon lords who sought to plunge the world into darkness. These epic battles have become part of mythology and inspire tales of heroism.

monster_instances.name: Solar

special_abilities.name: Angelic Weapons
special_abilities.description: The solar's weapon attacks are magical. When the solar hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra 6d8 radiant damage (included in the attack).

special_abilities.name: Divine Awareness
special_abilities.description: The solar knows if it hears a lie.

special_abilities.name: Innate Spellcasting
special_abilities.description:
The solar's spell casting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 25). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:
At will: detect evil and good, invisibility (self only)
3/day each: blade barrier, dispel evil and good, resurrection
1/day each: commune, control weather

special_abilities.name: Magic Resistance
special_abilities.description: The solar has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

actions.name: Multiattack.
actions.description: The solar makes two greatsword attacks.

actions.name: Greatsword.
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +15 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 22 (4d6 + 8) slashing damage plus 27 (6d8) radiant damage.

actions.name: Slaying Longbow.
actions.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +13 to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. Hit: 15 (2d8 + 6) piercing damage plus 27 (6d8) radiant damage. If the target is a creature that has 100 hit points or fewer, it must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or die.

actions.name: Flying Sword.
actions.description: The solar releases its greatsword to hover magically in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of it. If the solar can see the sword, the solar can mentally command it as a bonus action to fly up to 50 feet and either make one attack against a target or return to the solar’s hands. If the hovering sword is targeted by any effect, the solar is considered to be holding it. The hovering sword falls if the solar dies.

actions.name: Healing Touch (4/Day).
actions.description: The solar touches another creature. The target magically regains 40 (8d8 + 4) hit points and is freed from any curse, disease, poison, blindness, or deafness. The solar can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature’s turn. The solar regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

monster_instances.damage_resistances: radiant; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical weapons
monster_instances.description: The Solar, a majestic celestial being of immense power, is an embodiment of lawful good in the world. Its large frame is adorned with radiant armor, and its eyes hold the wisdom of the cosmos. As a guardian of balance, it wields its greatsword with unmatched skill, dealing devastating blows to those who threaten the natural order. The Solar's divine awareness allows it to discern truth from falsehood, while its magic resistance makes it nearly impervious to spells and magical effects. Its innate spellcasting abilities are vast and varied, capable of detecting evil and good or even resurrecting fallen allies. The Solar's most potent ability, however, is its healing touch - a beacon of hope in times of darkness that can heal wounds and cure curses with a single touch.

additionals.title: The Celestial Crusade
additionals.content: The Solar is a member of an elite order of celestial beings known as the Celestial Crusade. These divine warriors are sworn to protect the balance between good and evil in the world. They roam the lands in search of evil forces that seek to disrupt this balance, using their divine powers to vanquish them and restore harmony.

additionals.title: The Radiant Sanctuary
additionals.content: When not engaged in combat against evil forces, a Solar can create a radiant sanctuary around itself or others. This sanctuary acts as a safe haven from evil influences and magical effects. It provides protection from harm, healing for injuries, and guidance for those who seek truth.

additionals.title: The Divine Judgment
additionals.content: In times of great strife or when facing overwhelming odds, a Solar can unleash its divine judgment upon its foes. This powerful ability allows it to strike down multiple enemies at once with its greatsword while simultaneously casting powerful spells that can turn the tide of battle in favor of good.

monster_instances.name: Animated Armor
monster_instances.senses: blindsight 60 ft. (blind beyond this radius), passive Perception 6

special_abilities.name: Antimagic Susceptibility
special_abilities.description: The armor is incapacitated while in the area of an antimagic field. If targeted by dispel magic, the armor must succeed on a Constitution saving throw against the caster's spell save DC or fall unconscious for 1 minute.

special_abilities.name: False Appearance
special_abilities.description: While the armor remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a normal suit of armor.

actions.name: Multiattack.
actions.description: The armor makes two melee attacks.

actions.name: Slam.
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) bludgeoning damage.

monster_instances.condition_immunities: blinded, charmed, deafened, exhaustion, frightened, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned
monster_instances.description: The Animated Armor, a construct of cold steel and unyielding will, stands as a testament to the power of magic and the art of craftsmanship. Its once-shining surface now bears the marks of countless battles, a silent testament to the countless foes it has vanquished. The armor's blindsight allows it to detect threats even in the darkest corners, while its false appearance makes it a formidable foe. The armor's slam attacks are swift and deadly, capable of delivering crushing blows that can leave even the most seasoned warriors reeling. Despite its unyielding nature, the armor is not without its vulnerabilities. It is incapacitated in the presence of an antimagic field and can be dispelled by dispel magic, leaving it vulnerable and helpless. The armor's existence is a constant reminder of the power of magic and the ever-present danger of the unknown.

additionals.title: The Forging of the Animated Armor
additionals.content: The Animated Armor is a masterpiece of magical craftsmanship, created by a long-lost order of artificers who sought to harness the power of magic to create the perfect weapon. The armor is imbued with a powerful enchantment that brings it to life, allowing it to move and attack on its own. The armor's creation was a labor of love, taking years of painstaking work to perfect. The artificers who created the armor were driven by a desire to protect their homeland from the forces of darkness, and the armor was their greatest creation, a symbol of their unwavering commitment to their cause.

additionals.title: The Fall of the Artificers
additionals.content: The order of artificers who created the Animated Armor was eventually wiped out by a powerful necromancer who sought to harness the armor's power for his own nefarious purposes. The necromancer's dark magic corrupted the armor, turning it into a mindless weapon of destruction. The armor's original creators fought valiantly against the necromancer, but in the end, they were unable to defeat him. The armor was eventually discovered by a group of adventurers who managed to purge the necromancer's dark magic from the armor, restoring it to its former glory.

additionals.title: The Animated Armor in Battle
additionals.content: The Animated Armor is a formidable force on the battlefield, its relentless attacks and unyielding defense making it a nightmare for any enemy to face. The armor's blindsight allows it to detect enemies even in the darkest corners of the battlefield, while its false appearance makes it nearly impossible to spot. The armor's slam attacks are swift and deadly, capable of delivering crushing blows that can leave even the most seasoned warriors reeling. Despite its unyielding nature, the armor is not without its vulnerabilities. It is incapacitated in the presence of an antimagic field and can be dispelled by dispel magic, leaving it vulnerable and helpless.

monster_instances.name: Flying Sword
monster_instances.senses: blindsight 60 ft. (blind beyond this radius), passive Perception 7

special_abilities.name: Antimagic Susceptibility
special_abilities.description: The sword is incapacitated while in the area of an antimagic field. If targeted by dispel magic, the sword must succeed on a Constitution saving throw against the caster's spell save DC or fall unconscious for 1 minute.

special_abilities.name: False Appearance
special_abilities.description: While the sword remains motionless and isn't flying, it is indistinguishable from a normal sword.

actions.name: Longsword.
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d8 + 1) slashing damage.

monster_instances.condition_immunities: blinded, charmed, deafened, frightened, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned
monster_instances.description: The Flying Sword is a small, unassuming construct designed for aerial combat and ambushes. While it appears to be nothing more than an ordinary sword when at rest, its true power lies in its ability to fly and wield its deadly blade with deadly precision. This construct's origins are shrouded in mystery, but it's clear that it was created with both utility and lethality in mind.

additionals.title: The Art of Aerial Combat
additionals.content: The Flying Sword is an expert in aerial combat, using its speed and agility to evade enemy attacks while delivering powerful blows of its own. It can hover in place, allowing it to maintain its position and strike at enemies below without losing altitude. Its blindsight ability also gives it an advantage when fighting in low-light conditions or when its vision is otherwise limited.

additionals.title: A History of Deception
additionals.content: The Flying Sword's false appearance ability has allowed it to blend in with other objects or even appear as an ordinary sword, making it difficult for enemies to detect until it's too late. This has made the sword a valuable tool for spies and assassins alike, who can use it to sneak into heavily guarded locations or carry out covert missions without raising suspicion.

additionals.title: Falling from the Skies
additionals.content: Despite its flying abilities, the Flying Sword is not invulnerable to the forces of gravity. If struck by a powerful enough attack or caught in a strong updraft, it could be knocked out of the sky and plummet towards the ground at high speeds. This vulnerability makes it important for the sword to stay on the move and avoid direct confrontations whenever possible.

monster_instances.name: Rug of Smothering
monster_instances.senses: blindsight 60 ft. (blind beyond this radius), passive Perception 6

special_abilities.name: Antimagic Susceptibility
special_abilities.description: The rug is incapacitated while in the area of an antimagic field. If targeted by dispel magic, the rug must succeed on a Constitution saving throw against the caster's spell save DC or fall unconscious for 1 minute.

special_abilities.name: Damage Transfer
special_abilities.description: While it is grappling a creature, the rug takes only half the damage dealt to it, and the creature grappled by the rug takes the other half.

special_abilities.name: False Appearance
special_abilities.description: While the rug remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a normal rug.

actions.name: Smother.
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one Medium or smaller creature. Hit:The creature is grappled (escape DC 13). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained, blinded, and at risk of suffocating, and the rug can’t smother another target. In addition, at the start of each of the target’s turns, the target takes 10 (2d6 + 3) bludgeoning damage.

monster_instances.condition_immunities: blinded, charmed, deafened, frightened, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned
monster_instances.description: Lurking in the shadows of the mundane, the Rug of Smothering is a malevolent entity, its sole purpose to ensnare and suffocate the unsuspecting. At first glance, it's just an ordinary rug, but when stirred, it awakens, transforming into a relentless predator. This creation, as rare as it is perilous, has origins cloaked in enigma. Some whisper it was the brainchild of a deranged wizard, hell-bent on devising the ultimate snare for his foes. Others murmur about a necromancer's twisted experiment, an attempt to infuse a simple rug with the life force of a fallen creature. Yet, there are those who believe it to be a cursed relic, tainted by the sinister magic of the Nine Hells. Regardless of its true genesis, one thing is certain: the Rug of Smothering is a manifestation of darkness and despair, a foe not to be underestimated.

additionals.title: Engineering Notes
additionals.content:
Discovered in a dusty tome within an abandoned library, these incomplete notes provide a glimpse into the creation of a Rug of Smothering.


- **Materials needed**: A large rug (preferably of wool or silk), a living creature (preferably humanoid or beast), a silver dagger, a black candle, a vial of blood, a scroll of animate objects, a scroll of magic jar.


 **Procedure**: 

 - Ignite the black candle and position it at the center of the rug.
 With the silver dagger, slit the creature's throat and collect its life essence in the vial.
- Chant the incantation from the scroll of magic jar, transferring the creature's soul into the vial.
- Douse the rug with the blood and recite the incantation from the scroll of animate objects.
- The rug, now animated, should possess the creature's soul.
- To awaken the rug, utter the command word: \"Smother\".
- To put the rug to rest, say the command word: \"Sleep\".

 **Notes**:

- The rug's demeanor and appearance may vary based on the creature used.
- The rug may resist the command words, developing a will of its own.
- Spells and effects targeting constructs or living creatures may affect the rug.
- The rug may be vulnerable to antimagic fields and dispel magic.
- Fire or acid may destroy the rug.
- The rug's behavior can be unpredictable and dangerous. Proceed with caution.

additionals.title: The Rug's Prey
additionals.content:
The Rug of Smothering is indiscriminate in its choice of prey, attacking any creature within its reach. However, it does exhibit certain preferences and tendencies:

- **Preferred Prey**: Creatures that are medium or smaller in size, isolated, distracted or unaware, and weak or wounded. These traits make them easier to ensnare and smother.

- **Avoided Creatures**: Creatures that are large or bigger in size, in groups or accompanied, alert or wary, and strong or healthy. These traits make them more challenging targets.

The Rug of Smothering harbors a special hatred for fire and acid, the only substances that can permanently destroy it. It will avoid any creature that uses or carries such substances, and will flee or retaliate if attacked by them.

additionals.title: Tales of the Fallen*
additionals.content: There are countless stories of those who have fallen victim to the Rug of Smothering. One such tale speaks of a brave knight who, despite his strength and courage, was overpowered by the rug. His last words, whispered to his squire as he was being smothered, were a warning of the rug's true nature. His squire managed to escape, carrying the knight's warning to others. The knight's sacrifice was not in vain, for his tale has saved many from a similar fate.

monster_instances.name: Ankheg
monster_instances.senses: darkvision 60 ft., tremorsense 60 ft., passive Perception 11
monster_instances.description: The Ankheg, also known as the scorpion-like monstrosity, is a large creature that roams the underground caverns and tunnels of the world. Its tough exoskeleton provides excellent protection against physical attacks, while its powerful mandibles are capable of delivering a venomous bite that can incapacitate even the strongest adversaries. With keen senses that allow it to detect intruders from far away, the Ankheg is an elusive and dangerous predator that strikes quickly and without mercy. Its burrowing ability enables it to move through tight spaces and escape from danger with ease.

additionals.title: Bite Attack
additionals.content: The Ankheg's bite attack is not only powerful but also deadly. Its mandibles deliver a swift and painful strike, causing significant piercing damage. However, the venom injected into its prey can be just as lethal, dealing necrotic damage over time and potentially incapacitating or even killing its victim.

additionals.title: Poisonous Nature
additionals.content: The Ankheg's poisonous nature is not limited to its bite attack. The creature's exoskeleton may be coated in venomous secretions that can cause harm to those who come into contact with it or inhale its dust. Additionally, the Ankheg's burrowing ability can create clouds of poisonous dust that can slow down or even paralyze unsuspecting prey.

additionals.title: Hunting Strategies
additionals.content: Ankhegs are solitary hunters that rely on their stealth and speed to ambush their prey. They often lie in wait near tunnel entrances or in hidden alcoves, using their tremorsense ability to detect approaching creatures long before they arrive. When an enemy enters range, the Ankheg will strike with lightning speed, using its deadly bite to deliver both physical and necrotic damage.

monster_instances.name: Azer

special_abilities.name: Heated Body
special_abilities.description: A creature that touches the azer or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 ft. of it takes 5 (1d10) fire damage.

special_abilities.name: Heated Weapons
special_abilities.description: When the azer hits with a metal melee weapon, it deals an extra 3 (1d6) fire damage (included in the attack).

special_abilities.name: Illumination
special_abilities.description: The azer sheds bright light in a 10-foot radius and dim light for an additional 10 ft..

actions.name: Warhammer.
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) bludgeoning damage, or 8 (1d10 + 3) bludgeoning damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack, plus 3 (1d6) fire damage.

monster_instances.description: The **Azer** is a **medium-sized** creature with an elemental nature, its fiery essence radiating from within. Its *scorching* body is covered in *shimmering* scales that seem to *dance* with each movement, giving it an ethereal appearance. The **Azer**'s presence is felt long before it is seen, as the air around it seems to *sizzle* with heat. Despite its intimidating appearance, the **Azer** is a creature of balance, maintaining order through its lawful neutral alignment. It wields its warhammer with precision and skill, striking down those who would disrupt the balance of the world. Its heated body can be both a blessing and a curse; while it provides warmth in colder climates, it can also cause harm to those who come into contact with it. The **Azer**'s illumination ability allows it to see through even the darkest nights, ensuring that justice is served at all times.

additionals.title: Elemental Balance
additionals.content: *In ancient times*, _Azers_ were believed to be guardians of elemental balance. They were said to protect the delicate equilibrium between fire, water, earth, and air, ensuring that no single element would dominate the others.

additionals.title: The Hammer of Justice
additionals.content: *Legend has it* that _Azers_ are imbued with divine power by their creators to wield their warhammers as instruments of justice. They are said to strike down evil doers who threaten the harmony of their world.

additionals.title: The Azer's Role
additionals.content: *The Azer* plays an important role in maintaining order within its realm. It is often seen as a symbol of strength and determination by those who seek justice.

monster_instances.name: Basilisk

special_abilities.name: Petrifying Gaze
special_abilities.description:
If a creature starts its turn within 30 ft. of the basilisk and the two of them can see each other, the basilisk can force the creature to make a DC 12 Constitution saving throw if the basilisk isn't incapacitated. On a failed save, the creature magically begins to turn to stone and is restrained. It must repeat the saving throw at the end of its next turn. On a success, the effect ends. On a failure, the creature is petrified until freed by the greater restoration spell or other magic.
A creature that isn't surprised can avert its eyes to avoid the saving throw at the start of its turn. If it does so, it can't see the basilisk until the start of its next turn, when it can avert its eyes again. If it looks at the basilisk in the meantime, it must immediately make the save.
If the basilisk sees its reflection within 30 ft. of it in bright light, it mistakes itself for a rival and targets itself with its gaze.

actions.name: Bite.
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. H it:10 (2d6 + 3) piercing damage plus 7 (2d6) poison damage.

monster_instances.description: The Basilisk is a monstrous creature with a deadly gaze that can turn its victims to stone. Its body is covered in scales that shimmer in the light, giving it an otherworldly appearance. The basilisk's eyes are large and piercing, filled with malice and hatred. It has a long, venomous snake-like tail that it uses for balance and as a weapon. The basilisk's poisonous bite is lethal to many creatures, but it is most feared for its petrifying gaze. This terrifying ability can turn even the bravest of warriors into stone in an instant. However, the basilisk's vulnerability lies in bright light - it cannot stand direct sunlight or brightly lit areas, making it easy to exploit.

additionals.title: The Origins of the Basilisk
additionals.content: The Basilisk is an ancient creature, dating back to the dawn of time. It is said to have been created by powerful sorcerers who sought to harness its immense power for their own purposes. Over time, the basilisk has evolved into the fearsome beast that it is today. Its origins are shrouded in mystery, but some believe that it was created from a combination of serpentine and reptilian creatures, imbued with powerful magic that gives it its deadly abilities.

monster_instances.name: Behir

actions.name: Multiattack.
actions.description: The behir makes two attacks: one with its bite and one to constrict.

actions.name: Bite.
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 22 (3d10 + 6) piercing damage.

actions.name: Constrict.
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 5 ft., one Large or smaller creature. Hit: 17 (2d10 + 6) bludgeoning damage plus 17 (2d10 + 6) slashing damage. The target is grappled (escape DC 16) if the behir isn’t already constricting a creature, and the target is restrained until this grapple ends.

actions.name: Lightning Breath (Recharge 5-6).
actions.description: The behir exhales a line of lightning that is 20 feet long and 5 feet wide. Each creature in that line must make a DC 16 Dexterity saving throw, taking 66 (12d10) lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

actions.name: Swallow.
actions.description: The behir makes one bite attack against a Medium or smaller target it is grappling. If the attack hits, the target is also swallowed, and the grapple ends. While swallowed, the target is blinded and restrained, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the behir, and it takes 21 (6d6) acid damage at the start of each of the behir’s turns. A behir can have only one creature swallowed at a time.  If the behir takes 30 damage or more on a single turn from the swallowed creature, the behir must succeed on a DC 14 Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or regurgitate the creature, which falls prone in a space within 10 feet of the behir. If the behir dies, a swallowed creature is no longer restrained by it and can escape from the corpse by using 15 feet of movement, exiting prone.

monster_instances.description: The Behir, a monstrous serpentine creature with a large, muscular body and a wickedly sharp tail, is a formidable predator that prowls the wilderness. Its scales shimmer with an iridescent hue, reflecting the sunlight as it slithers through the dense foliage. This fearsome beast is native to treacherous mountainous regions and deep forests, where it ambushes its prey with deadly precision. Known for its cunning and stealthy nature, the Behir is an apex predator that relishes the thrill of the chase. It employs a combination of stealth and brute force to subdue its victims, using its lightning breath to strike from afar before closing in for a devastating constriction or swallowing attack.

additionals.title: Hunting Strategies
additionals.content: The Behir is an opportunistic hunter that prefers to ambush its prey from hiding spots such as rocky outcroppings or dense foliage. It uses its keen senses to detect prey from miles away and patiently waits for the perfect moment to strike. The Behir's lightning breath allows it to quickly dispatch targets from a distance before they even realize they are in danger. Once it has weakened its prey with lightning strikes, the Behir moves in for the kill with powerful constrictions or by attempting to swallow them whole.

additionals.title: Weaknesses
additionals.content: Despite their fearsome reputation, Behirs have their weaknesses. Their large size makes them slow-moving creatures that struggle in tight spaces or when attempting to navigate rough terrain quickly. Additionally, their reliance on their lightning breath can leave them vulnerable if they run out of energy or if their breath weapon is neutralized by magical effects or protective barriers.

additionals.title: Adaptability
additionals.content: Behirs are known for their adaptability and resilience. They have been observed adapting to different environments over time by altering their diet or finding new hunting grounds when necessary. Some Behirs have even been known to form temporary alliances with other creatures in order to survive harsh conditions or when faced with particularly dangerous threats.

monster_instances.name: Bugbear

special_abilities.name: Brute
special_abilities.description: A melee weapon deals one extra die of its damage when the bugbear hits with it (included in the attack).

special_abilities.name: Surprise Attack
special_abilities.description: If the bugbear surprises a creature and hits it with an attack during the first round of combat, the target takes an extra 7 (2d6) damage from the attack.

actions.name: Morningstar.
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack:+4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit:11 (2d8 + 2) piercing damage.

actions.name: Javelin.
actions.description: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack:+4 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30/120 ft., one target. Hit:9 (2d6 + 2)piercing damage in melee or 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage at range.

monster_instances.description: The Bugbear is a cunning and ferocious goblinoid humanoid, known for its agility and prowess in combat. Its large frame is covered in hide armor, giving it an impressive armor class of 16. With darkvision that extends 60 feet, it can navigate the shadows with ease. In battle, the bugbear's surprise attack ability allows it to deal devastating damage in the first round of combat, dealing an extra 7 (2d6) damage from the attack. Its brute ability also gives it an edge in melee combat, allowing a melee weapon to deal one extra die of its damage when the bugbear hits with it.

additionals.title: The Art of Stealth
additionals.content: Despite its large size and fearsome appearance, the bugbear has developed a keen sense of stealth. It can move silently through the shadows, using its darkvision to avoid detection by its prey. This makes it a formidable ambush predator that can strike quickly and without warning.

additionals.title: Goblinoid Society
additionals.content: Bugbears are part of the larger goblinoid society, which includes other creatures such as goblins and hobgoblins. They often live in tribes or clans led by powerful chieftains who command respect through their cunning and martial prowess.

additionals.title: Cunning Tactician
additionals.content: The bugbear's intelligence may not be particularly high, but it has developed a keen sense for tactics in battle. It can use its surroundings to its advantage, setting traps or finding cover to gain an edge over its opponents.

monster_instances.name: Bulette
monster_instances.senses: darkvision 60 ft., tremorsense 60 ft., passive Perception 16

special_abilities.name: Standing Leap
special_abilities.description: The bulette's long jump is up to 30 ft. and its high jump is up to 15 ft., with or without a running start.

actions.name: Bite.
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack:+7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit:30 (4d12 + 4) piercing damage.

actions.name: Deadly Leap.
actions.description: If the bulette jumps at least 15 feet as part of its movement, it can then use this action to land on its feet in a space that contains one or more other creatures. Each of those creatures must succeed on a DC 16 Strength or Dexterity saving throw (target’s choice) or be knocked prone and take 14 (3d6 + 4) bludgeoning damage plus 14 (3d6 + 4) slashing damage. On a successful save, the creature takes only half the damage, isn’t knocked prone, and is pushed 5 feet out of the bulette’s space into an unoccupied space of the creature’s choice. If no unoccupied space is within range, the creature instead falls prone in the bulette’s space.

monster_instances.description: The Bulette, a large monstrosity with a fearsome appearance, is a terrifying predator that lurks beneath the earth's surface. Its muscular body is covered in thick, coarse fur, while its powerful jaws house razor-sharp teeth designed for tearing through flesh and bone. The bulette's dark eyes reveal an unrelenting hunger for prey. Its natural armor protects it from harm as it burrows through the ground at impressive speeds. With a keen sense of tremorsense, the bulette can detect even the slightest vibrations in the earth, making it nearly impossible for prey to escape its grasp. The bulette's standing leap allows it to cover great distances with ease, while its deadly leap enables it to strike from above with devastating force. Adventurers who encounter this fearsome beast must be cautious and prepared to face a relentless predator.

additionals.title: The Bulette's Hunting Techniques
additionals.content: The bulette is an expert at stalking its prey and using the environment to its advantage. It often waits in ambush near the entrance of burrows or along paths frequented by potential victims. When a target approaches, the bulette leaps out and lands on its feet in a surprise attack, knocking prey off balance and inflicting massive damage with its powerful bite.

additionals.title: The Bulette's Adaptability
additionals.content: While primarily found in underground lairs, bulettes have been known to adapt to various environments such as swamps or even urban areas. Their ability to burrow through different terrains gives them an advantage when hunting prey or escaping danger. In addition to their natural armor and powerful jaws, bulettes have developed unique strategies for survival in diverse habitats.

additionals.title: A Tale of Survival: The Bulette's Resilience
additionals.content: In times of scarcity or when faced with particularly formidable adversaries, bulettes have been known to adapt their predatory habits. They become more cunning and resourceful, scavenging carrion or even raiding campsites for food. This resilience has allowed them to survive in regions where other predators would struggle.

monster_instances.name: Centaur

special_abilities.name: Charge
special_abilities.description: If the centaur moves at least 30 ft. straight toward a target and then hits it with a pike attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 10 (3d6) piercing damage.

actions.name: Multiattack.
actions.description: The centaur makes two attacks: one with its pike and one with its hooves or two with its longbow.

actions.name: Pike.
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (1d10 + 4) piercing damage.

actions.name: Hooves.
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Longbow.
actions.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d8 + 2) piercing damage.

monster_instances.description: The Centaur is a majestic creature with the upper body of a humanoid and the lower body of a horse. Its strong, muscular legs propel it across the battlefield at incredible speeds, while its powerful arms wield weapons with deadly precision. Its eyes are filled with intelligence and determination, reflecting its keen survival instincts and adaptability. The Centaur's noble bearing and natural grace make it an impressive sight to behold, and its neutral good alignment suggests that it can be reasoned with and may even choose to fight alongside adventurers who share its values.

additionals.title: The Life of a Centaur
additionals.content: Centaur society is complex and diverse, with various tribes living throughout the wilderness. They are skilled hunters and trackers, relying on their natural abilities to survive in their harsh environments. They are also known for their strong family bonds and deep respect for nature. While they may be fierce warriors when necessary, they prefer to live in harmony with the world around them.

additionals.title: The Art of Centaur Combat
additionals.content: Centaur combat techniques emphasize speed, agility, and power. They use their Charge ability to deliver devastating blows with their pikes or hooves, while their longbows allow them to engage enemies from a distance. Their athletics skills enable them to navigate difficult terrain with ease, making them formidable opponents in any environment.

additionals.title: A Day in the Life of a Centaur
additionals.content: A typical day in the life of a Centaur might involve hunting for food or gathering resources for their tribe. They spend much of their time outdoors, using their survival skills to navigate the wilderness. In times of conflict or danger, they may join forces with other creatures or adventurers who share their values.

monster_instances.name: Chimera

actions.name: Multiattack.
actions.description: The chimera makes three attacks: one with its bite, one with its horns, and one with its claws. When its fire breath is available, it can use the breath in place of its bite or horns.

actions.name: Bite.
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit:11 (2d6 + 4) piercing damage.

actions.name: Horns.
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit:10 (1d12 + 4) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Claws.
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) slashing damage.

actions.name: Fire Breath (Recharge 5-6).
actions.description: The dragon head exhales fire in a 15--foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw, taking 31 (7d8) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

monster_instances.description: The Chimera is a fearsome creature of myth and legend, a monstrous fusion of three distinct animals: *a lion*, *a goat*, and *a serpent*. This grotesque amalgamation has been known to terrorize the lands with its **fire-breathing ability**, which it can unleash upon its foes as a devastating 15-foot cone of flame. Its **multiattack** capabilities allow it to inflict significant damage with its **bite**, **horns**, or **claws**. The Chimera's **darkvision** and flight capabilities make it an elusive adversary that can strike from above or from the shadows. Despite its chaotic nature, this creature is not without intelligence, as evidenced by its understanding of Draconic but inability to speak.

additionals.title: Chimera Mythology
additionals.content: The Chimera has been a staple of mythology across many cultures throughout history. It has been depicted as a hybrid of various animals, often including elements such as lions, goats, snakes, dragons, and even birds. These creatures have been used to represent chaos, evil forces or even divine retribution.

additionals.title: Behavioral Traits
additionals.content: Chimeras are solitary creatures by nature but have been known to form temporary alliances with other monstrous creatures for mutual benefit. They are territorial and will fiercely defend their lairs from intruders. They are also known for their cunning and adaptability.

additionals.title: Diet
additionals.content: Chimeras are carnivorous predators that feed on a wide variety of prey. Their diet consists primarily of large mammals such as deer or bison but they have also been known to hunt smaller creatures like rabbits or even scavenge for carrion.

monster_instances.name: Chuul

special_abilities.name: Amphibious
special_abilities.description: The chuul can breathe air and water.

special_abilities.name: Sense Magic
special_abilities.description: The chuul senses magic within 120 feet of it at will. This trait otherwise works like the detect magic spell but isn't itself magical.

monster_instances.languages: understands Deep Speech but can't speak

actions.name: Multiattack.
actions.description: The chuul makes two pincer attacks. If the chuul is grappling a creature, the chuul can also use its tentacles once.

actions.name: Pincer.
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) bludgeoning damage. The target is grappled (escape DC 14) if it is a Large or smaller creature and the chuul doesn’t have two other creatures grappled.

actions.name: Tentacles.
actions.description: One creature grappled by the chuul must succeed on a DC 13 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned for 1 minute. Until this poison ends, the target is paralyzed. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

monster_instances.description:
"*The Chuul, a nightmarish aberration, emerges from the depths of the ocean, its grotesque form a testament to the darkness that lurks beneath the waves. Its body is a mass of writhing tentacles and sharp, hooked pincers, while its eyes glow with an eerie, otherworldly light. The Chuul is a relentless predator, feeding on anything it can capture in its deadly grasp. Driven by an insatiable hunger and a primal instinct to survive, it prowls the ocean depths, leaving a trail of destruction in its wake.*

*The Chuul's tentacles are not only used for attack, but also to entangle and drag its prey into the abyss. Its poisonous touch can paralyze its victims, ensuring a slow and painful death. The Chuul's senses are attuned to the presence of magic, and it is drawn to places where arcane energies are strong. It is a creature of darkness and chaos, thriving in the deepest, most inhospitable corners of the world.*

*The Chuul's lair is a twisted maze of coral and rock, filled with the remains of its past meals. It is a place of terror and despair, where the light of the surface is but a distant memory.*

*The Chuul is a creature of legend, its name whispered in fear by sailors and fishermen alike. It is a symbol of the unknown, a reminder of the dangers that lurk in the depths of the sea.*

additionals.title: Chuul Biology
additionals.content: The Chuul's body is a mass of writhing tentacles and sharp, hooked pincers. Its skin is a thick, rubbery substance that allows it to move freely through the water. Its eyes are large and bulging, with a translucent, gelatinous appearance. The Chuul's tentacles are covered in suction cups, which allow it to cling to surfaces and capture prey. Its blood is a dark, viscous liquid that coagulates quickly when exposed to air.

additionals.title: Habitat and Diet
additionals.content: The Chuul species is native to the deepest, darkest corners of the ocean, where sunlight never penetrates. It feeds on a diet of fish, marine mammals, and other sea creatures. The Chuul is also known to be attracted to places where arcane energies are strong, and it has been known to attack ships and settlements near powerful magical sites.

additionals.title: Interactions with Other Creatures
additionals.content: Almost every Chull is a solitary creature, but it has been known to form temporary alliances with other predators in order to capture larger prey. It is a cunning and ruthless hunter, using its intelligence and senses to outwit its victims. The Chuul is also known to be a formidable opponent in combat, using its tentacles and pincers to entangle and maim its enemies.

monster_instances.name: Cloaker

special_abilities.name: Damage Transfer
special_abilities.description: While attached to a creature, the cloaker takes only half the damage dealt to it (rounded down). and that creature takes the other half.

special_abilities.name: False Appearance
special_abilities.description: While the cloaker remains motionless without its underside exposed, it is indistinguishable from a dark leather cloak.

special_abilities.name: Light Sensitivity
special_abilities.description: While in bright light, the cloaker has disadvantage on attack rolls and Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

actions.name: Multiattack.
actions.description: The cloaker makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its tail.

actions.name: Bite.
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack:+6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit:10 (2d6 + 3) piercing damage, and if the target is Large or smaller, the cloaker attaches to it. If the cloaker has advantage against the target, the cloaker attaches to the target’s head, and the target is blinded and unable to breathe while the cloaker is attached. While attached, the cloaker can make this attack only against the target and has advantage on the attack roll. The cloaker can detach itself by spending 5 feet of its movement. A creature, including the target, can take its action to detach the cloaker by succeeding on a DC 16 Strength check.

actions.name: Tail.
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack:+6 to hit, reach 10 ft., one creature. Hit:7 (1d8 + 3) slashing damage.

actions.name: Moan.
actions.description: Each creature within 60 feet of the cloaker that can hear its moan and that isn’t an aberration must succeed on a DC 13 Wisdom saving throw or become frightened until the end of the cloaker’s next turn. If a creature’s saving throw is successful, the creature is immune to the cloaker’s moan for the next 24 hours

actions.name: Phantasms (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest).
actions.description: The cloaker magically creates three illusory duplicates of itself if it isn’t in bright light. The duplicates move with it and mimic its actions, shifting position so as to make it impossible to track which cloaker is the real one. If the cloaker is ever in an area of bright light, the duplicates disappear. Whenever any creature targets the cloaker with an attack or a harmful spell while a duplicate remains, that creature rolls randomly to determine whether it targets the cloaker or one of the duplicates. A creature is unaffected by this magical effect if it can’t see or if it relies on senses other than sight. A duplicate has the cloaker’s AC and uses its saving throws. If an attack hits a duplicate, or if a duplicate fails a saving throw against an effect that deals damage, the duplicate disappears.

monster_instances.description: The Cloaker, a large aberration creature, is known for its stealthy nature and ability to blend into shadows. Its dark leather cloak-like appearance allows it to easily hide in dimly lit or dark environments, making it nearly invisible to those who aren't paying close attention. This cunning predator uses its False Appearance ability to deceive its prey, making it appear as just another part of the darkness. When it chooses a target, the Cloaker uses its powerful bite and tail attacks to inflict damage on unsuspecting victims. If it manages to attach itself to a creature with advantage on the attack roll, the Cloaker can cause even more devastating damage by using Damage Transfer. This ability allows the Cloaker to take only half of the damage dealt to it while forcing the target creature to take the other half. The Cloaker's chaotic neutral alignment is evident in its unpredictable behavior and desire for chaos and confusion in battle.

additionals.title: Hunting Tactics
additionals.content: The Cloaker is an opportunistic hunter that relies on stealth and surprise attacks to take down its prey. It often lurks in dark corners or hidden alcoves, waiting for an unsuspecting victim to pass by within striking distance. Once it has chosen a target, the Cloaker uses its deadly combination of speed, agility, and powerful attacks to quickly subdue its prey.

additionals.title: Phantasms Ability
additionals.content: The Phantasms ability of the Cloaker adds an extra layer of confusion and chaos during combat. The illusory duplicates created by this ability make it nearly impossible for enemies to determine which is the real Cloaker, allowing it to strike from multiple angles or even escape from danger if needed.

monster_instances.name: Cockatrice

actions.name: Bite.
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 3 (1d4 + 1) piercing damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 11 Constitution saving throw against being magically petrified. On a failed save, the creature begins to turn to stone and is restrained. It must repeat the saving throw at the end of its next turn. On a success, the effect ends. On a failure, the creature is petrified for 24 hours.

monster_instances.description: The Cockatrice, an enigmatic creature shrouded in mystery, is an embodiment of ancient power and danger. Its small size belies its fierce nature, as it possesses the ability to petrify its foes with its deadly gaze. This monstrosity's unaligned alignment suggests that it is neither inherently good nor evil, but rather driven by its own instincts and desires. With a wingspan that allows for swift flight, the Cockatrice is a formidable opponent that can strike quickly and without warning.

additionals.title: The Petrifying Gaze
additionals.content: Legend has it that the Cockatrice's gaze can turn stone to flesh and flesh to stone. While this ability is not fully realized in its current encounter, it serves as a reminder of the creature's mythical origins and potential for greater power.

additionals.title: The Serpent's Tail
additionals.content: The serpentine tail of the Cockatrice is said to be venomous, capable of inflicting deadly poison upon those who dare to approach too closely. Although this encounter does not include this aspect of the creature's lore, it adds depth to its character and hints at the dangers that may lie hidden beneath its surface.

additionals.title: The Egg of Transformation
additionals.content: In some tales, the egg laid by a Cockatrice can bring about great change or even catastrophe. While not mentioned in this encounter, this element adds another layer to the creature's lore and invites further exploration into its mythology.

monster_instances.name: Couatl

special_abilities.name: Innate Spellcasting
special_abilities.description:
The couatl's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 14). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring only verbal components:

At will: detect evil and good, detect magic, detect thoughts
3/day each: bless, create food and water, cure wounds, lesser restoration, protection from poison, sanctuary, shield
1/day each: dream, greater restoration, scrying

special_abilities.name: Magic Weapons
special_abilities.description: The couatl's weapon attacks are magical.

special_abilities.name: Shielded Mind
special_abilities.description: The couatl is immune to scrying and to any effect that would sense its emotions, read its thoughts, or detect its location.

actions.name: Bite.
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack:+8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit:8 (1d6 + 5) piercing damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 13 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned for 24 hours. Until this poison ends, the target is unconscious. Another creature can use an action to shake the target awake.

actions.name: Constrict.
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack:+6 to hit, reach 10 ft., one Medium or smaller creature. Hit:10 (2d6 + 3) bludgeoning damage, and the target is grappled (escape DC 15). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained, and the couatl can’t constrict another target.

actions.name: Change Shape.
actions.description: The couatl magically polymorphs into a humanoid or beast that has a challenge rating equal to or less than its own, or back into its true form. It reverts to its true form if it dies. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying is absorbed or borne by the new form (the couatl’s choice). In a new form, the couatl retains its game statistics and ability to speak, but its AC, movement modes, Strength, Dexterity, and other actions are replaced by those of the new form, and it gains any statistics and capabilities (except class features, legendary actions, and lair actions) that the new form has but that it lacks. If the new form has a bite attack, the couatl can use its bite in that form.

monster_instances.damage_immunities: psychic; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical weapons
monster_instances.damage_resistances: radiant
monster_instances.description: The Couatl is a majestic celestial being with a serpentine body and a bird-like head adorned with plumes. Its large, piercing eyes reveal an ancient wisdom that has been passed down through the ages. As a guardian of balance and justice, it uses its powerful bite and constricting abilities to protect the innocent from evil forces. With innate spellcasting abilities, it can detect evil, good, and magic in its surroundings. Its magic weapons deal extra damage to enemies, while its shielded mind grants immunity to scrying and mind-reading effects. The Couatl is also capable of changing shape into various forms, making it a versatile and formidable opponent.

additionals.title: The Guardian of Knowledge
additionals.content: The Couatl is known for its vast knowledge of the world and its ability to detect thoughts. It acts as a beacon of wisdom in times of uncertainty, guiding those who seek truth on their path.

additionals.title: The Celestial Protector
additionals.content: As a celestial being, the Couatl is sworn to protect the balance between good and evil in the world. It roams the lands in search of evil forces that seek to disrupt this balance, using its divine powers to vanquish them and restore harmony.

additionals.title: The Serpentine Sentinel
additionals.content: In times of great strife or when facing overwhelming odds, a Couatl can unleash its divine judgment upon its foes. This powerful ability allows it to strike down multiple enemies at once with its constricting abilities while simultaneously casting powerful spells that can turn the tide of battle in favor of good.

monster_instances.name: Darkmantle

special_abilities.name: Echolocation
special_abilities.description: The darkmantle can't use its blindsight while deafened.

special_abilities.name: False Appearance
special_abilities.description: While the darkmantle remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a cave formation such as a stalactite or stalagmite.

actions.name: Crush.
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) bludgeoning damage, and the darkmantle attaches to the target. If the target is Medium or smaller and the darkmantle has advantage on the attack roll, it attaches by engulfing the target’s head, and the target is also blinded and unable to breathe while the darkmantle is attached in this way.  While attached to the target, the darkmantle can attack no other creature except the target but has advantage on its attack rolls. The darkmantle’s speed also becomes 0, it can’t benefit from any bonus to its speed, and it moves with the target.  A creature can detach the darkmantle by making a successful DC 13 Strength check as an action. On its turn, the darkmantle can detach itself from the target by using 5 feet of movement.

actions.name: Darkness Aura (1/Day).
actions.description: A 15--foot radius of magical darkness extends out from the darkmantle, moves with it, and spreads around corners. The darkness lasts as long as the darkmantle maintains concentration, up to 10 minutes (as if concentrating on a spell). Darkvision can’t penetrate this darkness, and no natural light can illuminate it. If any of the darkness overlaps with an area of light created by a spell of 2nd level or lower, the spell creating the light is dispelled.

monster_instances.description: The Darkmantle is a small creature of monstrosity type with a unique appearance that resembles a cave formation. It has a sleek body that is covered with *_a dark mantle_**, giving it its name. The creature is unaligned in nature, making it a formidable foe for adventurers who may not know its true intentions. The Darkmantle is equipped with an impressive set of abilities that allow it to blend into its surroundings and attack its prey with surprising speed. Its blindsight ability allows it to navigate through darkness with ease, while its echolocation ability enables it to detect any nearby threats. The Darkmantle's false appearance feature makes it almost indistinguishable from a cave formation, allowing it to ambush unsuspecting prey.

additionals.title: Hunting Techniques
additionals.content: The Darkmantle is known for its stealthy hunting techniques that involve using its echolocation ability to navigate through darkness and detect any nearby threats. It uses its false appearance feature to blend into cave formations and ambush unsuspecting prey.

additionals.title: Biology
additionals.content: The Darkmantle has an interesting biology that allows it to survive in harsh environments such as caves. It has developed an echolocation ability that enables it to navigate through darkness with ease.

additionals.title: Social Behavior
additionals.content: The social behavior of the Darkmantle is still not well understood due to their elusive nature. They are known for their solitary existence, making them difficult creatures to study.

monster_instances.name: Balor

special_abilities.name: Death Throes
special_abilities.description: When the balor dies, it explodes, and each creature within 30 feet of it must make a DC 20 Dexterity saving throw, taking 70 (20d6) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The explosion ignites flammable objects in that area that aren't being worn or carried, and it destroys the balor's weapons.

special_abilities.name: Fire Aura
special_abilities.description: At the start of each of the balor's turns, each creature within 5 feet of it takes 10 (3d6) fire damage, and flammable objects in the aura that aren't being worn or carried ignite. A creature that touches the balor or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 10 (3d6) fire damage.

special_abilities.name: Magic Resistance
special_abilities.description: The balor has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

special_abilities.name: Magic Weapons
special_abilities.description: The balor's weapon attacks are magical.

actions.name: Multiattack.
actions.description: The balor makes two attacks: one with its longsword and one with its whip.

actions.name: Longsword.
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +14 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit:21 (3d8 + 8) slashing damage plus 13 (3d8) lightning damage. If the balor scores a critical hit, it rolls damage dice three times, instead of twice.

actions.name: Whip.
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +14 to hit, reach 30 ft., one target. Hit:15 (2d6 + 8) slashing damage plus 10 (3d6) fire damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 20 Strength saving throw or be pulled up to 25 feet toward the balor.

actions.name: Teleport.
actions.description: The balor magically teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, up to 120 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.

monster_instances.damage_resistances: cold, lightning; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical weapons
monster_instances.description: The Balor is a fearsome demonic creature that towers over its foes with its *Huge size*, commanding a presence that instills terror in those who dare to face it. Its **fire-red skin** is scarred with ancient battle marks, while its **golden eyes** burn with an insatiable hunger for destruction. Its **wings** are black as night and powerful enough to carry it swiftly through the skies or across the battlefield.

additionals.title: The Balor's Domain
additionals.content: *The Balor's Domain* is a nightmarish landscape of twisted, charred trees and molten rock. The air crackles with electricity, and the ground trembles with the footsteps of unseen creatures. The Balor rules this desolate realm with an iron fist, its fiery gaze scanning the horizon for any sign of rebellion. The Balor's subjects, a motley crew of demons and undead creatures, cower in fear, knowing that their master's wrath is swift and merciless.

additionals.title: The Balor's Servants
additionals.content: *The Balor's Servants* are a motley crew of demons and undead creatures, each bound to the Balor by a powerful magical bond. These creatures serve the Balor with unquestioning loyalty, performing tasks both great and small. Among the Balor's servants are powerful demons such as succubi and incubi, who use their seductive powers to lure victims into the Balor's clutches. The Balor also commands legions of undead creatures including zombies, skeletons, and even more powerful undead such as liches and vampires. These creatures are relentless in their pursuit of the Balor's enemies, their undead forms allowing them to withstand damage that would fell a mortal.

additionals.title: The Balor's Lair
additionals.content: *The Balor's Lair* is a sprawling subterranean complex carved from the very rock of the earth. The lair is a labyrinth of twisting passages and cavernous chambers each more terrifying than the last. The walls of this lair are slick with blood from past battles fought within its halls; echoes of screams fill every corridor as they have for centuries past.

monster_instances.name: Dretch
monster_instances.languages: Abyssal, telepathy 60 ft. (works only with creatures that understand Abyssal)

actions.name: Multiattack.
actions.description: The dretch makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its claws.

actions.name: Bite.
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +2 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 3 (1d6) piercing damage.

actions.name: Claws.
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +2 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (2d4) slashing damage.

actions.name: Fetid Cloud (1/Day).
actions.description: A 10--foot radius of disgusting green gas extends out from the dretch. The gas spreads around corners, and its area is lightly obscured. It lasts for 1 minute or until a strong wind disperses it. Any creature that starts its turn in that area must succeed on a DC 11 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned until the start of its next turn. While poisoned in this way, the target can take either an action or a bonus action on its turn, not both, and can’t take reactions.

monster_instances.damage_resistances: cold, fire, lightning
monster_instances.description: The Dretch is a small, grotesque demon with a repulsive appearance. Its body is covered in slime, giving off an offensive stench that permeates the air around it. Its mouth is filled with sharp teeth, ready to deliver painful bites to any creature that dares to approach. The Dretch's eyes glow with an eerie green light, reflecting its malevolent nature. Despite its small size, the Dretch is not to be underestimated; it wields two sets of claws that can easily tear through flesh and armor alike. When not engaged in combat, the Dretch lurks in the shadows, waiting for unsuspecting prey to wander into its trap.

additionals.title: Fetid Cloud Tactics
additionals.content: The Dretch's fetid cloud ability can be used strategically to control the battlefield. By releasing the cloud in an enclosed space or near multiple enemies, the Dretch can poison multiple targets at once, weakening them and making them easier to defeat.

additionals.title: Diet
additionals.content: Dretches are carnivorous creatures that feed on living flesh. They are particularly attracted to weakened or injured targets, as their poisonous bite can quickly finish off their prey. However, they are not above scavenging from the corpses of other creatures if food is scarce.

additionals.title: Breeding
additionals.content: Dretches are born from eggs laid by more powerful demons. They reach maturity at around two years old and have an average lifespan of ten years in the Abyss. Although they are capable of some level of independent thought, Dretches are generally subservient to their demonic masters.

monster_instances.name: Glabrezu

special_abilities.name: Innate Spellcasting
special_abilities.description:
The glabrezu's spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save DC 16). The glabrezu can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:
At will: darkness, detect magic, dispel magic
1/day each: confusion, fly, power word stun

special_abilities.name: Magic Resistance
special_abilities.description: The glabrezu has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

actions.name: Multiattack.
actions.description: The glabrezu makes four attacks: two with its pincers and two with its fists. Alternatively, it makes two attacks with its pincers and casts one spell.

actions.name: Pincer.
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit:16 (2d10 + 5) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it is grappled (escape DC 15). The glabrezu has two pincers, each of which can grapple only one target.

actions.name: Fist.
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (2d4 + 2) bludgeoning damage.

monster_instances.damage_resistances: cold, fire, lightning; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical weapons
monster_instances.description: The Glabrezu is a large, demonic creature with a twisted, monstrous appearance. Its body is covered in dark, leathery skin, and it possesses two pairs of razor-sharp pincers and powerful fists. Its eyes burn with an evil glow, reflecting its chaotic nature. The Glabrezu's truesight ability allows it to see through illusions and darkness, making it a formidable foe in the Abyss. As a tormentor, it delights in inflicting pain and suffering on its victims. The Glabrezu's innate spellcasting abilities enable it to cast powerful spells such as darkness and dispel magic to control its surroundings. It is immune to poison and resistant to various types of damage, making it difficult to harm or defeat.

additionals.title: The Abyssal Tormentor
additionals.content: The Glabrezu is one of the most feared creatures in the Abyss. It serves as a tormentor for souls trapped in this hellish realm, inflicting unimaginable pain and suffering upon them. Its primary goal is to break the spirits of these souls, pushing them further into despair and madness.

additionals.title: The Art of Torture
additionals.content: The Glabrezu has mastered the art of torture, using its pincers and fists to inflict agonizing pain on its victims. It relishes in their screams of anguish and will continue to torment them until they are broken or dead.

additionals.title: Master of Darkness
additionals.content: The Glabrezu's innate ability to cast darkness allows it to manipulate its surroundings to its advantage. In battle, it can use this spell to obscure its enemies' vision and prevent them from seeing their allies or their own surroundings. This gives the Glabrezu an edge in combat against those who rely on sight.

monster_instances.name: Hezrou

special_abilities.name: Magic Resistance
special_abilities.description: The hezrou has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

special_abilities.name: Stench
special_abilities.description: Any creature that starts its turn within 10 feet of the hezrou must succeed on a DC 14 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned until the start of its next turn. On a successful saving throw, the creature is immune to the hezrou's stench for 24 hours.

monster_instances.damage_resistances: cold, fire, lightning; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical weapons
monster_instances.description: The Hezrou is a terrifying creature, its twisted form a testament to the darkness that dwells within the Abyss. Its massive frame is covered in blackened scales that seem to emit a constant stench, causing those nearby to choke and retch. The creature's eyes burn with a malevolent fire, reflecting an intelligence that is both cunning and cruel. Its mouth is filled with razor-sharp teeth, ready to tear into its prey with ruthless efficiency. This demonic beast is not only powerful but also cunning, using its stench as a weapon to incapacitate its foes before launching into battle. The Hezrou's very presence instills fear in those who encounter it, sensing the darkness that lies beneath its monstrous exterior.

content.title: The Stench of Corruption
content.content: The Hezrou's foul stench is not just a weapon, but a symbol of the corruption that has taken hold of its soul. This demonic odor permeates the air around it, causing even the strongest to falter and weaken. The stench is so potent that it can taint the very ground it walks upon, leaving a trail of decay and desolation in its wake.

content.title: The Feast of Souls
content.content: The Hezrou is a relentless predator, feeding not only on the flesh of its enemies but also on their very souls. It hunts with a ruthless efficiency, tearing into its prey with razor-sharp teeth and devouring their life force with a hunger that cannot be satiated. The souls it consumes fuel its dark powers, granting it the strength to continue its endless hunt for more.

content.title: The Abyssal Pact
content.content: The Hezrou is bound by a pact with the Abyss, a dark agreement that grants it immense power but also a terrible curse. This pact binds the demon to the Abyss, tying its fate to the eternal struggle between the forces of good and evil. The Hezrou is a harbinger of chaos, a living symbol of the darkness that threatens to consume the world.

monster_instances.name: Marilith

special_abilities.name: Magic Resistance
special_abilities.description: The marilith has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

special_abilities.name: Magic Weapons
special_abilities.description: The marilith's weapon attacks are magical.

special_abilities.name: Reactive
special_abilities.description: The marilith can take one reaction on every turn in combat.

actions.name: Multiattack.
actions.description: The marilith makes seven attacks: six with its longswords and one with its tail.

actions.name: Longsword.
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) slashing damage.

actions.name: Tail.
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 10 ft., one creature. Hit: 15 (2d10 + 4) bludgeoning damage. If the target is Medium or smaller, it is grappled (escape DC 19).
