Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained, the marilith can automatically hit the target with its tail, and the marilith can’t make tail attacks against other targets.

actions.name: Teleport.
actions.description: The marilith magically teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, up to 120 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.

actions.name: Parry.
actions.description: The marilith adds 5 to its AC against one melee attack that would hit it. To do so, the marilith must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

monster_instances.damage_resistances: cold, fire, lightning; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical weapons
monster_instances.description: A *sinister* figure of _evil_, the Marilith is a _nightmare incarnate_ with its _skeletal frame_ covered in _demonic runes_. Its _burning red eyes_ emit a chilling gaze that sends shivers down the spine of any who dare look into them. The Marilith's voice is like a _whisper from hell_, luring its prey into its clutches with promises of power and dominion. With each step it takes, it leaves behind a trail of death and despair, as it hunts down its prey with relentless determination. Its *deadly arsenal* includes six longswords and a tail that can entangle its victims, leaving them helpless in its grasp. The Marilith is not one to be trifled with - it is an embodiment of chaos and destruction, seeking to spread terror wherever it goes.

additionals.title: The Fallen Angels
additionals.content: The Marilith was once an angel, but fell from grace when it succumbed to the lure of power. It now serves as a living reminder of the perils of ambition, a symbol of what happens when even celestial beings become corrupted by their own desires.

additionals.title: Tactical Mastery
additionals.content: The Marilith is not only powerful but also highly intelligent. It uses its teleportation abilities to keep enemies off balance, while its reactive combat style allows it to adapt to changing situations on the fly. This makes it a formidable foe that can turn any battle in its favor.

additionals.title: Soul Harvester
additionals.content: The Marilith feeds on the life force of those it defeats in battle. Each soul it consumes only strengthens its already immense power, making it an even more dangerous adversary.

monster_instances.name: Nalfeshnee

special_abilities.name: Magic Resistance
special_abilities.description: The nalfeshnee has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

actions.name: Multiattack.
actions.description: The nalfeshnee uses Horror Nimbus if it can. It then makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its claws.

actions.name: Bite.
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit:32 (5d10 + 5) piercing damage.

actions.name: Claw.
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit:15 (3d6 + 5) slashing damage.

actions.name: Horror Nimbus (Recharge 5-6).
actions.description: The nalfeshnee magically emits scintillating, multicolored light. Each creature within 15 feet of the nalfeshnee that can see the light must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw or be frightened for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature’s saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the nalfeshnee’s Horror Nimbus for the next 24 hours.

actions.name: Teleport.
actions.description: The nalfeshnee magically teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, up to 120 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.

monster_instances.damage_resistances: cold, fire, lightning; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical weapons
monster_instances.description: The Nalfeshnee is a large, terrifying demon with a twisted form that exudes evil. Its skin is covered in dark, oozing sores that emit an acrid stench. Two pairs of razor-sharp claws extend from its arms, while its massive jaws are lined with jagged teeth. The Nalfeshnee's eyes burn with malevolent intent, reflecting its chaotic evil alignment. As it moves through the battlefield, the air around it crackles with dark energy, a testament to its Magic Resistance and ability to resist various forms of damage.

additionals.title: The Demonic Hordes
additionals.content: The Nalfeshnee is part of an army of demons that serve the forces of chaos and destruction in the Abyss. These creatures are sworn to spread terror and discord wherever they go, seeking to undermine the balance between good and evil in the world.

additionals.title: Fear Tactics
additionals.content: In battle, the Nalfeshnee relies on its Horror Nimbus ability to strike fear into the hearts of its enemies. This power can turn even the bravest warriors into quivering wrecks, leaving them vulnerable to attack.

additionals.title: Tactical Teleportation
additionals.content: The Nalfeshnee's Teleport ability allows it to move quickly around the battlefield and avoid attacks from enemies. This makes it difficult for opponents to target it effectively, giving it an advantage in combat.

monster_instances.name: Quasit

special_abilities.name: Shapechanger
special_abilities.description: The quasit can use its action to polymorph into a beast form that resembles a bat (speed 10 ft. fly 40 ft.), a centipede (40 ft., climb 40 ft.), or a toad (40 ft., swim 40 ft.), or back into its true form . Its statistics are the same in each form, except for the speed changes noted. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed . It reverts to its true form if it dies.

special_abilities.name: Magic Resistance
special_abilities.description: The quasit has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

special_abilities.name: Variant: Familiar
special_abilities.description: The quasit can serve another creature as a familiar, forming a telepathic bond with its willing master. While the two are bonded, the master can sense what the quasit senses as long as they are within 1 mile of each other. While the quasit is within 10 feet of its master, the master shares the quasit's Magic Resistance trait. At any time and for any reason, the quasit can end its service as a familiar, ending the telepathic bond.

actions.name: Claws (Bite in Beast Form).
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d4 + 3) piercing damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 10 Constitution saving throw or take 5 (2d4) poison damage and become poisoned for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

actions.name: Scare (1/Day).
actions.description: One creature of the quasit’s choice within 20 feet of it must succeed on a DC 10 Wisdom saving throw or be frightened for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, with disadvantage if the quasit is within line of sight, ending the effect on itself on a success.

actions.name: Invisibility.
actions.description: The quasit magically turns invisible until it attacks or uses Scare, or until its concentration ends (as if concentrating on a spell). Any equipment the quasit wears or carries is invisible with it.

monster_instances.damage_resistances: cold; fire; lightning; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical weapons
monster_instances.description: The Quasit is a **tiny** fiend demon known for its **shapechanging** abilities. With **darkvision** of 120 feet, it can easily navigate the shadows. Its **stealth** skill is exceptional, making it difficult to detect in its natural environment. In addition to its shapechanging abilities, the Quasit possesses **magic resistance**, giving it an advantage when facing spells and magical effects. It can also serve as a familiar for another creature, forming a telepathic bond that allows them to share sensory experiences. The Quasit's **claws** are deadly, capable of inflicting significant damage, while its **Scare** ability can terrify opponents with ease. Despite its small size, the Quasit is resilient and has several damage resistances.

additionals.title: Beast Forms
additionals.content: The Quasit's shapechanging abilities allow it to assume three different beast forms: a bat, a centipede, or a toad. Each form has unique characteristics that enable it to navigate different terrains with ease.

additionals.title: Familiar Bond
additionals.content: The Quasit's ability to serve as a familiar allows it to form strong bonds with other creatures. This telepathic connection provides valuable information and support.

additionals.title: Tactical Mastery
additionals.content: The Quasit is adept at using its abilities strategically in combat situations.

monster_instances.name: Vrock

special_abilities.name: Magic Resistance
special_abilities.description: The vrock has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

actions.name: Multiattack.
actions.description: The vrock makes two attacks: one with its beak and one with its talons.

actions.name: Beak.
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit:10 (2d6 + 3) piercing damage.

actions.name: Talons.
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit:14 (2d10 + 3) slashing damage.

actions.name: Spores (Recharge 6).
actions.description: A 15--foot--radius cloud of toxic spores extends out from the vrock. The spores spread around corners. Each creature in that area must succeed on a DC 14 Constitution saving throw or become poisoned. While poisoned in this way, a target takes 5 (1d10) poison damage at the start of each of its turns. A target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. Emptying a vial of holy water on the target also ends the effect on it.

actions.name: Stunning Screech (1/Day).
actions.description: The vrock emits a horrific screech. Each creature within 20 feet of it that can hear it and that isn’t a demon must succeed on a DC 14 Constitution saving throw or be stunned until the end of the vrock’s next turn.

monster_instances.damage_resistances: cold, fire, lightning; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical weapons
monster_instances.description: The Vrock is a **fiendish demon** that embodies chaos and destruction. Its *monstrous form* is covered in *shimmering black scales*, with *vicious talons* that are capable of tearing through even the strongest armor. Its *beak* is a wicked weapon, delivering devastating blows with ease. The Vrock's eyes glow with an *evil light*, reflecting its malevolent nature. It is known for its deadly **Spores** attack, which can poison and weaken its foes. The Vrock's **Stunning Screech** can momentarily stun those who hear it, leaving them vulnerable to attack. It is resistant to fire, cold, lightning, as well as bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical weapons.

additionals.title: The Vrock's Origins
additionals.content: The Vrock originates from the Abyssal planes, a realm of chaos and darkness. It was created by powerful demons who sought to bring destruction and terror to the mortal realm. The Vrock serves as one of their primary agents of chaos.

additionals.title: Hunting Strategies
additionals.content: Vrocks are known for their cunning hunting strategies. They use their **Spores** attack to weaken their prey before moving in for the kill with their deadly talons.

additionals.title: Legends of the Vrock
additionals.content: Throughout history, tales of the Vrock have spread fear among mortals. These legends often depict the Vrock as a harbinger of doom, bringing death and destruction wherever it goes.

monster_instances.name: Barbed Devil

special_abilities.name: Barbed Hide
special_abilities.description: At the start of each of its turns, the barbed devil deals 5 (1d10) piercing damage to any creature grappling it.

special_abilities.name: Devil's Sight
special_abilities.description: Magical darkness doesn't impede the devil's darkvision.

special_abilities.name: Magic Resistance
special_abilities.description: The devil has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

actions.name: Multiattack.
actions.description: The devil makes three melee attacks: one with its tail and two with its claws. Alternatively, it can use Hurl Flame twice.

actions.name: Claw.
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage.

actions.name: Tail.
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) piercing damage.

actions.name: Hurl Flame.
actions.description: Ranged Spell Attack: +5 to hit, range 150 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (3d6) fire damage. If the target is a flammable object that isn’t being worn or carried, it also catches fire.

monster_instances.damage_resistances: cold; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical weapons that aren't silvered
monster_instances.description: The Barbed Devil, a malevolent creature of pure evil, is a terrifying sight to behold. Its _scaly_, _jet-black hide_ is covered with _sharp barbs_, which are not only used for defense but also as weapons against its foes. With a **Medium** size, it can move swiftly on its four legs, capable of covering *30 ft.* in just one turn. Its eyes glow with an _intense red hue_, revealing its sinister nature. The devil's **six** limbs are well-muscled and powerful, each equipped with *claws* and a _deadly tail_. The creature's **challenge rating** of **5** indicates that it is no easy prey for adventurers. The Barbed Devil has an impressive set of abilities at its disposal: *Devil's Sight*, *Magic Resistance*, and the ability to deal damage with its *tail* or *claws*. Its **alignment** of **lawful evil** suggests that it follows a strict code but is nonetheless cruel and ruthless.

additionals.title: Barbed Devil Society
additionals.content: The Barbed Devils are known to live in large groups called 'hives'. These hives are led by the most powerful devil among them. They communicate telepathically using their Infernal language. They are fiercely territorial and will defend their territory against any intruders.

additionals.title: Hunt for Souls
additionals.content: The Barbed Devils are relentless hunters who feed on souls of living beings. They use their Hurl Flame ability to strike from a distance before closing in for melee combat with their deadly claws and tail.

additionals.title: Devilish Rituals
additionals.content: During their rituals, Barbed Devils summon other fiends to aid them in their quest for power. These rituals are performed under the cover of darkness or within hidden lairs.

monster_instances.name: Bearded Devil

special_abilities.name: Devil's Sight
special_abilities.description: Magical darkness doesn't impede the devil's darkvision.

special_abilities.name: Magic Resistance
special_abilities.description: The devil has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

special_abilities.name: Steadfast
special_abilities.description: The devil can't be frightened while it can see an allied creature within 30 feet of it.

actions.name: Multiattack.
actions.description: The devil makes two attacks: one with its beard and one with its glaive.

actions.name: Beard.
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit:6 (1d8 + 2) piercing damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 12 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned for 1 minute. While poisoned in this way, the target can’t regain hit points. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

actions.name: Glaive.
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack:+5 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d10 + 3) slashing damage. If the target is a creature other than an undead or a construct, it must succeed on a DC 12 Constitution saving throw or lose 5 (1d10) hit points at the start of each of its turns due to an infernal wound. Each time the devil hits the wounded target with this attack, the damage dealt by the wound increases by 5 (1d10). Any creature can take an action to stanch the wound with a successful DC 12 Wisdom (Medicine) check. The wound also closes if the target receives magical healing.

monster_instances.damage_resistances: cold; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical weapons that aren't silvered
monster_instances.description:
"*Emerging from the shadows, the bearded devil, a fiend both fearsome and cunning, brandishes its glaive, a weapon capable of inflicting wounds that burn with infernal fire.* **Loyalty to their masters and a ruthless pursuit of power define these devils, often serving as enforcers and torturers for powerful demons and other fiends.**

*In a human city, chaos and discord were sown by one such devil, dispatched by a demon lord. Disguised as a beggar, it roamed the streets, a wolf in sheep's clothing.* **Using charm and telepathy, it manipulated and deceived, spreading lies and rumors like a plague. Violence and hatred were incited, friends and allies turned against each other in a dance of mistrust and betrayal.**

*The devil's glaive, a tool of destruction, wounded and killed any who dared to oppose or suspect it, leaving a trail of blood and agony in its wake.* **The devil reveled in its work, finding joy in the pain and suffering it caused. It felt no remorse or pity for its victims, only contempt and amusement.**

*The devil planned to continue its mission, a puppet dancing on the strings of its master, until the city was reduced to ashes or its master called it back.*"

additionals.title: Origin and History
additionals.content: Residing in the **Nine Hells**, the infernal plane of existence ruled by the archdevils, are the bearded devils. These creatures are the twisted reincarnations of mortal souls who, in life, committed acts of violence, cruelty, and betrayal. Condemned to eternal damnation in death, these souls are transformed into bearded devils by the corrupting energies of the Nine Hells. While they retain fragments of their mortal memories and personalities, they are also instilled with a fanatical devotion to their infernal masters and a seething hatred for all other creatures. Constantly striving to prove their worth, they hope to ascend the ranks of devilhood or at least avoid punishment for failure. Bearded devils are known for their rivalry with other devil types, particularly the spined devils, as they compete for resources and glory.

additionals.title: The Devil’s Mark: A Letter
additionals.content:
My dearest father,

 I hope this letter finds you well. I write to you from the city of Delvin, a place I came to seeking adventure and fortune, but have found only horror and despair.

 Father, I have been wounded by a terrible creature, a bearded devil. It attacked me without warning, its wicked glaive inflicting a searing pain in my chest. I managed to escape, but not before it whispered in my mind, 'You are mine now. You will suffer and die, and your soul will be mine.'

 Father, I am afraid. The wound festers, and I grow weaker each day. Healers and priests can do nothing for me. They say the wound is infernal, curable only by magic. But magic is rare and expensive, and I have no money left. I am alone and helpless.

 Father, I beg you, please help me. Please send me some money, or a magic item, or anything that can save me. I don't want to die. I don't want to lose my soul. I don't want to become a devil. Please, father, please.

 Your loving son,

 Rolan

monster_instances.name: Bone Devil

special_abilities.name: Devil's Sight
special_abilities.description: Magical darkness doesn't impede the devil's darkvision.

special_abilities.name: Magic Resistance

actions.name: Multiattack.
actions.description: The devil makes three attacks: two with its claws and one with its sting.

actions.name: Claw.
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d8 + 4) slashing damage.

actions.name: Sting.
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) piercing damage plus 17 (5d6) poison damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 14 Constitution saving throw or become poisoned for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

monster_instances.damage_resistances: cold; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical weapons that aren't silvered
monster_instances.description: The Bone Devil is a terrifying creature that embodies the very essence of evil. Its skeletal form is covered in a layer of blackened bone, giving it a menacing appearance that strikes fear into the hearts of even the bravest warriors. Its eyes burn with a fiery intensity, reflecting its malevolent nature and unquenchable thirst for destruction. The Bone Devil's wings are like those of a bat, but with a twisted, grotesque twist that adds to its horror-inspiring look. Its claws are razor-sharp, capable of tearing through flesh with ease, while its sting delivers a deadly poison that can paralyze its victims. As a fiendish being from the depths of hell, it possesses innate abilities such as Magic Resistance and Devil's Sight, making it a formidable adversary for any adventurer who dares to confront it.

additionals.title: The Bone Devil's Origins
additionals.content: The Bone Devil is said to have been created by powerful necromancers who sought to harness the destructive power of pure evil. These sorcerers conducted dark rituals that bound the souls of wicked mortals to their undead creations. Over time, these beings evolved into the terrifying Bone Devils we know today.

additionals.title: Realm of Torment
additionals.content: Bone Devils are believed to originate from the Abyssal plane known as the Realm of Torment. This nightmarish realm is home to countless fiendish creatures that feed on suffering and misery. The Bone Devil is said to return to this realm when it slays a mortal soul.

additionals.title: Hunting Grounds
additionals.content: Bone Devils are often found lurking in desolate wastelands or haunting battlefields where death and destruction are abundant. They are drawn to places where suffering is rampant and souls are plentiful, making them particularly dangerous adversaries for adventurers who find themselves in such perilous locations.

monster_instances.name: Chain Devil

special_abilities.name: Devil's Sight
special_abilities.description: Magical darkness doesn't impede the devil's darkvision.

special_abilities.name: Magic Resistance
special_abilities.description: The devil has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

actions.name: Multiattack.
actions.description: The devil makes two attacks with its chains.

actions.name: Chain.
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack:+8 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) slashing damage. The target is grappled (escape DC 14) if the devil isn’t already grappling a creature. Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained and takes 7 (2d6) piercing damage at the start of each of its turns.

actions.name: Animate Chains (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest).
actions.description: Up to four chains the devil can see within 60 feet of it magically sprout razor--edged barbs and animate under the devil’s control, provided that the chains aren’t being worn or carried. Each animated chain is an object with AC 20, 20 hit points, resistance to piercing damage, and immunity to psychic and thunder damage. When the devil uses Multiattack on its turn, it can use each animated chain to make one additional chain attack. An animated chain can grapple one creature of its own but can’t make attacks while grappling. An animated chain reverts to its inanimate state if reduced to 0 hit points or if the devil is incapacitated or dies.

actions.name: Unnerving Mask.
actions.description: When a creature the devil can see starts its turn within 30 feet of the devil, the devil can create the illusion that it looks like one of the creature’s departed loved ones or bitter enemies. If the creature can see the devil, it must succeed on a DC 14 Wisdom saving throw or be frightened until the end of its turn.

monster_instances.damage_resistances: cold; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical weapons that aren't silvered
monster_instances.description: The Chain Devil, a sinister fiend with a twisted sense of humor, is a medium-sized creature with a body covered in razor-sharp chains. Its eyes gleam with malicious intent, and it bears an uncanny resemblance to one of its victim's loved ones or enemies. This devil is known for its ability to animate chains and use them as weapons against its foes. It has a natural armor that makes it resistant to most physical attacks, and it can also resist fire and poison damage. The Chain Devil is not easily frightened, but it uses its Unnerving Mask ability to instill fear in others. Its dark sense of humor only adds to its terrifying presence.

additionals.title: The Animated Chains
additionals.content: The Chain Devil's most unique ability is its power to animate chains within a 60-foot radius. These animated chains become objects under the devil's control, each having an AC of 20, 20 hit points, resistance to piercing damage, and immunity to psychic and thunder damage. The devil can use these animated chains in addition to its Multiattack action, making it a formidable foe.

additionals.title: Unnerving Mask
additionals.content: The Chain Devil's Unnerving Mask ability is one of the reasons why it is feared by many. As soon as a creature starts its turn within 30 feet of the devil, the devil can create an illusion that makes the creature believe that the devil looks like one of their departed loved ones or bitter enemies. If the creature can see the devil, they must succeed on a DC 14 Wisdom saving throw or be frightened until the end of their turn.

additionals.title: The Frightening Grasp
additionals.content: When using its Multiattack action, the Chain Devil grapples any creature it hits with one of its chain attacks. Once grappled, the creature must make a DC 14 Strength check to escape or suffer 7 (2d6) piercing damage at the start of each of their turns. This continuous damage not only causes physical harm but also adds psychological torment as they are trapped by this horrifying creature.

monster_instances.name: Erinyes

special_abilities.name: Hellish Weapons
special_abilities.description: The erinyes's weapon attacks are magical and deal an extra 13 (3d8) poison damage on a hit (included in the attacks).

special_abilities.name: Magic Resistance
special_abilities.description: The erinyes has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

actions.name: Multiattack.
actions.description: The erinyes makes three attacks.

actions.name: Longsword.
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d8 + 4) slashing damage, or 9 (1d10 +4) slashing damage if used with two hands, plus 13(3d8) poison damage.

actions.name: Longbow.
actions.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) piercing damage plus 13 (3d8) poison damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 14 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned. The poison lasts until it is removed by the lesser restoration spell or similar magic.

actions.name: Parry.
actions.description: The erinyes adds 4 to its AC against one melee attack that would hit it. To do so, the erinyes must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

monster_instances.damage_resistances: cold; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical weapons that aren't silvered
monster_instances.description: The Erinyes is a terrifying creature of hellish origin, its form a nightmarish fusion of humanoid and demonic features. Its skin is black as pitch, with crimson eyes that burn with an inner fire. Wings of dark smoke flutter behind it, leaving a trail of malevolence in their wake. The Erinyes wields its weapons with deadly precision, its every strike an attempt to drag its foes into the abyss. This fiendish being is relentless in its pursuit of evil, using its powers to spread chaos and suffering wherever it goes. Despite its sinister nature, the Erinyes is a disciplined warrior, following the laws of chaos with unwavering devotion.

additionals.title: The Origin of the Erinyes
additionals.content: The Erinyes are ancient beings, born from the fires of chaos itself. They are the embodiment of vengeance and retribution, created by the primordial forces that shape the world. These fiends are bound by their own dark nature to spread destruction and discord wherever they go, acting as agents of chaos in the mortal realm.

additionals.title: Their role in Hell
additionals.content: In hell, the Erinyes serve as enforcers of chaos, ensuring that no order or structure can take root among the denizens of the underworld. They are feared and respected by their fellow fiends for their unwavering commitment to their cause. The Erinyes are often tasked with hunting down rebellious demons or those who would seek to disrupt the balance between law and chaos.

additionals.title: A Fatal Encounter
additionals.content: An encounter with an Erinyes is a harrowing experience for any adventurer. These creatures are relentless in their pursuit of evil, using their powers to spread chaos and suffering wherever they go. Those who face an Erinyes must be prepared for a brutal battle that will test their resolve and force them to confront their own darkest fears.

monster_instances.name: Horned Devil

special_abilities.name: Devil's Sight
special_abilities.description: Magical darkness doesn't impede the devil's darkvision.

special_abilities.name: Magic Resistance
special_abilities.description: The devil has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

actions.name: Multiattack.
actions.description: The devil makes three melee attacks: two with its fork and one with its tail. It can use Hurl Flame in place of any melee attack.

actions.name: Fork.
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack:+10 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 15 (2d8 + 6) piercing damage.

actions.name: Tail.
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack:+10 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (1d8 + 6) piercing damage. If the target is a creature other than an undead or a construct, it must succeed on a DC 17 Constitution saving throw or lose 10 (3d6) hit points at the start of each of its turns due to an infernal wound. Each time the devil hits the wounded target with this attack, the damage dealt by the wound increases by 10 (3d6). Any creature can take an action to stanch the wound with a successful DC 12 Wisdom (Medicine) check. The wound also closes if the target receives magical healing.

actions.name: Hurl Flame.
actions.description: Ranged Spell Attack:+7 to hit, range 150 ft., one target. Hit:14 (4d6) fire damage. If the target is a flammable object that isn’t being worn or carried, it also catches fire.

monster_instances.damage_resistances: cold; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical weapons that aren't silvered
monster_instances.description:
"*Emerging from the shadows, the horned devil, a fearsome and cunning fiend, brandishes its fork and tail, weapons capable of inflicting wounds that burn with infernal fire.* **Loyalty to their masters and a ruthless pursuit of power define these devils, often serving as enforcers and torturers for powerful demons and other fiends.**

*In a human city, chaos and discord were sown by one such devil, dispatched by a demon lord. Disguised as a noble, it manipulated and deceived, spreading lies and rumors like a plague. Violence and hatred were incited, friends and allies turned against each other in a dance of mistrust and betrayal.* **The devil's fork and tail, tools of destruction, wounded and killed any who dared to oppose or suspect it, leaving a trail of blood and agony in its wake.* **The devil reveled in its work, finding joy in the pain and suffering it caused. It felt no remorse or pity for its victims, only contempt and amusement.**

*The devil planned to continue its mission, a puppet dancing on the strings of its master, until the city was reduced to ashes or its master called it back.*"

additionals.title: Origin and History
additionals.content: Residing in the **Nine Hells**, the infernal plane of existence ruled by the archdevils, are the horned devils. These creatures are the twisted reincarnations of mortal souls who, in life, committed acts of violence, cruelty, and betrayal. Condemned to eternal damnation in death, these souls are transformed into horned devils by the corrupting energies of the Nine Hells. While they retain fragments of their mortal memories and personalities, they are also instilled with a fanatical devotion to their infernal masters and a seething hatred for all other creatures. Constantly striving to prove their worth, they hope to ascend the ranks of devilhood or at least avoid punishment for failure. Horned devils are known for their rivalry with other devil types, particularly the spined devils, as they compete for resources and glory.

additionals.title: The Devil's Hunt: A Tale of Deception
additionals.content: In the city of Eldarath, a horned devil named Zariel infiltrated the highest echelons of society, posing as a nobleman. His true intentions, however, were far from noble. Zariel was sent by a powerful demon lord to sow discord and chaos among the humans, to weaken them and make them easier to control. Using his charm and cunning, Zariel manipulated the city's leaders, driving them to distrust each other and turn on one another. The city was soon plunged into a state of anarchy, with friends and family members turning against each other in a brutal civil war. The death toll mounted, and the city was left in ruins. But Zariel's master was pleased with his work, and rewarded him with a powerful artifact that would further enhance his abilities. And so, the horned devil continued his hunt for souls, leaving a trail of destruction and despair in his wake.

monster_instances.name: Ice Devil
monster_instances.senses: blindsight 60 ft., darkvision 120 ft., passive Perception 12

special_abilities.name: Devil's Sight
special_abilities.description: Magical darkness doesn't impede the devil's darkvision.

special_abilities.name: Magic Resistance
special_abilities.description: The devil has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

actions.name: Multiattack.
actions.description: The devil makes three attacks: one with its bite, one with its claws, and one with its tail.

actions.name: Bite.
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 12 (2d6 + 5) piercing damage plus 10 (3d6) cold damage.

actions.name: Claws.
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (2d4 + 5) slashing damage plus 10 (3d6) cold damage.

actions.name: Tail.
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 12 (2d6 + 5) bludgeoning damage plus 10 (3d6) cold damage.

actions.name: Wall of Ice (Recharge 6).
actions.description: The devil magically forms an opaque wall of ice on a solid surface it can see within 60 feet of it. The wall is 1 foot thick and up to 30 feet long and 10 feet high, or it’s a hemispherical dome up to 20 feet in diameter.  When the wall appears, each creature in its space is pushed out of it by the shortest route. The creature chooses which side of the wall to end up on, unless the creature is incapacitated. The creature then makes a DC 17 Dexterity saving throw, taking 35 (10d6) cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The wall lasts for 1 minute or until the devil is incapacitated or dies. The wall can be damaged and breached; each 10--foot section has AC 5, 30 hit points, vulnerability to fire damage, and immunity to acid, cold, necrotic, poison, and psychic damage. If a section is destroyed, it leaves behind a sheet of frigid air in the space the wall occupied. Whenever a creature finishes moving through the frigid air on a turn, willingly or otherwise, the creature must make a DC 17 Constitution saving throw, taking 17 (5d6) cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The frigid air dissipates when the rest of the wall vanishes.

monster_instances.damage_resistances: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical weapons that aren't silvered
monster_instances.description: The Ice Devil is a **terrifying** creature that exudes a cold aura that can make even the bravest of adventurers shiver with fear. Its large frame is covered in *shimmering ice* scales that seem to ripple with an otherworldly energy. With its piercing red eyes and razor-sharp claws, it looks like it has been carved from ice itself. Its **booming voice** echoes with an air of authority and malice, making it clear that it is not to be trifled with. The Ice Devil's **cold touch** can freeze its enemies solid, making them as brittle as ice sculptures. Its **fiery temper** is matched only by its icy demeanor, making it a formidable opponent in any battle.

content.title: Ice Devil Lore
content.content: The *Ice Devil* is a *fiendish* creature that originates from the *Frozen Hells*, a realm of eternal cold and darkness. They are bound to their *Icy Masters*, who command them to wreak havoc on the mortal realms. The *Ice Devils* are known for their *cold-hearted* nature and their ability to withstand the harshest of conditions. They are often sent as emissaries of their *Icy Masters*, tasked with spreading fear and chaos in the mortal realms. The *Ice Devils* are a symbol of the *Icy Masters*' power and a reminder of the *Frozen Hells*' reach into the mortal world.

content.title: Ice Devil Society
content.content: The *Ice Devil* society is a *hierarchical* and *militaristic* society, with each *Ice Devil* having a specific role within their ranks. The *Ice Devils* are loyal to their *Icy Masters* and follow their commands without question. The *Ice Devils* are organized into *frozen legions*, each led by a *Frost General*. The *Frost Generals* are the *Ice Devils* who have proven their loyalty and strength over time. The *Frost Generals* are responsible for leading their legions in battle and reporting back to the *Icy Masters*. The *Ice Devil* society is a *cold* and *harsh* place, where only the strongest survive.

content.title: Ice Devil Rituals
content.content: The *Ice Devils* have a number of *rituals* that they perform to maintain their *icy* power and loyalty to their *Icy Masters*. One such ritual is the *Frostbite Ritual*, where the *Ice Devil* willingly endures extreme cold to strengthen their *icy* powers. Another ritual is the *Icy Bonding*, where two *Ice Devils* form a *frozen* bond to increase their strength and loyalty to their *Icy Masters*. The *Ice Devils* also perform a *Frostwalking* ritual, which allows them to traverse the *Frozen Hells* with ease. These rituals are an important part of *Ice Devil* society, as they help to maintain their *icy* power and loyalty to their *Icy Masters*.

monster_instances.name: Imp

special_abilities.name: Shapechanger
special_abilities.description: The imp can use its action to polymorph into a beast form that resembles a rat (speed 20 ft.), a raven (20 ft., fly 60 ft.), or a spider (20 ft., climb 20 ft.), or back into its true form. Its statistics are the same in each form, except for the speed changes noted. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

special_abilities.name: Devil's Sight
special_abilities.description: Magical darkness doesn't impede the imp's darkvision.

special_abilities.name: Magic Resistance
special_abilities.description: The imp has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

special_abilities.name: Variant: Familiar
special_abilities.description: The imp can serve another creature as a familiar, forming a telepathic bond with its willing master. While the two are bonded, the master can sense what the quasit senses as long as they are within 1 mile of each other. While the imp is within 10 feet of its master, the master shares the quasit's Magic Resistance trait. At any time and for any reason, the imp can end its service as a familiar, ending the telepathic bond.

monster_instances.damage_resistances: cold; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical/nonsilver weapons
monster_instances.description: The Imp is a cunning and mischievous creature that uses its shapechanging abilities to infiltrate enemy ranks or blend into the shadows. Its small size allows it to move stealthily through tight spaces, while its Magic Resistance makes it difficult for spellcasters to harm it. As a familiar to a powerful being, the Imp is loyal to its master and shares in their knowledge and experiences. Despite its malevolent nature, the Imp can be unpredictable in combat, sometimes choosing to flee rather than engage in direct conflict.

additionals.title: The Art of Deception
additionals.content: The Imp has mastered the art of deception, using its shapechanging abilities to confuse enemies and gain an advantage in combat. It can transform into various creatures such as rats, ravens, or spiders to avoid detection or infiltrate enemy strongholds. The Imp's cunning mind allows it to anticipate the moves of its foes and adapt quickly to any situation.

additionals.title: A Bond of Trust
additionals.content: The relationship between the Imp and its master is one of trust and loyalty. The Imp shares in the knowledge and experiences of its master, gaining wisdom from their time together. In return for their service as a familiar, the Imp provides valuable information to their master about potential threats or opportunities for gain. This bond between the two beings is strong enough to withstand even the most challenging circumstances.

additionals.title: Survival Instincts
additionals.content: Despite its malevolent nature, the Imp has strong survival instincts that sometimes lead it to flee from combat rather than engage directly with enemies. This instinctive behavior can be both a blessing and a curse for the creature; while it helps ensure that the Imp lives long enough to continue serving its master, it also means that it may not always be able to contribute effectively in battles against powerful foes.

monster_instances.name: Lemure

special_abilities.name: Devil's Sight
special_abilities.description: Magical darkness doesn't impede the lemure's darkvision.

special_abilities.name: Hellish Rejuvenation
special_abilities.description: A lemure that dies in the Nine Hells comes back to life with all its hit points in 1d10 days unless it is killed by a good-aligned creature with a bless spell cast on that creature or its remains are sprinkled with holy water.

actions.name: Fist.
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 2 (1d4) bludgeoning damage.

monster_instances.damage_resistances: cold
monster_instances.description: In the dark corners of the Nine Hells, there lies a creature known as a Lemure. With its *_deep crimson skin_* and _sinister_ eyes that seem to pierce through one's soul, it is a sight to behold. The Lemure stands tall at *_5 feet_*, with its _muscular frame_ covered in _chains that seem to be fused into its flesh_. Its _bestial face_ is filled with malice and hatred, while its _sharp horns_ are a clear indication of its evil nature. The Lemure's presence is felt long before it appears, as if it brings with it an _aura of despair_. Its movement is swift and agile, able to move at **15 ft.** per round. It wields its fists with great strength, dealing **2 (1d4)** bludgeoning damage with each strike.

additionals.title: Hellish Rejuvenation
additionals.content: The Lemure possesses an extraordinary ability known as Hellish Rejuvenation. When it dies within the Nine Hells, it does not remain dead for long. After **1d10** days have passed since its demise, it miraculously returns to life with all of its hit points restored. However, this rejuvenation comes at a price: unless the Lemure's remains are destroyed by a good-aligned creature under the effects of the bless spell or doused in holy water before this period elapses, it will return stronger than ever.

additionals.title: A Taste of Hell
additionals.content: Lemures are known for their insatiable appetite for pain and suffering. They feed on negative energy from living beings around them, draining their vitality and sapping their strength. This feeding process can manifest itself as physical symptoms such as fatigue or even more severe conditions like illnesses or injuries that seem to defy natural explanations.

additionals.title: Guardians of Torment
additionals.content: In addition to their role as harbingers of pain and suffering in Hell's darkest realms, Lemures also serve as guards for various demonic lords residing within the Nine Hells. These fiends are fiercely loyal to their masters and will stop at nothing to protect them from any threats or intruders.

monster_instances.name: Pit Fiend

special_abilities.name: Fear Aura
special_abilities.description: Any creature hostile to the pit fiend that starts its turn within 20 feet of the pit fiend must make a DC 21 Wisdom saving throw, unless the pit fiend is incapacitated. On a failed save, the creature is frightened until the start of its next turn. If a creature's saving throw is successful, the creature is immune to the pit fiend's Fear Aura for the next 24 hours.

special_abilities.name: Magic Resistance
special_abilities.description: The pit fiend has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

special_abilities.name: Magic Weapons
special_abilities.description: The pit fiend's weapon attacks are magical.

special_abilities.name: Innate Spellcasting
special_abilities.description:
The pit fiend's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 21). The pit fiend can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:
At will: detect magic, fireball
3/day each: hold monster, wall of fire

actions.name: Multiattack.
actions.description: The pit fiend makes four attacks: one with its bite, one with its claw, one with its mace, and one with its tail.

actions.name: Bite.
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +14 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 22 (4d6 + 8) piercing damage. The target must succeed on a DC 21 Constitution saving throw or become poisoned. While poisoned in this way, the target can’t regain hit points, and it takes 21 (6d6) poison damage at the start of each of its turns. The poisoned target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

actions.name: Claw.
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +14 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit:17 (2d8 + 8) slashing damage.

actions.name: Mace.
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +14 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 15 (2d6 + 8) bludgeoning damage plus 21 (6d6) fire damage.

actions.name: Tail.
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +14 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 24 (3d10 + 8) bludgeoning damage.

monster_instances.damage_resistances: cold; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical weapons that aren't silvered
monster_instances.description: **The Pit Fiend** is an **imposing** _Large_ fiend with **natural armor** that gives it an advantage in *truesight*. Its **Fear Aura** ability is so powerful that any creature hostile to the Pit Fiend within 20 feet must make a DC 21 Wisdom saving throw, or risk being _frightened_. This fiend is no stranger to magic, possessing **Magic Resistance**, which grants it advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects. It can cast spells such as *detect magic* and *fireball* at will, as well as *hold monster* and *wall of fire* three times per day. Its **damage immunities** include fire and poison, while its **damage resistances** include cold; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical weapons that aren't silvered. With a total of 300 hit points, this Pit Fiend is no easy foe.

additionals.title: Hellish Origins
additionals.content: The Pit Fiend hails from the Nine Hells itself, making it a fearsome representative of its home plane. It has been sent to wreak havoc on mortal realms as part of its duty to spread chaos and suffering.

additionals.title: Fiery Wrath
additionals.content: The Pit Fiend's attacks are not to be trifled with. Its bite can poison foes, causing them to take increasing damage each round until they succeed on a DC 21 Constitution saving throw. Its mace attack inflicts devastating damage along with significant fire damage, while its tail delivers brutal bludgeoning damage.

additionals.title: Master Tactician
additionals.content: This fiend is no mere brute; it has innate spellcasting abilities that make it a formidable adversary in any situation. It can use these abilities strategically to gain an edge in combat or manipulate its enemies.

monster_instances.name: Plesiosaurus

special_abilities.name: Hold Breath
special_abilities.description: The plesiosaurus can hold its breath for 1 hour.

actions.name: Bite.
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 14 (3d6 + 4) piercing damage.

monster_instances.description: The Plesiosaurus is a massive, fearsome beast that prowls the depths of the ocean, its large size and powerful frame a testament to its predatory instincts. With a bite as deadly as any land-dwelling predator, this aquatic creature is a force to be reckoned with. Its keen senses allow it to navigate the underwater world with ease, while its Hold Breath ability enables it to stalk its prey for extended periods without revealing its presence. The Plesiosaurus is a formidable predator that strikes with lightning speed and precision, leaving little chance for escape for those who find themselves in its sights.

additionals.title: The Rise of the Plesiosaurus
additionals.content: Long ago, in a time when the world was dominated by dinosaurs, the Plesiosaurus ruled the seas as one of the most feared predators. With its massive size and powerful jaws, it was able to take down even the largest marine creatures with ease. Over time, however, as the world changed and other species rose to prominence, the Plesiosaurus became a relic of a bygone era. Despite this, it continues to lurk in the depths of the ocean, a reminder of a time when it was king.

monster_instances.name: Triceratops

special_abilities.name: Trampling Charge
special_abilities.description: If the triceratops moves at least 20 ft. straight toward a creature and then hits it with a gore attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a DC 13 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone. If the target is prone, the triceratops can make one stomp attack against it as a bonus action.

actions.name: Gore.
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit:24 (4d8 + 6) piercing damage.

actions.name: Stomp.
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack:+9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one prone creature. Hit:22 (3d10 + 6) bludgeoning damage.

monster_instances.description: The Triceratops is a colossal herbivore that roams the prehistoric landscapes in search of vegetation to sustain its massive size. With its three mighty horns and thick, armored hide, it is a formidable sight to behold. The Triceratops' gore attack is a powerful weapon, capable of inflicting devastating damage on its enemies. Its trampling charge further amplifies its destructive potential, allowing it to knock down and trample enemies underfoot. Despite its intimidating appearance, the Triceratops is primarily a herbivore, using its horns for defense rather than offense. However, when threatened or provoked, it can become a fierce and unstoppable force of nature.

additionals.title: The Life of a Triceratops
additionals.content: Triceratops lived during the late Cretaceous period around 68-65 million years ago. They were one of the last non-avian dinosaurs to exist before their extinction event. These massive herbivores grazed on various types of plant life such as ferns, conifers, and fruits. They used their horns for defense against predators like Tyrannosaurus rex.

additionals.title: Habitat and Behavior
additionals.content: Triceratops inhabited what is now North America during their time on Earth. They lived in herds for protection against predators and to increase their chances of finding food. These gentle giants were known for their strong social bonds and cooperative behavior within their groups.

monster_instances.name: Tyrannosaurus Rex

actions.name: Multiattack.
actions.description: The tyrannosaurus makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its tail. It can’t make both attacks against the same target.

actions.name: Bite.
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 10 ft.,one target. Hit:33 (4d12 + 7) piercing damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it is grappled (escape DC 17). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained, and the tyrannosaurus can’t bite another target.

actions.name: Tail.
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit:20 (3d8 + 7) bludgeoning damage.

monster_instances.description: The Tyrannosaurus Rex, commonly known as the T-Rex, is a massive, ferocious beast that roamed the Earth millions of years ago. With its powerful build and fearsome jaws, the T-Rex was the apex predator of its time, capable of taking down any creature that crossed its path. Today, the T-Rex is a symbol of strength and power, often depicted in popular culture as a formidable opponent. Despite its intimidating appearance, the T-Rex is also known for its intelligence, which allowed it to navigate its environment and hunt its prey with precision.

additionals.title: The Roar of the Tyrant
additionals.content: The T-Rex's terrifying roar is a testament to its dominance and power. This deafening sound can strike fear into the hearts of even the bravest of adversaries, and can be heard from miles away. The roar serves multiple purposes - it can intimidate potential threats, communicate with other T-Rex, and rally pack members during a hunt.

additionals.title: Hunting in Packs
additionals.content: Contrary to popular belief, the T-Rex did not always hunt alone. Paleontological evidence suggests that these beasts often hunted in packs, using their combined strength and speed to bring down large prey. The pack would work together, with some T-Rex focusing on the prey's legs while others targeted its head or neck. This cooperative hunting strategy allowed the T-Rex to dominate the food chain and maintain its status as the top predator.

additionals.title: The T-Rex's Environment
additionals.content: The T-Rex lived in a vast, diverse ecosystem teeming with life. This environment provided ample resources for the T-Rex to hunt and thrive. The T-Rex's habitat was filled with lush forests, towering mountains, and vast plains, each offering unique opportunities for the T-Rex to hone its hunting skills and adapt to various challenges.

monster_instances.name: Doppelganger

special_abilities.name: Shapechanger
special_abilities.description: The doppelganger can use its action to polymorph into a Small or Medium humanoid it has seen, or back into its true form. Its statistics, other than its size, are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

special_abilities.name: Ambusher
special_abilities.description: The doppelganger has advantage on attack rolls against any creature it has surprised.

special_abilities.name: Surprise Attack
special_abilities.description: If the doppelganger surprises a creature and hits it with an attack during the first round of combat, the target takes an extra 10 (3d6) damage from the attack.

actions.name: Multiattack.
actions.description: The doppelganger makes two melee attacks.

actions.name: Slam.
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Read Thoughts.
actions.description: The doppelganger magically reads the surface thoughts of one creature within 60 feet of it. The effect can penetrate barriers, but 3 feet of wood or dirt, 2 feet of stone, 2 inches of metal, or a thin sheet of lead blocks it. While the target is in range, the doppelganger can continue reading its thoughts, as long as the doppelganger’s concentration isn’t broken (as if concentrating on a spell). While reading the target’s mind, the doppelganger has advantage on Wisdom (Insight) and Charisma (Deception, Intimidation, and Persuasion) checks against the target.

monster_instances.description: The Doppelganger is a master of deception, able to blend seamlessly into any environment or take on the guise of any humanoid it has seen. Its chameleon-like abilities allow it to infiltrate societies and gather intelligence without detection. This cunning creature is not only a formidable spy but also a dangerous adversary in combat, using surprise attacks and its shapechanging abilities to gain the upper hand. Despite its stealthy nature, the Doppelganger is vulnerable to fire, which can expose its true form and leave it defenseless.

additionals.title: The Art of Deception
additionals.content: The Doppelganger's ability to blend into any environment or take on the guise of any humanoid it has seen is not just a physical transformation but also an art of deception. The creature uses subtle body language, mannerisms, and speech patterns to convincingly impersonate others. Its keen senses allow it to pick up on social cues and adapt accordingly, making it nearly impossible for anyone who doesn't know what they're looking for to detect its true nature.

additionals.title: Infiltrating Society
additionals.content: The Doppelganger's natural talent for deception makes it an excellent spy and infiltrator. It can gather valuable information from within enemy ranks or sabotage operations from within an organization by impersonating key members. The creature is not driven by malice but rather by curiosity and a desire for knowledge, making it a dangerous wild card in any conflict.

additionals.title: A Deadly Foe
additionals.content: When faced with danger or cornered, the Doppelganger reveals its true form and becomes a formidable adversary. Its natural stealth allows it to strike from the shadows or disappear after an attack, making it difficult for enemies to retaliate effectively. The creature uses surprise attacks and ambushes to take down opponents before they even know what hit them, leaving them with little chance of fighting back.

monster_instances.description: The Ancient Black Dragon is a gargantuan force of nature that has roamed the world for centuries. Its scales are as black as the void itself, adorned with intricate patterns that shimmer in the light like ink on water. Its eyes are like pools of molten lava, filled with an ancient wisdom that has seen the rise and fall of empires. This dragon's age has given it immense power and knowledge, but also made it more unpredictable in its actions. It is not just a mindless beast; it is an entity that has experienced countless lifetimes worth of joy and sorrow.

additionals.title: Age-Old Wisdom
additionals.content: The Ancient Black Dragon's vast experience allows it to see through deception and manipulation easily. It can sense when someone is lying or attempting to use trickery against it. However, this wisdom also means that the dragon may have developed certain biases or prejudices based on past experiences.

additionals.title: Ancient Rituals
additionals.content: Throughout its long life, the Ancient Black Dragon has witnessed many changes in the world around it. As such, it may still remember ancient rituals or practices from bygone eras that have long since been forgotten by others.

additionals.title: Eternal Guardian
additionals.content: Despite its chaotic evil alignment, the Ancient Black Dragon may have taken on roles as an eternal guardian over specific territories or treasures throughout its existence.

monster_instances.description: The Adult Black Dragon is a monstrous, Huge creature with a menacing presence. Its scales glisten like obsidian, reflecting the darkest shades of black in the light of the setting sun. This dragon's eyes are cold and calculating, filled with malice and cunning. As a Chaotic Evil creature, it delights in causing chaos and destruction, using its fearsome abilities to terrorize those who cross its path. With a Challenge Rating of 14, this dragon is no mere trifle for adventurers to face; it requires skill, strategy, and teamwork to overcome. The Adult Black Dragon's abilities include Frightful Presence, which can strike fear into the hearts of its enemies; Acid Breath; and powerful melee attacks with its bite, claws, and tail. This dragon is not only a formidable foe but also a symbol of the darker forces that lurk in the world.

additionals.title: The Black Dragon's Lair
additionals.content: The lair of an Adult Black Dragon is a place of darkness and terror. It is often found deep within caves or hidden underground chambers, where it has carved out a domain filled with traps and guarded by minions. The lair is filled with piles of treasure hoarded by the dragon over the centuries, including gold coins, gems, and magical artifacts that catch the light in eerie ways. The air is thick with the smell of sulfur and decaying flesh, as well as the faint scent of acid that lingers in the air from previous battles.

additionals.title: A Clash with an Adult Black Dragon
additionals.content: Facing an Adult Black Dragon is no small feat for even the most experienced adventurers. The dragon's Frightful Presence can strike fear into their hearts before they even engage in battle. Its powerful melee attacks can deliver devastating blows that leave enemies reeling or dead in their tracks. However, this dragon's greatest strength lies in its Acid Breath, which can decimate entire groups of enemies with ease if they fail their saving throws. Adventurers must rely on their wits, strategy, and teamwork to overcome this formidable foe.

additionals.title: The Legacy of Black Dragons
additionals.content: Black Dragons are known for their cunning intelligence and ruthless ambition. They are often driven by a desire for power and wealth that knows no bounds. Their hoards are legendary among adventurers who seek their fortune through treacherous dungeons filled with deadly traps and monstrous guardians. These dragons are not only feared for their destructive capabilities but also for their ability to inspire loyalty in those who serve them or fear them.

monster_instances.name: Young Black Dragon
monster_instances.senses: blindsight 30 ft., darkvision 120 ft., passive Perception 16

special_abilities.name: Amphibious
special_abilities.description: The dragon can breathe air and water.

monster_instances.description: The Young Black Dragon is a fearsome creature, with scales as black as the depths of the ocean. Its eyes are cold and calculating, reflecting the cunning nature of this chaotic beast. Its powerful wings allow it to take to the skies or dive into the water with ease, giving it a significant advantage over many other creatures. The dragon's acidic breath weapon can corrode both flesh and stone, leaving behind a trail of destruction in its wake. Despite its evil nature, the Young Black Dragon is still a young creature, learning and growing in power. It is not yet as powerful as its older brethren, but it is still a formidable foe.

additionals.title: The Dragon's Lair
additionals.content: Young Black Dragons often claim lairs near bodies of water, where they can easily access both land and water for hunting. Their lairs are typically hidden away from prying eyes, with multiple entrances and exits for added security.

additionals.title: Prey
additionals.content: Young Black Dragons have a varied diet, including fish, birds, mammals, and even other dragons if they are smaller or weaker than the Young Black Dragon itself.

additionals.title: A Life's Treasure
additionals.content: Like other dragons, they are known to hoard treasure in their lairs. This treasure often includes items of value that they have taken from their victims or found during their travels.

special_abilities.name: Amphibious
special_abilities.description: The dragon can breathe air and water.

actions.name: Bite.
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d10 + 2) piercing damage plus 2 (1d4) acid damage.

actions.name: Acid Breath (Recharge 5-6).
actions.description: The dragon exhales acid in a 15--foot line that is 5 feet wide. Each creature in that line must make a DC 11 Dexterity saving throw, taking 22 (5d8) acid damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

monster_instances.description:
"*The Black Dragon Wyrmling is a fearsome creature, its scales a lustrous black that seems to absorb light rather than reflect it. Its eyes burn with an inner fire, a reflection of the dragon's innate chaotic nature. Despite its small size for a dragon, this wyrmling is already displaying signs of immense power and cunning.*

*Its wings are still developing, but they promise to be as strong and swift as those of its elder kin. The wyrmling's tail is already a formidable weapon, capable of delivering devastating blows to those who dare approach.*

*The dragon's breath is acidic, corroding not only flesh but also metal and stone. This makes it particularly dangerous in both natural environments and urban settings.*

*Though young, this Black Dragon Wyrmling is already showing signs of intelligence beyond its years. It has been known to observe its prey carefully before striking, waiting for the perfect moment to unleash its deadly breath or swift claws.*

*As it grows older, this wyrmling will become an even greater threat, with its power increasing alongside its size.*"

additionals.title: Dragon's Lair
additionals.content: The lair of a Black Dragon Wyrmling is typically hidden away in remote areas such as dense forests or rocky cliffs. It may also be located near bodies of water if the dragon has not yet fully developed its swimming abilities.

additionals.title: Hunting Strategies
additionals.content: A Black Dragon Wyrling employs a combination of stealth and ambush tactics when hunting prey. It relies heavily on its keen senses and agility to sneak up on unsuspecting victims before launching surprise attacks.

additionals.title: Growth and Development
additionals.content: As the Black Dragon Wyrling matures, it will continue to develop its wings for flight and sharpen its natural predatory instincts. Its acidic breath will also become more potent over time.

Its _ancient eyes_ hold a wealth of knowledge from eons past, making it both a formidable foe and an enigmatic figure in legends. It uses its lightning breath to incinerate any who dare oppose it, striking fear into the hearts of all who witness its mighty roar. In combat, it is cunning and strategic, using its Frightful Presence to instill terror in its enemies before unleashing devastating attacks with its bite and claws.

additionals.title: Draconic Lore
additionals.content: In this section we delve into the history of dragons as seen through the eyes of ancient texts and legends. We explore their origins, their roles in society, their relationships with other creatures, and how they have evolved over time.

additionals.title: Blue Dragon Society
additionals.content: This section provides insight into the social structures of blue dragons. It covers everything from their family dynamics to their political systems and how they interact with other dragon societies.

additionals.title: The Hunt for Ancient Treasures
additionals.content: This section details the exploits of adventurers seeking out ancient treasures guarded by powerful dragons such as our Ancient Blue Dragon.

This magnificent beast is known for its fierce loyalty to its hoard, guarding it with ferocity against all intruders. The dragon's breath is a force to be reckoned with, as it unleashes a torrent of lightning that can strike down even the most hardened warriors. It is said that those who have faced this majestic creature have been forever changed by the experience.

additionals.title: The Blue Dragon's Hoard
additionals.content: The Blue Dragon's hoard is not just a collection of treasures; it represents the culmination of its life experiences and conquests. The dragon carefully selects items that hold sentimental or practical value to it, often incorporating them into its lair or using them as part of its daily routine.

additionals.title: Dragon Lore: The Blue Dragon
additionals.content: In this captivating tale, follow the journey of a young blue dragon as it grows from a hatchling into an Adult Blue Dragon. Discover its trials and tribulations as it navigates the perils of its world, learning valuable lessons about power, friendship, and sacrifice along the way.

additionals.title: The Art of Flight: A Blue Dragon's Perspective
additionals.content: Delve into the mind of a blue dragon as it takes to the skies. Explore how this majestic creature perceives its world from above and how flight has shaped its view on life and strategy.

monster_instances.description: The Young Blue Dragon, with its striking azure scales shimmering in the light, is a breathtaking sight to behold. This dragon is a master of lightning, able to unleash devastating bolts that strike fear into the hearts of its enemies. Despite its youth, it has already established a reputation as a formidable force in the world. The Young Blue Dragon's presence is felt throughout the land, as tales of its exploits spread far and wide.

additionals.title: Draconic Wisdom
additionals.content: The wisdom of dragons is renowned throughout the world. As a young blue dragon, this creature has already begun to accumulate knowledge and experience. Its insights into ancient lore and hidden secrets are invaluable to those who can gain access to them.

additionals.title: The Hunt for Thunderstones
additionals.content: The Young Blue Dragon's breath weapon is fueled by thunderstones, rare gemstones that store the raw power of lightning. These stones are highly sought after by dragons and other magical beings alike. The dragon's insatiable hunger for these stones drives it to hunt down any who possess them or know their whereabouts.

additionals.title: A Symbol of Power
additionals.content: In many cultures, dragons are seen as symbols of power and authority. The presence of a Young Blue Dragon in an area can have significant implications for local politics and social structures. As this dragon grows stronger and more powerful, it may become embroiled in conflicts between kingdoms or factions vying for control.

monster_instances.description: The Blue Dragon Wyrmling is a young but powerful creature of myth and legend. Its scales shimmer with a deep azure hue, reflecting the vast expanse of the sky above. With a keen intellect, this dragon is capable of understanding complex concepts and strategies that far surpass those of its larger counterparts. Its eyes are a piercing blue, filled with wisdom that belies its age. As it grows, it learns to harness its innate magical abilities to control lightning, a testament to its mastery over the elements. This wyrmling is adaptable and resourceful, able to survive in various environments by burrowing underground or taking to the skies on powerful wings.

additionals.title: The Electric Storm
additionals.content: The Blue Dragon Wyrmling possesses an incredible ability to manipulate lightning. This power can be used in various ways: to strike fear into enemies with sudden bursts of energy or as a defensive measure against incoming attacks.

additionals.title: A Mind of Its Own
additionals.content: Despite its youthful appearance, the Blue Dragon Wyrmling is an intelligent being with a keen understanding of its surroundings. It can communicate telepathically with other dragons or even humans if it deems them worthy.

additionals.title: Hunting Strategies

monster_instances.description: The Ancient Green Dragon is a colossal force of nature, its emerald scales shimmering with an otherworldly glow. Its eyes hold the wisdom of centuries, and its roar echoes through the depths of time itself. This gargantuan beast is not only a fearsome warrior but also an intelligent strategist, capable of outwitting even the most cunning of foes. With the ability to breathe both air and water, it can strike from any environment, leaving its enemies always on edge. Its legendary resistance allows it to overcome even the most potent spells and enchantments. The dragon's poison breath is a weapon of mass destruction, capable of laying waste to entire armies with a single exhale. The mere sight of this ancient behemoth instills terror in the hearts of all who dare to face it.

additionals.title: The Ancient Green Dragon's Lair
additionals.content: The lair of an Ancient Green Dragon is a testament to its immense power and cunning. Often hidden deep within treacherous swamps or vast underground caverns, these lairs are filled with traps and illusions designed to ensnare intruders. The dragon's hoard is a treasure trove of gold, jewels, and magical artifacts that have been collected over centuries of conquest and plunder.

additionals.title: Surrounding legends
additionals.content: Throughout history, tales have been passed down from generation to generation about the fearsome Ancient Green Dragon. These legends speak of a creature so powerful that even gods tremble before it. Some believe that these dragons are remnants from a time when magic ruled supreme and that they are destined to return when humanity has forgotten the true power of magic.

additionals.title: The Battle Against an Ancient Green Dragon
additionals.content: Facing an Ancient Green Dragon in battle is a daunting task indeed. The sheer size and strength of this creature make it nearly impossible for even the most skilled warriors to defeat it in melee combat. However, there are strategies that can be employed to gain an advantage over this fearsome foe. By using ranged weapons or magic spells that target the dragon's weak points or exploit its vulnerabilities, heroes may have a chance at besting this mighty adversary.

monster_instances.description:
"*Deep within the heart of a mountain or the depths of a dense forest lies the lair of an **Adult Green Dragon**. Its _lair_ is a place of power and danger, a maze of tunnels and chambers filled with traps and guarded by its minions.*

*The dragon's _hoard_ is not only a testament to its wealth and power but also a reflection of its cunning and resourcefulness, as it has amassed these riches from far and wide using its cunning and strength to outwit and overcome its foes.*

*The dragon's mate is a fierce and cunning creature, a partner in crime who stands by their side as they raise their young.*

*The young dragons are a source of pride for the Adult Green Dragon, _a testament to its strength_ that reminds it of its mortality._*

additionals.title: Hoard of Riches
additionals.content: "The _hoard_ of an Adult Green Dragon is more than just gold, gems, or magical items; it represents centuries of conquest, cunning strategy, hard-won treasure from distant lands. Each piece in this vast collection tells a story - one that whispers tales of ancient battles fought for dominance or treasures plundered from rival dragons. The dragon's lair is filled with piles of gold coins gleaming under dim torchlight; gleaming jewels that catch your eye; enchanted artifacts with arcane runes etched into them. All these treasures are guarded jealously by the dragon itself."

additionals.title: The Green Dragon's Lair
additionals.content: *_The dragon's lair_ isn't just any old cave or den; it's an intricate network of tunnels carved over generations by powerful talons through solid rock. The labyrinthine passages are booby-trapped with deadly snares designed to deter intruders. Every chamber echoes with tales of past battles against rival dragons or adventurers who dared to challenge this mighty beast.*

additionals.title: Dragon Clan Dynamics
additionals.content: *An Adult Green Dragon isn't alone in this vast world; it forms part of a larger family - _a clan_. The dragon has a mate - another fierce creature who shares not only life but also responsibilities like raising their offspring. Together they teach their young about survival tactics, hunting techniques, how to outwit potential threats. And when their offspring grow strong enough? They too join this cycle - continuing the legacy._*
