actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack:+4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit:6 (1d8 + 2) piercing damage, or 11 (2d8 +2) piercing damage while enlarged.

actions.name: Javelin.
actions.description: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30/120 ft., one target. Hit:5 (1d6 + 2)piercing damage, or 9 (2d6 + 2) piercing damage while enlarged.

actions.name: Invisibility (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest).
actions.description: The duergar magically turns invisible until it attacks, casts a spell, or uses its Enlarge, or until its concentration is broken, up to 1 hour (as if concentrating on a spell). Any equipment the duergar wears or carries is invisible with it.

monster_instances.damage_resistances: poison
monster_instances.description:
"*The duergar, a subterranean dwarf, is a master of the dark. With its enlarged form and deadly war pick, it is a formidable adversary in the depths of the earth. Its resilience to poison and illusions, coupled with its sensitivity to sunlight, make it a cunning and resourceful foe. The duergar's language skills in Dwarvish and Undercommon reveal a race that values communication and diplomacy, but when pushed to the edge, they are ruthless and cunning.*

*The duergar's enlargement ability is a testament to its adaptability and resourcefulness. It can use this power to increase its damage output and gain an advantage in combat, but it also reveals a creature that is not afraid to take risks and make the most of its abilities.*

*The duergar's invisibility ability is a powerful tool that allows it to strike from the shadows and disappear before its enemies can react. This ability, combined with its resilience and combat prowess, makes the duergar a formidable opponent in any situation.*

*The duergar's sensitivity to sunlight is a reminder of its subterranean origins and the dangers that lie above ground. This sensitivity, combined with its resilience to other forms of attack, makes the duergar a formidable adversary in the dark and dangerous world it calls home.*

additionals.title: Duergar Society
additionals.content: The duergar are a proud and secretive race, living deep beneath the earth's surface in vast, intricate underground cities. They are skilled miners and engineers, and their cities are a marvel of subterranean architecture. The duergar are a matriarchal society, with women holding the highest positions of power. They are known for their strict code of honor and their loyalty to their kin and their city. The duergar are also known for their love of gold and precious gems, which they use to adorn their weapons and armor. They are a resourceful and cunning race, and they will stop at nothing to protect their cities and their people.

additionals.title: Duergar Cuisine
additionals.content: The duergar diet consists primarily of underground fungi and other subterranean creatures. They are known for their love of spicy foods, and they often use fiery peppers in their cooking. The duergar also have a penchant for sweet foods, and they are particularly fond of honey and chocolate. They are also known for their love of alcoholic beverages, particularly mead and ale. The duergar are a social race, and they often gather in taverns and inns to share stories, sing songs, and enjoy each other's company.

monster_instances.name: Air Elemental

special_abilities.name: Air Form
special_abilities.description: The elemental can enter a hostile creature's space and stop there. It can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

actions.name: Multiattack.
actions.description: The elemental makes two slam attacks.

actions.name: Slam.
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 14 (2d8 + 5) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Whirlwind (Recharge 4-6).
actions.description: Each creature in the elemental’s space must make a DC 13 Strength saving throw. On a failure, a target takes 15 (3d8 + 2) bludgeoning damage and is flung up 20 feet away from the elemental in a random direction and knocked prone. If a thrown target strikes an object, such as a wall or floor, the target takes 3 (1d6) bludgeoning damage for every 10 feet it was thrown. If the target is thrown at another creature, that creature must succeed on a DC 13 Dexterity saving throw or take the same damage and be knocked prone.  If the saving throw is successful, the target takes half the bludgeoning damage and isn’t flung away or knocked prone.

monster_instances.damage_resistances: lightning; thunder; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical weapons
monster_instances.condition_immunities: exhaustion, grappled, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned, prone, restrained, unconscious
monster_instances.description: In the vast expanse of the elemental plane, the *Air Elemental* reigns supreme. Its **swirling form** is a mesmerizing display of raw power, as it dances through the air with a grace that belies its immense strength. This creature is not a mindless force of nature; it possesses a keen awareness of its surroundings and an understanding of its role in maintaining balance within the plane. The **elemental's voice**, while ethereal and faint, carries with it an ancient wisdom that has been passed down through countless generations of air elementals.

additionals.title: The Air Elemental's Role in Maintaining Balance
additionals.content: *The Air Elemental* is not merely a destructive force; it plays a vital role in maintaining balance within the elemental plane. It is responsible for regulating wind patterns and weather phenomena, ensuring that no single element becomes too dominant. Its interactions with other elements are complex and intricate, reflecting the delicate balance that exists within this realm.
additionals.additional_title_example: What lies beyond the Veil of Wind?

additionals.title: The Elemental's Connection to Air
additionals.content: *Air Elementals* are intimately connected to their element. They can manipulate air currents with ease, using them to propel themselves through the sky or to create powerful gusts of wind that can knock even the most sturdy creatures off their feet. This connection also allows them to communicate with other beings of air, sharing knowledge and warnings across great distances.

additionals.title: The Birthplace of Air Elementals
additionals.content: *The Aetherial Nexus*, a realm located at the heart of the elemental plane, serves as the birthplace for all air elementals. Here, they are formed from swirling vortices of pure energy that coalesce into their distinctive shapes. These newborn elementals are then tasked with protecting their home realm from any who would seek to exploit or corrupt it.

additionals.title: The Warrior Spirit of Air Elementals
additionals.content: *Air Elementals* embody a warrior spirit, fiercely defending their home realm from any who would threaten it. They are known for their unyielding determination and fierce loyalty to their brethren, fighting relentlessly against any foes who would seek to disrupt the balance within their realm.

monster_instances.name: Earth Elemental
monster_instances.senses: darkvision 60 ft., tremorsense 60 ft., passive Perception 10

special_abilities.name: Earth Glide
special_abilities.description: The elemental can burrow through nonmagical, unworked earth and stone. While doing so, the elemental doesn't disturb the material it moves through.

special_abilities.name: Siege Monster
special_abilities.description: The elemental deals double damage to objects and structures.

actions.name: Multiattack.
actions.description: The elemental makes two slam attacks.

actions.name: Slam.
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit:14 (2d8 + 5) bludgeoning damage.

monster_instances.damage_resistances: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical weapons
monster_instances.description: The Earth Elemental is a massive elemental being composed of solid rock and dirt. Its body is rough and pitted, with jagged rocks protruding from its surface. Its eyes are dark pits that seem to hold the secrets of the earth itself. The elemental's powerful limbs end in large, stone-like hands that can crush anything in their grasp. Its feet are wide and sturdy, allowing it to burrow through the earth with ease. As it moves, it leaves behind a trail of crushed rock and soil, a testament to its immense strength.

additionals.title: The Earth's Wrath
additionals.content: When an Earth Elemental becomes enraged or feels threatened, it can unleash a devastating attack known as the Earth's Wrath. This attack involves the elemental using its immense strength to create a shockwave that radiates outward from its body, causing massive destruction in all directions.

additionals.title: The Elemental's Burrowing
additionals.content: While burrowing through the earth, the Earth Elemental can sense vibrations and movements within the ground around it. This ability allows it to detect potential threats or prey before they even come into view.

additionals.title: Stone Shape
additionals.content: The Earth Elemental has the innate ability to reshape stone at will. This power allows it to create tunnels or pathways through solid rock or even reform its own body by smoothing out rough edges or adding additional mass as needed.

monster_instances.name: Fire Elemental

special_abilities.name: Fire Form
special_abilities.description: The elemental can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing. A creature that touches the elemental or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 ft. of it takes 5 (1d10) fire damage. In addition, the elemental can enter a hostile creature's space and stop there. The first time it enters a creature's space on a turn, that creature takes 5 (1d10) fire damage and catches fire; until someone takes an action to douse the fire, the creature takes 5 (1d10) fire damage at the start of each of its turns.

special_abilities.name: Illumination
special_abilities.description: The elemental sheds bright light in a 30-foot radius and dim light in an additional 30 ft..

special_abilities.name: Water Susceptibility
special_abilities.description: For every 5 ft. the elemental moves in water, or for every gallon of water splashed on it, it takes 1 cold damage.

actions.name: Multiattack.
actions.description: The elemental makes two touch attacks.

actions.name: Touch.
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) fire damage. If the target is a creature or a flammable object, it ignites. Until a creature takes an action to douse the fire, the target takes 5 (1d10) fire damage at the start of each of its turns.

monster_instances.damage_resistances: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical weapons
monster_instances.condition_immunities: exhaustion, grappled, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned, prone, restrained, unconscious
monster_instances.description: The Fire Elemental is a colossal being of pure elemental fire, its body shimmering with a dancing play of flames. Its *_red_** eyes burn with a fierce intensity, as if they could consume any who dare to look into them. The creature's form is _ethereal_, yet it exudes an air of raw power that is both mesmerizing and terrifying. Its **scorching** touch can ignite anything it comes into contact with, turning its surroundings into a sea of flames in an instant. The Elemental's presence is felt long before it is seen; its heat can be felt from miles away, as if a _blazing_** sun had descended from the heavens to walk among mortals. The Fire Elemental is a force of nature that commands respect and fear alike.

additionals.title: The Dance of Flames
additionals.content: The Fire Elemental moves with an otherworldly grace, its *_flaming_** limbs seemingly defying gravity as they twist and turn with every step. It weaves through the battlefield like a _dancing_** inferno, leaving a trail of destruction in its wake. The Elemental's mastery over fire allows it to control its own form, shifting between solid and gaseous states at will. This ability gives it unprecedented mobility on the battlefield, making it difficult for enemies to predict or counter.

additionals.title: A Beacon in the Dark
additionals.content: The Fire Elemental serves as both a protector and guardian against darkness and chaos. It has been known to appear during times of great need or turmoil, using its **bright** light to dispel shadows and restore hope to those who face despair. In times of darkness, it serves as a beacon for lost souls seeking guidance or refuge from their fears.

additionals.title: The Endless Flame
additionals.content: The Fire Elemental is bound by no mortal constraints; it exists beyond the reach of time itself. Its **eternal** flame burns without relenting, fueled by an internal fire that cannot be extinguished by any means known to mortals. This immortality has led some scholars to speculate that the Elemental may have once been a powerful sorcerer or divine being who sacrificed their mortality for their mastery over fire.

monster_instances.name: Water Elemental

special_abilities.name: Water Form
special_abilities.description: The elemental can enter a hostile creature's space and stop there. It can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

special_abilities.name: Freeze
special_abilities.description: If the elemental takes cold damage, it partially freezes; its speed is reduced by 20 ft. until the end of its next turn.

monster_instances.damage_resistances: acid; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical weapons
monster_instances.condition_immunities: exhaustion, grappled, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned, prone, restrained, unconscious
monster_instances.description: The Water Elemental originates from a realm where water reigns supreme. This realm is a vast, ever-changing landscape of oceans, rivers, and lakes, with waterfalls cascading into the distance and misty clouds of vapor drifting through the sky. The air is cool and refreshing, and the sound of water is a constant, soothing presence. This realm is a place of balance and harmony, where the elements work together in perfect unity.

additionals.title: The Elemental Plane of Water
additionals.content: The Elemental Plane of Water is a realm of infinite possibility. Here, water takes on countless forms, from the tiniest droplet to the mightiest ocean. The plane is a place of constant motion and change, with water flowing and shifting in ways that defy comprehension. It is a realm of power and potential, where the forces of water can be harnessed and wielded by those who understand them.

additionals.title: The Cycle of Rebirth
additionals.content: In the Elemental Plane of Water, there is no death, only a cycle of rebirth. When an elemental's time comes to an end, its essence is returned to the plane, where it is reborn in a new form. This cycle ensures that the plane is always filled with life and energy, and that the elementals within it are always ready to serve their purpose.

monster_instances.name: Drow

special_abilities.name: Fey Ancestry
special_abilities.description: The drow has advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can't put the drow to sleep.

special_abilities.name: Innate Spellcasting
special_abilities.description:
The drow's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 11). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:
At will: dancing lights
1/day each: darkness, faerie fire

special_abilities.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
special_abilities.description: While in sunlight, the drow has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

actions.name: Shortsword.
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit:5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage.

actions.name: Hand Crossbow.
actions.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. Hit:5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 13 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned for 1 hour. If the saving throw fails by 5 or more, the target is also unconscious while poisoned in this way. The target wakes up if it takes damage or if another creature takes an action to shake it awake.

monster_instances.description: The Drow is a member of a race known for their dark skin and predatory nature. They are **Medium** creatures with a **Humanoid (Elf)** subtype. Their *stealth* ability of 4 makes them formidable foes who can navigate the shadows with ease. Their *darkvision* allows them to see even in the darkest corners of the world, giving them an advantage over most other races. Their *sunlight sensitivity* means they must be cautious when venturing out into the light of day. With a **Challenge Rating** of **1/4**, they are not to be underestimated.

additionals.title: Beliefs and Rituals
additionals.content: The Drow are known for their worship of *Vhaeraun*, the god of trickery, deception, and shadows. They believe that strength comes from cunning rather than brute force. Drow society is highly structured, with powerful matriarchs ruling over their clans.

additionals.title: Reproduction and Growth
additionals.content: Drow reproduce through a process called 'crystallization', where eggs are grown in dark chambers until they hatch into fully-formed adults. This process allows Drow society to maintain control over their population.

additionals.title: Historical Sightings
additionals.content: *Underdark*, the subterranean world beneath the surface of many worlds, is home to many Drow settlements. They have been known to venture above ground on occasion, but they are generally wary of sunlight due to their sensitivity.

monster_instances.name: Ettercap

special_abilities.name: Spider Climb
special_abilities.description: The ettercap can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

special_abilities.name: Web Sense
special_abilities.description: While in contact with a web, the ettercap knows the exact location of any other creature in contact with the same web.

special_abilities.name: Web Walker
special_abilities.description: The ettercap ignores movement restrictions caused by webbing.

actions.name: Multiattack.
actions.description: The ettercap makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its claws.

actions.name: Bite.
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 6 (1d8 + 2) piercing damage plus 4 (1d8) poison damage. The target must succeed on a DC 11 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned for 1 minute. The creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

actions.name: Claws.
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (2d4 + 2) slashing damage.

actions.name: Web (Recharge 5-6).
actions.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, range 30/60 ft., one Large or smaller creature. Hit: The creature is restrained by webbing. As an action, the restrained creature can make a DC 11 Strength check, escaping from the webbing on a success. The effect also ends if the webbing is destroyed. The webbing has AC 10, 5 hit points, vulnerability to fire damage, and immunity to bludgeoning, poison, and psychic damage.

monster_instances.description: The Ettercap is a monstrous spider-like creature with a sinister demeanor and an evil alignment. Its body is covered in thick, black fur, with four spindly legs ending in wicked-looking claws. Its eyes glow with a malevolent intelligence, while its fangs drip with venom, ready to strike at any unsuspecting prey. The Ettercap is a master of deception and cunning, using its web-spinning abilities to ensnare victims before delivering a deadly bite filled with potent poison.

additionals.title: The Deadly Dance of the Ettercap
additionals.content: The Ettercap is a master of subterfuge and stealth, using its exceptional climbing skills to navigate the treetops undetected. It stalks its prey from above, weaving intricate webs between branches to ensnare unwary victims. Once it has lured a target into range, it strikes swiftly and mercilessly with its venomous fangs.

additionals.title: The Web of Deceit
additionals.content: Ettercaps are not only skilled hunters but also master manipulators of webs. They use these intricate strands to create complex traps that can ensnare even the most wary adventurer. The Ettercap's Web Sense ability allows it to detect other creatures entangled in these webs, giving it a significant advantage in both hunting and evasion.

additionals.title: The Hidden Lair of the Ettercap
additionals.content: Ettercaps are known for their preference for dark, damp environments such as caves or dense forests. Within these hidden lairs lies a complex network of webs that serve as both shelter and hunting grounds for the cunning creatures. These lairs are also home to their deadly broodlings - young ettercaps still learning the art of hunting.

monster_instances.name: Ettin

special_abilities.name: Two Heads
special_abilities.description: The ettin has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks and on saving throws against being blinded, charmed, deafened, frightened, stunned, and knocked unconscious.

special_abilities.name: Wakeful
special_abilities.description: When one of the ettin's heads is asleep, its other head is awake.

actions.name: Multiattack.
actions.description: The ettin makes two attacks: one with its battleaxe and one with its morningstar.

actions.name: Battleaxe.
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit:14 (2d8 + 5) slashing damage.

actions.name: Morningstar.
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit:14 (2d8 + 5) piercing damage.

monster_instances.description: This chaotic evil giant, known as an Ettin, is a fearsome creature that roams the lands in search of prey. Its two heads, each with their own wicked intentions, give it an advantage in detecting danger and reacting quickly. One head is always awake while the other sleeps, ensuring that this creature remains vigilant at all times. The Ettin wields both a battleaxe and a morningstar with deadly precision, dealing devastating blows to its enemies with each strike.

additionals.title: The Two-Headed Terror
additionals.content: The Ettin's two heads are not only a source of strength but also a symbol of its chaotic nature. Each head has its own personality and desires, often leading to internal conflicts within the creature itself.

additionals.title: The Wakeful Giant
additionals.content: Despite having one head asleep at any given time, the Ettin is never truly restful. Its wakeful nature allows it to react quickly to threats and opportunities alike, making it a formidable adversary in any situation.

additionals.title: The Deadly Weaponsmaster
additionals.content: The Ettin's battleaxe and morningstar are not just weapons; they are extensions of this giant's very soul. The creature has spent countless hours honing these tools of destruction, turning them into deadly instruments of chaos.

monster_instances.name: Shrieker
monster_instances.senses: blindsight 30 ft. (blind beyond this radius), passive Perception 6

special_abilities.name: False Appearance
special_abilities.description: While the shrieker remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from an ordinary fungus.

monster_instances.description:
"*The Shrieker is a grotesque plant creature that resembles a large fungus with a gaping maw in the center. Its body is covered in writhing tendrils that end in sharp spines, ready to impale any creature that comes too close. The Shrieker's true form is hidden by its false appearance, which makes it indistinguishable from an ordinary fungus until it attacks.*

*The Shrieker's primary ability is its shriek, which can deafen and frighten any creature within range. Its blindsight allows it to detect prey even when it cannot see them. Despite its frightening appearance and abilities, the Shrieker has no real offensive capabilities beyond its shriek.*

*The Shrieker is unaligned and has no known interactions with other creatures beyond defending itself when threatened.*

additionals.title: Shrieker Biology
additionals.content: The Shrieker is a plant-based creature that relies on spores for reproduction. It feeds on nutrients from the soil around it and can absorb moisture from the air through its tendrils. Its body is covered in chitinous plates that provide some protection against physical attacks.

additionals.title: Habitat and Diet
additionals.content: The Shrieker can be found in dark, damp environments such as caves or underground tunnels. It feeds on decaying organic matter and can also absorb nutrients from nearby plants or animals if necessary.

additionals.title: Interactions with Other Creatures
additionals.content: The Shrieker has no known social behaviors or interactions with other creatures beyond defending itself when threatened.

monster_instances.name: Violet Fungus
monster_instances.senses: blindsight 30 ft. (blind beyond this radius), passive Perception 6

special_abilities.name: False Appearance
special_abilities.description: While the violet fungus remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from an ordinary fungus.

actions.name: Multiattack.
actions.description: The fungus makes 1d4 Rotting Touch attacks.

actions.name: Rotting Touch.
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack:+2 to hit, reach 10 ft., one creature. Hit:4 (1d8) necrotic damage.

monster_instances.description: The *Violet Fungus* (_Fungus violetius_), a sinister plant creature known for its deceptive appearance and deadly touch, is a **terrifying** presence in the darkest corners of the forest. This *medium-sized* organism appears as a cluster of violet mushrooms growing from a central stalk. Its true nature is revealed when it comes into contact with its prey: the mushroom caps **explode**, releasing spores that engulf their victims in a cloud of necrotic energy. The violet fungus's **blindsight** allows it to detect prey even when hidden from sight. Despite its gruesome appearance and lethal abilities, this creature remains an enigma to scholars who study it.

additionals.title: Life Cycle
additionals.content: *The Violet Fungus* begins its life as a tiny spore released into the air by its predecessor. Once landing on a suitable substrate, it starts growing rapidly until it forms a mature organism ready to release new spores.

additionals.title: Habitat
additionals.content: *The Violet Fungus* thrives in dark, damp environments such as caves or dense forests. It can also be found near sources of death or decay where it can feed on organic matter.

additionals.title: Diet
additionals.content: *The Violet Fungus* primarily feeds on organic matter but has developed a taste for living flesh due to its necrotic properties.

monster_instances.name: Gargoyle

special_abilities.name: False Appearance
special_abilities.description: While the gargoyle remains motion less, it is indistinguishable from an inanimate statue.

actions.name: Multiattack.
actions.description: The gargoyle makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its claws.

actions.name: Bite.
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit:5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage.

actions.name: Claws.
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit:5 (1d6 + 2) slashing damage.

monster_instances.damage_resistances: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical weapons that aren't adamantine
monster_instances.description: The *Gargoyle*, a **menacing** _elemental_ creature with a chiseled _stone-like_ appearance, stands tall as a harbinger of chaos. Its **skeletal frame** adorned with intricate details gives it an air of ancient _dignity_. The *Gargoyle*'s **feathered wings** are a stark contrast to its stony exterior, adding to its imposing presence. Its **_burning_ red eyes_** seem to glow with malevolent intent, piercing through the darkness like _flames_. The *Gargoyle* is known for its _unearthly agility_, capable of swiftly navigating through the skies on its powerful wings. Its **_sharp talons_** are coated in _toxic venom_, making even a single scratch from it potentially lethal. As it descends upon its unsuspecting prey or foe, the *Gargoyle*'s shadow casts an ominous figure that chills those who dare to face it.

content.title: The Gargoyle's Origins
content.content: The *Gargoyle* is a creature of ancient lore, its origins shrouded in mystery. Some believe they are the remnants of a long-lost civilization, bound to their stone forms as a punishment for their hubris. Others claim they are the embodiment of vengeful spirits, cursed to roam the skies for all eternity. Regardless of their origin, the *Gargoyle* is a formidable foe, its _stone-like_ body and _feathered wings_ allowing it to move with unmatched agility and speed. Its **_burning_ red eyes_** seem to hold a _malevolent intent_, and its **_sharp talons_** are coated in _toxic venom_, making it a deadly adversary.

content.title: The Stone Guardians
content.content: In ancient times, the *Gargoyle* was known as the 'Stone Guardian', a protector of sacred temples and powerful artifacts. These creatures were summoned by powerful sorcerers to defend their treasures and secrets from those who sought to exploit them. The *Gargoyle*'s _stone-like_ body and _feathered wings_ made it the perfect guardian, able to move swiftly and silently through the skies, watching over its charges with unblinking **_burning_ red eyes_**.

content.title: Legends of the Fallen
content.content: There are many tales of fallen *Gargoyles*, their _stone-like_ bodies crumbling to dust as they succumb to the ravages of time. These legends speak of the *Gargoyle*'s _unearthly agility_, its ability to navigate the skies with ease, and its _toxic venom_-coated **_sharp talons_** that could strike fear into the hearts of even the bravest warriors. These stories serve as a reminder of the *Gargoyle*'s power and the danger it poses to those who cross its path.

monster_instances.name: Djinni

special_abilities.name: Elemental Demise
special_abilities.description: If the djinni dies, its body disintegrates into a warm breeze, leaving behind only equipment the djinni was wearing or carrying.

special_abilities.name: Innate Spellcasting
special_abilities.description:
The djinni's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 17, +9 to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

At will: detect evil and good, detect magic, thunderwave 3/day each: create food and water (can create wine instead of water), tongues, wind walk
1/day each: conjure elemental (air elemental only), creation, gaseous form, invisibility, major image, plane shift

special_abilities.name: Variant: Genie Powers
special_abilities.description:
Genies have a variety of magical capabilities, including spells. A few have even greater powers that allow them to alter their appearance or the nature of reality.

Disguises.
Some genies can veil themselves in illusion to pass as other similarly shaped creatures. Such genies can innately cast the disguise self spell at will, often with a longer duration than is normal for that spell. Mightier genies can cast the true polymorph spell one to three times per day, possibly with a longer duration than normal. Such genies can change only their own shape, but a rare few can use the spell on other creatures and objects as well.
Wishes.
The genie power to grant wishes is legendary among mortals. Only the most potent genies, such as those among the nobility, can do so. A particular genie that has this power can grant one to three wishes to a creature that isn't a genie. Once a genie has granted its limit of wishes, it can't grant wishes again for some amount of time (usually 1 year). and cosmic law dictates that the same genie can expend its limit of wishes on a specific creature only once in that creature's existence.
To be granted a wish, a creature within 60 feet of the genie states a desired effect to it. The genie can then cast the wish spell on the creature's behalf to bring about the effect. Depending on the genie's nature, the genie might try to pervert the intent of the wish by exploiting the wish's poor wording. The perversion of the wording is usually crafted to be to the genie's benefit.

actions.name: Multiattack.
actions.description: The djinni makes three scimitar attacks.

actions.name: Scimitar.
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 12 (2d6 + 5) slashing damage plus 3 (1d6) lightning or thunder damage (djinni’s choice).

actions.name: Create Whirlwind.
actions.description: A 5--foot--radius, 30--foot--tall cylinder of swirling air magically forms on a point the djinni can see within 120 feet of it. The whirlwind lasts as long as the djinni maintains concentration (as if concentrating on a spell). Any creature but the djinni that enters the whirlwind must succeed on a DC 18 Strength saving throw or be restrained by it. The djinni can move the whirlwind up to 60 feet as an action, and creatures restrained by the whirlwind move with it. The whirlwind ends if the djinni loses sight of it. A creature can use its action to free a creature restrained by the whirlwind, including itself, by succeeding on a DC 18 Strength check. If the check succeeds, the creature is no longer restrained and moves to the nearest space outside the whirlwind.

monster_instances.description: The Djinni is a *mystical being*, composed of pure elemental energy, that inhabits the vast expanse of the Elemental Plane. Its body is a *mesmerizing amalgamation* of swirling sand and wind, taking on an ethereal form that defies mortal comprehension. Standing at **9 feet tall**, this powerful creature possesses a muscular build with **chiseled features** that are both fierce and enigmatic. Its eyes glow with an inner fire, reflecting its chaotic good nature. The Djinni's hair is like a storm front, billowing around its head as it moves. It wears nothing but a loose robe that billows around it like smoke. The robe is often adorned with ancient symbols representing its connection to the elemental world.

content.title: Djinni Hierarchy
content.content: The Djinni hierarchy is a complex and intricate system, reflecting the vast diversity of elemental energies that make up the Djinni. At the top of the hierarchy are the *Great Djinn*, who are the oldest and most powerful of their kind. They are followed by the *Majestic Djinn*, who are highly respected and revered for their wisdom and experience. Below them are the *Mortal Djinn*, who are still growing and learning, and finally, the *Elemental Djinn*, who are the youngest and least experienced. Each level of the hierarchy has its own unique responsibilities and duties, and the Djinni work together to maintain balance and harmony within the Elemental Plane.

content.title: Djinni Origins
content.content: The origins of the Djinni can be traced back to the dawn of time, when the world was still young and the Elemental Plane was just beginning to take shape. The Djinni were created by the *Cosmic Forge*, a powerful artifact that harnessed the raw energy of the universe. The Djinni were forged from the very essence of the Elemental Plane, and their creation marked the beginning of a new era of balance and harmony. Over the centuries, the Djinni have evolved and adapted, growing stronger and more powerful as they continue to protect and maintain the balance of the Elemental Plane.

content.title: Djinni Legends
content.content: The Djinni have been the subject of countless legends and tales throughout history, their exploits and adventures passed down through the ages. They are often depicted as powerful and mysterious beings, with the ability to grant wishes and shape reality to their will. The Djinni are known for their wisdom and cunning, and they are often seen as protectors of the innocent and defenders of justice. In many stories, the Djinni are portrayed as noble and selfless heroes, using their powers for the greater good and fighting against evil and corruption. These legends have inspired countless artists, writers, and dreamers, and the Djinni continue to captivate the imagination of people around the world.

monster_instances.name: Efreeti

special_abilities.name: Elemental Demise
special_abilities.description: If the efreeti dies, its body disintegrates in a flash of fire and puff of smoke, leaving behind only equipment the djinni was wearing or carrying.

special_abilities.name: Innate Spellcasting
special_abilities.description:
The efreeti's innate spell casting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 15, +7 to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

At will: detect magic
3/day: enlarge/reduce, tongues
1/day each: conjure elemental (fire elemental only), gaseous form, invisibility, major image, plane shift, wall of fire

special_abilities.name: Variant: Genie Powers
special_abilities.description:
Genies have a variety of magical capabilities, including spells. A few have even greater powers that allow them to alter their appearance or the nature of reality.

Disguises.
Some genies can veil themselves in illusion to pass as other similarly shaped creatures. Such genies can innately cast the disguise self spell at will, often with a longer duration than is normal for that spell. Mightier genies can cast the true polymorph spell one to three times per day, possibly with a longer duration than normal. Such genies can change only their own shape, but a rare few can use the spell on other creatures and objects as well.
Wishes.
The genie power to grant wishes is legendary among mortals. Only the most potent genies, such as those among the nobility, can do so. A particular genie that has this power can grant one to three wishes to a creature that isn't a genie. Once a genie has granted its limit of wishes, it can't grant wishes again for some amount of time (usually 1 year). and cosmic law dictates that the same genie can expend its limit of wishes on a specific creature only once in that creature's existence.
To be granted a wish, a creature within 60 feet of the genie states a desired effect to it. The genie can then cast the wish spell on the creature's behalf to bring about the effect. Depending on the genie's nature, the genie might try to pervert the intent of the wish by exploiting the wish's poor wording. The perversion of the wording is usually crafted to be to the genie's benefit.

actions.name: Multiattack.
actions.description: The efreeti makes two scimitar attacks or uses its Hurl Flame twice.

actions.name: Scimitar.
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack:+10 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit:13 (2d6 + 6) slashing damage plus 7 (2d6) fire damage.

actions.name: Hurl Flame.
actions.description: Ranged Spell Attack: +7 to hit, range 120 ft., one target. Hit:17 (5d6) fire damage.

monster_instances.description: The Efreeti is a formidable creature of fire, its body shimmering with a golden glow that seems to dance with every movement. Its large size is deceptive; beneath its muscular frame lies an agility that allows it to move with grace and speed. Its **_scimitar_** is a deadly weapon, its edge glowing with a faint flame as it slices through the air. Its **_hurl flame_** ability is a devastating attack, capable of causing massive damage to its enemies. The Efreeti's **_fire immunity_** allows it to withstand temperatures that would be lethal to most other creatures. Its **_Elemental Demise_** ability ensures that even in death, it remains a threat.

additionals.title: Efreeti Origins
additionals.content: The Efreetti are a race of powerful elemental beings hailing from the Elemental Plane of Fire. They are created from the essence of fire and are bound to their elemental nature, making them fiercely loyal to their elemental masters.

additionals.title: Efreeti Hierarchy
additionals.content: Efreetti society is a complex web of alliances and rivalries, with each Efreetti striving for power and prestige.

additionals.title: Efreeti Legends
additionals.content: Efreetti are the subject of many legends and tales, often depicted as powerful and enigmatic beings.

monster_instances.name: Ghost

special_abilities.name: Ethereal Sight
special_abilities.description: The ghost can see 60 ft. into the Ethereal Plane when it is on the Material Plane, and vice versa.

special_abilities.name: Incorporeal Movement
special_abilities.description: The ghost can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 (1d10) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

monster_instances.languages: any languages it knew in life

actions.name: Withering Touch.
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 17 (4d6 + 3) necrotic damage.

actions.name: Etherealness.
actions.description: The ghost enters the Ethereal Plane from the Material Plane, or vice versa. It is visible on the Material Plane while it is in the Border Ethereal, and vice versa, yet it can’t affect or be affected by anything on the other plane.

actions.name: Horrifying Visage.
actions.description: Each non--undead creature within 60 feet of the ghost that can see it must succeed on a DC 13 Wisdom saving throw or be frightened for 1 minute. If the save fails by 5 or more, the target also ages 1d4 × 10 years. A frightened target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the frightened condition on itself on a success. If a target’s saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the target is immune to this ghost’s Horrifying Visage for the next 24 hours. The aging effect can be reversed with a greater restorationspell, but only within 24 hours of it occurring.

actions.name: Possession (Recharge 6).
actions.description: One humanoid that the ghost can see within 5 feet of it must succeed on a DC 13 Charisma saving throw or be possessed by the ghost; the ghost then disappears, and the target is incapacitated and loses control of its body. The ghost now controls the body but doesn’t deprive the target of awareness. The ghost can’t be targeted by any attack, spell, or other effect, except ones that turn undead, and it retains its alignment, Intelligence, Wisdom, Charisma, and immunity to being charmed and frightened. It otherwise uses the possessed target’s statistics, but doesn’t gain access to the target’s knowledge, class features, or proficiencies. The possession lasts until the body drops to 0 hit points, the ghost ends it as a bonus action, or the ghost is turned or forced out by an effect like the dispel evil and good spell. When the possession ends, the ghost reappears in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the body. The target is immune to this ghost’s Possession for 24 hours after succeeding on the saving throw or after the possession ends.

monster_instances.damage_resistances: acid, fire, lightning, thunder; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical weapons
monster_instances.condition_immunities: charmed, exhaustion, frightened, grappled, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned, prone, restrained
monster_instances.description:
"*A spectral figure, the ghost floats through the air with an eerie grace. Its translucent form reveals a once-human body, marred by the wounds that claimed its life. The ghost's eyes burn with a cold, unnatural light, a testament to its otherworldly nature. Its ethereal form allows it to move through solid objects, leaving a chilling sensation in its wake. The ghost's touch is a harbinger of death, its Withering Touch capable of reducing even the sturdiest of foes to a pile of ash. Its horrifying visage can strike fear into the hearts of the living, causing them to age rapidly or even possessing them if they fail their saving throw. The ghost is a relentless, vengeful spirit, seeking to right the wrongs it suffered in life and punish those who it deems deserving.*

*The ghost's origins are shrouded in mystery, but it is known that they were once living beings who met a tragic end. Whether they were wronged, betrayed, or simply met a violent death, they have become a vengeful spirit, seeking to make others suffer as they did. The ghost's abilities are a testament to its unresolved anger and pain, and it will stop at nothing to achieve its goals.*

*The ghost's ethereal form allows it to move through the world in ways that other creatures cannot. It can traverse the Material and Ethereal planes with ease, leaving its physical form behind and slipping through the cracks of reality. This ability to move between worlds gives the ghost a unique perspective on life and death, and it uses this knowledge to torment those who cross its path.*

*The ghost's Withering Touch is a deadly weapon, capable of reducing even the strongest of foes to a pile of ash. Its ability to age and possess others adds a layer of unpredictability to its attacks, making it a formidable and terrifying opponent.*

*The ghost's existence is a testament to the power of vengeance and the lengths to which the living will go to seek retribution. Its chilling presence serves as a reminder that even after death, the consequences of our actions can haunt us.*

additionals.title: Ghostly Origins
additionals.content: Ghosts are the restless spirits of the deceased, often bound to the Material Plane due to unfinished business, a strong emotional attachment to their former life, or a powerful curse. They are often seen as harbingers of bad luck or omens of impending doom. Despite their ethereal nature, ghosts are still bound by the laws of their former plane and can interact with the physical world in limited ways. Some ghosts are able to move between the Material and Ethereal Planes, using their unique abilities to wreak havoc on the living. These ghosts are often considered the most dangerous, as they can use their knowledge of the world to their advantage and are not bound by the same constraints as their less powerful counterparts.

additionals.title: The Ghost's Lament
additionals.content: The ghost's lament is a haunting melody that can be heard in the darkest corners of the world. It is said that if one listens closely, they can hear the cries of the ghost's former life, a plea for release from its eternal torment. The lament is said to be a powerful tool, capable of driving even the strongest of wills to madness. It is believed that only those with a pure heart can withstand the power of the ghost's lament, and even then, it is a test of one's resolve and strength.

monster_instances.name: Ghast

special_abilities.name: Stench
special_abilities.description: Any creature that starts its turn within 5 ft. of the ghast must succeed on a DC 10 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned until the start of its next turn. On a successful saving throw, the creature is immune to the ghast's Stench for 24 hours.

special_abilities.name: Turn Defiance
special_abilities.description: The ghast and any ghouls within 30 ft. of it have advantage on saving throws against effects that turn undead.

actions.name: Bite.
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 12 (2d8 + 3) piercing damage.

actions.name: Claws.
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) slashing damage. If the target is a creature other than an undead, it must succeed on a DC 10 Constitution saving throw or be paralyzed for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

monster_instances.description: In the darkness of ancient crypts and cursed tombs, *Ghasts* lurk, waiting for unsuspecting souls to torment. These *undead* creatures are a horrifying blend of humanoid and beast, with twisted limbs ending in sharp talons. Their faces are grotesque parodies of humanity, with gaping maws that emit a vile stench capable of paralyzing those who draw too near. The *Ghast*'s body is resistant to necrotic damage, allowing it to withstand attacks that would fell other creatures. It moves with unnatural agility for its size, able to close the distance between itself and its prey with shocking speed. Its bite is poisonous, while its talons can inflict agonizing pain upon those they strike.

additionals.title: The Ghast's Origins
additionals.content: The origins of the Ghast are shrouded in mystery. Some believe they were once mortal beings cursed by powerful necromancers for their defiance against dark magic. Others suggest they are remnants of an ancient race that walked the earth long before humanity rose to prominence. Whatever their origin may be, it is clear that these creatures now serve as agents of terror in the world of the living.

additionals.title: The Ghast's Hunting Grounds
additionals.content: The Ghast is drawn to places where death and decay are abundant. It prefers dark and damp environments such as crypts, tombs, and ruined castles. The stench emanating from their bodies makes them difficult to track in daylight hours; however, at night when their scent blends with the cool air, they become nearly invisible predators.

additionals.title: Surviving an Encounter with a Ghast
additionals.content: Surviving an encounter with a Ghast requires not only physical strength but also mental fortitude. One must first attempt to drive off or incapacitate any ghoul allies before focusing on the ghast itself. The ghast's stench can be overpowering; using items like incense or oils can help mask your scent and prevent paralysis from its claws. Additionally, magical effects such as _Holy Water_ or _Banishment_ may prove useful against this fearsome creature.

monster_instances.name: Ghoul

actions.name: Bite.
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +2 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 9 (2d6 + 2) piercing damage.

actions.name: Claws.
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (2d4 + 2) slashing damage. If the target is a creature other than an elf or undead, it must succeed on a DC 10 Constitution saving throw or be paralyzed for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

monster_instances.description: The Ghoul, a creature of the night, is a vile undead being that feeds on the flesh of the living. Its dark, twisted form is a testament to its chaotic evil nature. Its skin is pale and covered in a thin layer of filth, and its eyes are sunken and filled with a hunger that can never be satisfied. Its claws are sharp and deadly, capable of paralyzing its prey with a single strike. The Ghoul is a creature of the shadows, using its darkvision to navigate the darkness with ease and stalk its prey with ruthless efficiency. It is a relentless predator, driven by its own desires and with no regard for the well-being of others. The Ghoul is a symbol of the darkness that lurks within the hearts of all living beings, a reminder that even the most innocent can be corrupted by the lure of power and the allure of darkness.

additionals.title: Infinite Hunger
additionals.content: The Ghoul's hunger is insatiable. It feeds on the flesh of the living, consuming their life force and gaining strength from their suffering. The Ghoul's paralyzing claws are its most dangerous weapon, capable of immobilizing its prey and making it an easy target for its bite. The Ghoul's darkvision allows it to hunt its prey with ease, even in the darkest corners of the world.

additionals.title: The Ghoul's Transformation
additionals.content: Ghoul are creatures of the night, each one a vile undead being that has been transformed by dark magic. Its transformation began when it was struck by a powerful curse, causing its body to decay and its mind to become twisted and corrupted. The Ghoul's transformation is a slow and painful process, as it loses more and more of its humanity with each passing day. The Ghoul's transformation is a testament to the power of dark magic, and a reminder that even the most innocent can be corrupted by the lure of power and the allure of darkness.

additionals.title: Haunted Lair
additionals.content: The Ghoul's lair is a dark and twisted place, filled with the remains of its past victims. The Ghoul's lair is typically located in a hidden or abandoned area, such as an old graveyard or a forgotten crypt. The Ghoul's lair is a place of darkness and despair, filled with the echoes of its past victims' screams and the stench of decay. The Ghoul's lair is a testament to its chaotic evil nature, a place where the line between life and death is blurred and the darkness reigns supreme.

monster_instances.name: Cloud Giant

special_abilities.name: Keen Smell
special_abilities.description: The giant has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.

special_abilities.name: Innate Spellcasting
special_abilities.description:
The giant's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma. It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

At will: detect magic, fog cloud, light
3/day each: feather fall, fly, misty step, telekinesis
1/day each: control weather, gaseous form

actions.name: Multiattack.
actions.description: The giant makes two morningstar attacks.

actions.name: Morningstar.
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +12 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit:21 (3d8 + 8) piercing damage.

actions.name: Rock.
actions.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +12 to hit, range 60/240 ft., one target. Hit:30 (4d10 + 8) bludgeoning damage.

monster_instances.description:
"*The Cloud Giant is a majestic being of colossal size and immense power. With its towering form reaching up to 20 feet tall, it stands as a symbol of strength and nobility in the skies above. Its skin is a deep blue hue, blending seamlessly with the clouds that surround it. The giant's eyes are a piercing ice blue, reflecting wisdom and experience gained from centuries spent roaming the skies.*

*Its home in the sky is a place of wonder and mystery. It moves through the clouds with ease, using its innate spellcasting abilities to manipulate weather patterns and create powerful storms. The giant's favorite spell is Control Weather, allowing it to shape the environment around it at will.*

*The Cloud Giant is known for its neutrality, often choosing to stay above conflicts rather than becoming involved in them. However, when pushed to defend its territory or those it deems worthy of protection, it becomes an unstoppable force.*

*Its morningstar attacks are swift and deadly, while its rock throwing ability can level entire buildings from great heights.*

*In times of peace, these giants are known to be wise teachers and protectors of their people.*"

content.title: The Cloud Giant's Sanctuary
content.content: The Cloud Giant's Sanctuary is a hidden haven high in the sky, a place of serenity and power. The giant has spent centuries perfecting this sanctuary, a testament to its wisdom and mastery of the elements. The sanctuary is a place of learning and growth, where the giant shares its knowledge with those who seek it. It is also a place of great power, where the giant can call upon the forces of nature to protect its people and its territory.

additionals.title: The Giants' Code: A Legacy of Neutrality

content.title: The Giants' Code: A Legacy of Neutrality
content.content: The Giants' Code is a set of ancient principles that govern the behavior of the Cloud Giants. These principles emphasize neutrality and the importance of maintaining balance in the world. The giants are expected to stay above conflicts and only intervene when their territory or their people are in danger. The code also teaches the giants to be wise and just, using their immense power responsibly and for the benefit of all.

additionals.title: A Tale of Two Giants: The Struggle for Power

content.title: A Tale of Two Giants: The Struggle for Power
content.content: A Tale of Two Giants: The Struggle for Power is a legendary story that has been passed down through generations of Cloud Giants. The story tells of two giants, brothers by birth, who were born with the gift of innate spellcasting. As they grew, they became powerful and influential, their names becoming synonymous with the forces of good and evil. The story follows their journey as they struggle for power, ultimately leading to a climactic battle that would determine the fate of their people and the world.

monster_instances.name: Fire Giant

actions.name: Multiattack.
actions.description: The giant makes two greatsword attacks.

actions.name: Greatsword.
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 28 (6d6 + 7) slashing damage.

actions.name: Rock.
actions.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, range 60/240 ft., one target. Hit: 29 (4d10 + 7) bludgeoning damage.

monster_instances.description:
"*The Fire Giant looms over its foes like a colossal inferno, its skin glowing with an otherworldly heat. Its eyes burn with an inner fire that seems to consume it from within.*

*Hailing from the scorching planes of existence, these giants are born with a connection to the primal forces of flame.*

*They are known for their immense strength and unyielding determination, as well as their mastery of fire magic.*

*Fire Giants are often found at the forefront of their kin's battles, wielding weapons of flame and fury that can incinerate entire armies in a single stroke.*

*Yet beneath this fiery exterior lies a complex being with its own desires and motivations.*

*Their society is built upon ancient traditions and customs that have been passed down through generations.*

*Though they are feared by many, Fire Giants are not without honor. They respect strength and courage in others and are known to form alliances with those who prove themselves worthy.*

*But make no mistake - when provoked or threatened, a Fire Giant's wrath is unleashed like a torrent of fire, leaving nothing but ash in its wake.*

additionals.title: Fire Magic
additionals.content: "The art of fire magic is deeply ingrained in Fire Giant culture. They possess an innate connection to the elemental forces of flame, allowing them to wield its power with devastating effectiveness."

additionals.title: Society and Traditions
additionals.content: "Fire Giants live in secluded communities deep within volcanic regions or other areas where fire reigns supreme. Their society is built upon ancient traditions that emphasize strength, honor, and loyalty."

additionals.title: History and Legends
additionals.content: "Fire Giants have been woven into countless tales throughout history - stories of their mighty deeds echo through time as testaments to their power."

monster_instances.name: Frost Giant

actions.name: Multiattack.
actions.description: The giant makes two greataxe attacks.

actions.name: Greataxe.
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 25 (3d12 + 6) slashing damage.

actions.name: Rock.
actions.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, range 60/240 ft., one target. Hit: 28 (4d10 + 6) bludgeoning damage.

monster_instances.description: In the frozen wastelands of the North, a colossal figure looms over the snow-covered landscape. A *Frost Giant*, this Huge being is a terrifying force of nature, its icy blue skin glistening with frost. Its eyes burn with an inner fire that belies its cold exterior. With each step it takes, the ground trembles under its immense weight. This monstrous giant wields a pair of greataxes with deadly precision, each swing capable of cleaving through even the sturdiest armor. Its roars echo across the tundra, striking fear into the hearts of all who hear them. It is said that these giants are born from ice and snow themselves, and they rule over the frozen realms with an iron fist.

additionals.title: Frost Giant Society
additionals.content: The Frost Giants are an ancient race that once ruled over vast empires in the North. They are known for their imposing size and strength, as well as their unyielding loyalty to one another. In times of peace, they live simple lives in icy caverns or frozen fortresses. However, when war threatens their lands or their kin are threatened, these giants become formidable warriors who strike fear into even the bravest hearts.

additionals.title: Mythology and Legends
additionals.content: In ancient mythology and legends, Frost Giants are often depicted as fearsome beings who challenge even gods themselves. These tales speak of epic battles between gods and giants that shape the very world we know today. These stories serve as reminders of the power and danger inherent in these monstrous beings.

additionals.title: Combat Strategies
additionals.content: Frost Giants are known for their cunning battle tactics that take full advantage of their size and strength. They often use their massive greataxes to strike down enemies from a distance or close quarters. Additionally, they have been known to hurl boulders or other debris at foes from afar or use their immense strength to crush enemies beneath them.

monster_instances.name: Hill Giant

actions.name: Multiattack.
actions.description: The giant makes two greatclub attacks.

actions.name: Greatclub.
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit:18 (3d8 + 5) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Rock.
actions.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, range 60/240 ft., one target. Hit:21 (3d10 + 5) bludgeoning damage.

monster_instances.description: The Hill Giant is a massive, hulking creature that stands tall and imposing with its Huge size. Its muscular frame is covered in coarse, unkempt hair, and its skin is a deep shade of greenish-gray. The giant's eyes are small and beady, but they gleam with a fierce intelligence that belies its chaotic evil alignment. The Hill Giant's language is limited to Giant, but it is known to be proficient in the use of greatclubs and rocks as deadly weapons. When in combat, the giant's strength is unmatched, as it can wield greatclubs with ease and hurl rocks with devastating force.

additionals.title: The Hill Giants' Culture
additionals.content: Hill Giants are known for their ferocity in battle and their chaotic nature. They are a proud and warlike race that values strength above all else. They live in small tribes led by the strongest among them, who is often the most skilled warrior. The tribes are constantly at war with each other over territory and resources, but they also have a deep respect for the natural world around them. They believe that nature is a force to be respected and harnessed, rather than conquered or controlled.

monster_instances.name: Stone Giant

special_abilities.name: Stone Camouflage
special_abilities.description: The giant has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide in rocky terrain.

actions.name: Multiattack.
actions.description: The giant makes two greatclub attacks.

actions.name: Greatclub.
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit:19 (3d8 + 6) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Rock.
actions.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, range 60/240 ft., one target. Hit:28 (4d10 + 6) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 17 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

actions.name: Rock Catching.
actions.description: If a rock or similar object is hurled at the giant, the giant can, with a successful DC 10 Dexterity saving throw, catch the missile and take no bludgeoning damage from it.

monster_instances.description: The **Stone Giant** is a colossal being of immense strength and endurance, its *massive* frame covered in rough-hewn stone armor that appears to have been sculpted by nature itself. Its *deep-set eyes* seem to hold centuries of wisdom, while its *chiseled features* exude an air of ancient power. This giant's **stone camouflage** allows it to blend seamlessly into its surroundings when still or moving with stealthy caution. Its **greatclub** is a formidable weapon, capable of crushing bones with ease. When it throws its **rocks**, it does so with deadly precision, often knocking enemies off their feet or outright shattering them upon impact.

content.title: Ancient Guardians
content.content: The Stone Giants are ancient guardians of the earth, their existence tied to the very rocks and mountains they inhabit. They are the protectors of the natural world, using their immense strength and wisdom to maintain balance and ward off threats. These giants are revered by many as symbols of endurance and resilience, their presence a testament to the unyielding power of nature.

content.title: Stone Giant Society
content.content: The Stone Giants are a solitary and reclusive people, preferring to live in isolation from other races. They are deeply connected to the earth and its elements, and their society is built around the principles of strength, wisdom, and harmony with nature. While they are not a unified society, they share a common bond and respect for one another, often coming together in times of need or crisis to protect their homelands.

content.title: Giants of Stone
content.content: The Giants of Stone are a diverse group, each with their own unique abilities and characteristics. They are known for their immense strength, endurance, and wisdom, as well as their ability to blend seamlessly into their surroundings. While they are often seen as fierce and intimidating, they are also deeply connected to the earth and its elements, and are fiercely protective of their homelands and the natural world.

monster_instances.name: Storm Giant

special_abilities.name: Amphibious

special_abilities.description:
The giant's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 17). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

At will: detect magic, feather fall, levitate, light
3/day each: control weather, water breathing

actions.description: The giant hurls a magical lightning bolt at a point it can see within 500 feet of it. Each creature within 10 feet of that point must make a DC 17 Dexterity saving throw, taking 54 (12d8) lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

monster_instances.damage_resistances: cold
monster_instances.description: The **Storm Giant** is a colossal being of _chaotic good_ alignment. Its towering form is adorned with scales of a deep *cobalt blue*, giving it an appearance of an ancient sea creature. With its massive hands wielding *greatswords*, it can cleave through anything that dares to stand against it. The _Storm Giant_ is not only a fearsome warrior but also a guardian of nature's fury. Its innate ability to cast spells like _detect magic_, _feather fall_, _levitate_, and _light_ showcases its divine connection with the elements. It can even control weather patterns over vast areas, making it a force of nature itself. In times of great peril, this giant stands as a symbol of hope against overwhelming odds.

additionals.title: Beliefs and Rituals
additionals.content: *The Storm Giants* are known for their reverence towards *Stormlord*, the deity who rules over storms and tempests. They perform ritualistic dances during thunderstorms to honor their patron deity. These dances are believed to strengthen the connection between them and Stormlord.

additionals.title: Reproduction and Growth
additionals.content: *Storm Giants* are born from storm clouds that gather over ancient mountains or vast oceans. As they grow, they learn to harness their elemental powers from their surroundings. It takes decades for them to reach their full size and power.

additionals.title: Historical Sightings
additionals.content: *Historical accounts* tell of *Storm Giants* who have fought alongside mortal heroes in times of great need. They have been known to aid in battles against powerful foes such as dragons or demons that threaten entire kingdoms.

monster_instances.name: Gibbering Mouther

special_abilities.name: Aberrant Ground
special_abilities.description: The ground in a 10-foot radius around the mouther is doughlike difficult terrain. Each creature that starts its turn in that area must succeed on a DC 10 Strength saving throw or have its speed reduced to 0 until the start of its next turn.

special_abilities.name: Gibbering
special_abilities.description: The mouther babbles incoherently while it can see any creature and isn't incapacitated. Each creature that starts its turn within 20 feet of the mouther and can hear the gibbering must succeed on a DC 10 Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, the creature can't take reactions until the start of its next turn and rolls a d8 to determine what it does during its turn. On a 1 to 4, the creature does nothing. On a 5 or 6, the creature takes no action or bonus action and uses all its movement to move in a randomly determined direction. On a 7 or 8, the creature makes a melee attack against a randomly determined creature within its reach or does nothing if it can't make such an attack.

actions.name: Multiattack.
actions.description: The gibbering mouther makes one bite attack and, if it can, uses its Blinding Spittle.

actions.name: Bites.
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +2 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit:17 (5d6) piercing damage. If the target is Medium or smaller, it must succeed on a DC 10 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone. If the target is killed by this damage, it is absorbed into the mouther.

actions.name: Blinding Spittle (Recharge 5-6).
actions.description: The mouther spits a chemical glob at a point it can see within 15 feet of it. The glob explodes in a blinding flash of light on impact. Each creature within 5 feet of the flash must succeed on a DC 13 Dexterity saving throw or be blinded until the end of the mouther’s next turn.

monster_instances.description: The Gibbering Mouther is a sinister aberration that lurks in the darkest corners of the world, preying on unsuspecting victims with its grotesque appearance and horrifying abilities. Its body is covered in writhing tendrils that secrete a corrosive spittle capable of blinding its prey. This creature thrives in aquatic environments, using its swim speed to navigate through water with ease. Its doughlike ground ability makes it even more dangerous, as it can entrap its foes and render them helpless. The mouther's gibbering is said to drive those who hear it mad, causing them to act without thought or reason. This creature serves as a constant reminder of the unpredictable dangers that lurk beneath the surface of our world.

additionals.title: The Doughlike Ground
additionals.content: The Gibbering Mouther's doughlike ground ability is both a defensive mechanism and an offensive weapon. By manipulating the terrain around it, this creature can control access to its lair and capture prey within its sticky grasp. The ground's viscous nature makes it difficult for creatures to escape, forcing them to rely on their wits and strength to break free.

additionals.title: Blinding Spittle: A Weapon of Survival
additionals.content: The Gibbering Mouther's blinding spittle serves multiple purposes - as both an offensive attack and a means of survival. When used offensively, this corrosive glob can blind its enemies, leaving them vulnerable to further attacks from the mouther or other nearby creatures. However, when used defensively, this spittle can deter potential threats from approaching too closely.

additionals.title: Echoes of Madness: The Gibbering Mouther's Lament
additionals.content: The gibbering mouther's constant babbling has been interpreted by some scholars as a haunting lament for its lost sanity. As an aberration born from another plane of existence, this creature may be tormented by memories of its past life and driven mad by the vast differences between its home plane and our own. These echoes of madness serve as both a warning and a testament to the power of fear.

monster_instances.name: Gnoll

special_abilities.name: Rampage
special_abilities.description: When the gnoll reduces a creature to 0 hit points with a melee attack on its turn, the gnoll can take a bonus action to move up to half its speed and make a bite attack.

actions.name: Bite.
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) piercing damage.

actions.name: Spear.
actions.description: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2)piercing damage, or 6 (1d8 + 2) piercing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack.

actions.name: Longbow.
actions.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d8 + 1) piercing damage.

monster_instances.description: The Gnoll, a *chaotic evil* creature, is a medium-sized humanoid belonging to the gnoll subtype. It has a **medium** build and is covered in **coarse, dark fur**. Its *yellowed, jagged teeth* are visible even when its mouth is closed, and its *sharp claws* are perfect for tearing flesh. The Gnoll's *evil eyes* seem to *glow with a dark energy*, and its *bestial snarl* is enough to strike fear into the hearts of its enemies. It is known for its *savagery and brutality*, often attacking its prey in a frenzied *rampage*. Its *sharp senses* allow it to detect threats from a distance, and its *agility* makes it a formidable opponent in combat. Despite its ferocity, the Gnoll is also an *intelligent* creature, capable of *strategizing and planning* in order to achieve its goals. Its *bestial cunning* is often underestimated by its enemies, leading to many surprises on the battlefield.

additionals.title: Gnoll Society
additionals.content: The Gnoll society is a complex and often brutal network of *packs*, each led by a *dominant alpha*. These packs are *highly territorial* and will often engage in *violent conflicts* with other packs over territory or resources. The Gnolls are *hunter-gatherers*, relying on their *sharp senses* and *ferocity* to hunt down prey. They are also known for their *cannibalistic tendencies*, often consuming the flesh of their fallen enemies.

additionals.title: Gnoll Rituals and Beliefs
additionals.content: The Gnolls have a *dark and twisted belief system*, often worshipping *evil deities* that align with their *chaotic and violent nature*. They hold *rituals* that involve *sacrifices* and *bloodletting*, which they believe strengthens their connection to their deities and increases their power. The Gnolls are also known for their *superstitions*, often attributing *bad luck* or *curses* to anything that disrupts their pack dynamics or hunting rituals.

additionals.title: Gnoll Language and Communication
additionals.content: The Gnolls communicate using a *guttural and aggressive language*, often *growls* and *snarls* to convey their thoughts and emotions. They are known for their *intimidating vocalizations*, which can strike fear into the hearts of their enemies. The Gnolls are also known for their *unique body language*, using *posturing* and *body movements* to communicate with other members of their pack.

special_abilities.name: Stone Camouflage

special_abilities.name: Gnome Cunning

1/day each: blindness/deafness, blur, disguise self
