Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) piercing damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 12 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

monster_instances.description: The Deep Gnome, or Svirfneblin, is a creature of the underground, a master of the shadows and the darkness. With their stone-colored skin and keen senses, they blend seamlessly into the rocky terrain, becoming almost invisible. They are a neutral good race, known for their cunning and resourcefulness, often relying on their innate magical abilities to survive in the harsh subterranean world.

additionals.title: The Birth of Svirfneblin
additionals.content: Legend has it that the Svirfneblin were born from the earth itself, a result of the fusion of ancient magic and the primordial forces of the world. They are the children of the earth, connected to it on a level that few other races can comprehend.

additionals.title: The Underground Civilization
additionals.content: Svirfneblin society is a complex web of tunnels and caverns, hidden deep beneath the surface of the world. They live in harmony with the earth, using their innate magical abilities to shape and manipulate their environment to their needs. Their cities are a marvel of engineering, with intricate systems of tunnels, chambers, and passageways that stretch for miles.

additionals.title: The Gnomish Cuisine
additionals.content: Despite their small size, Svirfneblin have a hearty appetite. They have developed a unique cuisine based on the resources found in the underground world, with dishes made from fungi, roots, and small creatures. They have an affinity for spices, which they use liberally to add flavor to their dishes.

additionals.title: The Stone Camouflage
additionals.content: Svirfneblin have a natural ability to blend into their surroundings, thanks to their stone-colored skin and keen senses. They use this ability to their advantage in the underground world, often using it to sneak up on prey or avoid detection by potential threats.

additionals.title: The Gnomish Magic
additionals.content: Svirfneblin have a deep connection to the magical energies of the earth. They are known for their innate spellcasting abilities, which they use to protect themselves and their communities from the dangers of the underground world. Their magic is often associated with earth, stone, and shadows.

monster_instances.name: Goblin

special_abilities.name: Nimble Escape
special_abilities.description: The goblin can take the Disengage or Hide action as a bonus action on each of its turns.

actions.name: Scimitar.
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit:5 (1d6 + 2) slashing damage.

actions.name: Shortbow.
actions.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. Hit:5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage.

monster_instances.description: The Goblin is a small but stealthy humanoid creature, belonging to the goblinoid subtype. With a neutral evil alignment, these creatures are known for their cunning tactics and ability to blend into the shadows. Their darkvision allows them to navigate in low-light environments with ease, while their high dexterity and nimble escape ability make them formidable opponents on the battlefield. Goblins are skilled in both melee and ranged combat, wielding scimitars and shortbows with deadly precision. They communicate in both Common and Goblin languages, showcasing their intelligence and adaptability.

additionals.title: The Origins of Goblins
additionals.content: Goblins have a rich history that dates back centuries. They are believed to have originated from a distant land where they were enslaved by a powerful race of beings. Over time, they learned to fight for their freedom and survival, honing their skills in combat and stealth. As they spread across the world, they formed small tribes that lived in harmony with nature but were always ready to defend themselves against threats.

additionals.title: Society
additionals.content: Their society is a complex web of alliances and rivalries between various tribes. They live in underground settlements or hidden forests, where they build simple but functional structures from wood and stone. Their society is governed by a council of elders who make decisions based on the best interests of the tribe. Goblins are known for their cunning tactics in warfare, using hit-and-run strategies to outmaneuver larger forces. Despite their evil alignment, some goblins have been known to form uneasy alliances with other races when it serves their interests.

monster_instances.name: Clay Golem

special_abilities.name: Acid Absorption
special_abilities.description: Whenever the golem is subjected to acid damage, it takes no damage and instead regains a number of hit points equal to the acid damage dealt.

special_abilities.name: Berserk

On each of its turns while berserk, the golem attacks the nearest creature it can see. If no creature is near enough to move to and attack, the golem attacks an object, with preference for an object smaller than itself. Once the golem goes berserk, it continues to do so until it is destroyed or regains all its hit points.

special_abilities.name: Immutable Form
special_abilities.description: The golem is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

special_abilities.name: Magic Resistance
special_abilities.description: The golem has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

special_abilities.name: Magic Weapons
special_abilities.description: The golem's weapon attacks are magical.

actions.name: Multiattack.
actions.description: The golem makes two slam attacks.

actions.name: Slam.
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 16 (2d10 + 5) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or have its hit point maximum reduced by an amount equal to the damage taken. The target dies if this attack reduces its hit point maximum to 0. The reduction lasts until removed by the greater restoration spell or other magic.

actions.name: Haste (Recharge 5-6).
actions.description: Until the end of its next turn, the golem magically gains a +2 bonus to its AC, has advantage on Dexterity saving throws, and can use its slam attack as a bonus action.

monster_instances.description:
"*The Clay Golem is a _massive_ construct of _clay_ and _magic_, standing over 10 feet tall. Its form is reminiscent of a humanoid figure, with muscular limbs ending in powerful hands that end in sharp *slamming* fingers. The golem's face is featureless, except for two glowing _orbs_ that serve as its eyes. Its skin is a mottled grayish color, with streaks of darker clay running through it like veins of metal through stone. The golem's movements are slow but deliberate, its limbs moving with an unsettling fluidity as it stalks its prey.*

*Its *_immutable form_ makes it resistant to most magic and spells, while its _magic resistance_ allows it to shrug off many harmful effects. However, it is vulnerable to acid damage, which it can actually use against its foes due to its *acid absorption* ability.*

*When damaged enough to trigger its *berserk* state, the golem becomes a relentless killing machine that can turn on both friend and foe alike.*

*Its primary weapon is a pair of powerful *slams*, capable of dealing massive bludgeoning damage that can reduce a target's hit point maximum if successful. Its *haste* ability allows it to move quickly and strike with even greater force.*

*Despite its monstrous appearance and destructive capabilities, the Clay Golem remains bound by the orders of its creator. It will not act without clear instructions or provocation.*"

content.title: The Creation Process
content.content: The creation of a Clay Golem is a complex and time-consuming process, requiring the caster to shape a large block of clay into a humanoid form. The caster then imbues the clay with magic, giving it life and sentience. This process is not without its risks, however, as the clay can crack or crumble under the strain of the magic, or even turn on its creator if the spell is not cast with precision. Once created, the golem is bound to its creator by a powerful magical bond, one that transcends the boundaries of life and death. This bond is a double-edged sword, however, as the golem's life is tied to that of its creator. If the creator should fall, the golem's existence may be threatened, and the creature may become uncontrollable, its loyalty to its fallen master driving it to wreak havoc on the world.

content.title: The Golem's Sentience
content.content: The Clay Golem, despite its inanimate appearance, possesses a certain level of sentience. It is not a living being, but it does have a rudimentary form of consciousness, allowing it to understand and react to its environment. This sentience is a result of the magic used to create the golem, which imbues it with a limited form of intelligence and awareness. The golem is not capable of complex thought or emotion, but it can recognize and react to threats, and it can follow simple instructions given to it by its creator. The golem's sentience also allows it to learn and adapt over time, becoming more effective in combat and more efficient in its tasks.

content.title: A History of Destruction
content.content: The Clay Golem has a long and storied history, dating back to the earliest days of magic. These constructs have been used for a variety of purposes, from simple labor tasks to complex military operations. They have been used as guards, soldiers, and even as weapons of mass destruction. Despite their destructive capabilities, the Clay Golem has also been used for more peaceful purposes, such as construction and mining. The golem's ability to withstand immense amounts of damage and its powerful slam attacks make it a formidable force on the battlefield, but its slow movement and lack of agility can make it vulnerable to more nimble opponents. The Clay Golem's history is one of destruction and chaos, but it is also a testament to the power and versatility of magic.

monster_instances.name: Flesh Golem

special_abilities.name: Berserk
special_abilities.description:
Whenever the golem starts its turn with 40 hit points or fewer, roll a d6. On a 6, the golem goes berserk. On each of its turns while berserk, the golem attacks the nearest creature it can see. If no creature is near enough to move to and attack, the golem attacks an object, with preference for an object smaller than itself. Once the golem goes berserk, it continues to do so until it is destroyed or regains all its hit points.
The golem's creator, if within 60 feet of the berserk golem, can try to calm it by speaking firmly and persuasively. The golem must be able to hear its creator, who must take an action to make a DC 15 Charisma (Persuasion) check. If the check succeeds, the golem ceases being berserk. If it takes damage while still at 40 hit points or fewer, the golem might go berserk again.

monster_instances.description: The Flesh Golem is a medium-sized construct with a neutral alignment. Its body is made of flesh and bone, giving it an appearance similar to that of a humanoid creature. However, its lifeless eyes and lack of facial features reveal its true nature as an animated creation. The golem's flesh appears to be stitched together from various sources, hinting at its origins in the realm of necromancy. Despite its grotesque appearance, the Flesh Golem moves with purpose and determination. Its movements are fluid and powerful, reflecting its impressive strength score of 16.

additionals.title: Origins of the Flesh Golem
additionals.content: The Flesh Golem was created by an arcane master seeking the perfect guardian for their lair. The master combined flesh from various creatures with powerful enchantments to bring the golem to life. The result was a creature that was both loyal and terrifyingly powerful. The master trained the golem in combat, honing its skills until it became an unstoppable force.

additionals.title: A Day in the Life
additionals.content: The Flesh Golem's day-to-day life revolves around protecting its creator and their lair. It spends most of its time patrolling the perimeter, searching for intruders or signs of danger. When not on duty, it remains in standby mode near its creator's chamber, ready to spring into action at any moment.

additionals.title: The Berserk State
additionals.content: When the Flesh Golem starts its turn with 40 hit points or fewer, it enters a berserk state. This transformation changes the golem's behavior dramatically, as it becomes focused solely on destruction. In this state, it attacks anything within reach without discrimination or strategy.

additionals.title: Immunities and Vulnerabilities
additionals.content: The Flesh Golem has several immunities that make it difficult to subdue or control. It is immune to poison and has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects due to its Magic Resistance ability. However, it also has vulnerabilities that can be exploited by clever opponents - for example, using nonmagical weapons made of adamantine can deal damage to the golem.

monster_instances.description:
The Iron Golem is a massive construct of iron and steel, standing tall with a formidable presence that instills both fear and awe in those who behold it. Its fire absorption ability makes it a formidable opponent in fiery environments, while its immutable form renders it immune to magical transformations. With magic resistance, it is protected from many enchantments that could potentially harm or control it. This golem was created for a specific purpose - to protect its creator's interests - and is programmed to carry out its duties with unwavering loyalty. Its poison breath can clear entire rooms of enemies with ease, making it a versatile weapon in any battle.

Despite its monstrous appearance, the Iron Golem is not without vulnerability. It is incapable of speech and relies on its creator for guidance, leaving it somewhat dependent on others for communication. Its strength lies in its adherence to its programming and the power of the magic used to create it.

additionals.title: The Origins of Iron Golems
additionals.content: Iron Golems have been created by various civilizations throughout history for diverse purposes. They are often crafted by powerful sorcerers or enchanters who imbue them with magic to serve as protectors or laborers.

additionals.title: The Creation Process
additionals.content: Creating an Iron Golem is an intricate process that requires immense skill and knowledge in both magic and engineering. The process typically involves gathering materials such as iron or steel, shaping them into the desired form, and infusing them with magical energy.

additionals.title: The Purpose of Iron Golems
additionals.content: Iron Golems are often created for specific purposes such as guarding treasures or locations, performing laborious tasks, or even engaging in combat against powerful enemies. Their creators must program them carefully to ensure they fulfill their intended roles effectively.

With powerful slam attacks that can deal devastating damage, the Stone Golem is a force to be reckoned with on the battlefield. However, it is vulnerable to nonmagical weapons that aren't adamantine, making it susceptible to certain attacks. The Stone Golem's origin lies in the mystical arts of its creator, who imbued it with magical abilities that allow it to wield powerful weapons and resist magical effects.

additionals.title: The Creation of the Stone Golem
additionals.content: The Stone Golem was created by an ancient artisan who sought to protect their people from various threats. The artisan used powerful magic and mystical stones to bring the golem to life, infusing it with immense strength and resilience. The golem was programmed with a single purpose: to defend its creators and their homeland from any danger that threatened them.

additionals.title: The Fall of the Artisan
additionals.content: Tragically, the artisan who created the Stone Golem was eventually killed in a great conflict that shook their homeland. With their creator gone, the golem became lost and wandered for centuries until it was discovered by a group of adventurers who sought to harness its power for their own purposes. The adventurers managed to reactivate the golem and learn how to control it, using its immense power to protect themselves and those they cared about.

additionals.title: The Eternal Guardian
additionals.content: Though many centuries have passed since its creation, the Stone Golem remains a loyal guardian of its creators' legacy. It has faced countless battles and foes over the years but remains unyielding in its duty. The golem's stone-cold heart beats with an unwavering commitment to protect those it was designed to serve, even if that means sacrificing itself in the process.

monster_instances.name: Gorgon

special_abilities.name: Trampling Charge
special_abilities.description: If the gorgon moves at least 20 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a gore attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a DC 16 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone. If the target is prone, the gorgon can make one attack with its hooves against it as a bonus action.

actions.name: Gore.
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 18 (2d12 + 5) piercing damage.

actions.name: Hooves.
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 16 (2d10 + 5) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Petrifying Breath (Recharge 5-6).
actions.description: The gorgon exhales petrifying gas in a 30--foot cone. Each creature in that area must succeed on a DC 13 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a target begins to turn to stone and is restrained. The restrained target must repeat the saving throw at the end of its next turn. On a success, the effect ends on the target. On a failure, the target is petrified until freed by the greater restorationspell or other magic.

monster_instances.description: The Gorgon, a creature of monstrous size and intimidating presence, is an entity that commands attention. Its *large*, *scaly body* is covered in thick *armor*, providing a formidable defense against most attacks. Its eyes burn with an intensity that seems to pierce through time itself, while its *snake-like hair* stands out like a crown of serpents. Its **gore** attacks are swift and brutal, capable of leaving even the most hardened warriors gasping for air. But it is not just its physical prowess that makes the Gorgon a fearsome foe; it is also its **petrifying breath** that can turn living creatures into stone with ease. The Gorgon's _repertoire_ also includes a _trampling charge_, which can leave its enemies scattered and vulnerable. Despite its _monstrous_ appearance, the Gorgon is not without weaknesses; it can be petrified itself if exposed to _greater restoration_ or other magic.

additionals.title: Beliefs and Rituals
additionals.content: The Gorgon holds great reverence for its snake-like hair, believing it to be a gift from an ancient deity who granted them dominion over life and death. They often braid their hair into intricate patterns as a sign of respect to their patron god or goddess. The Gorgon is also known to conduct ritualistic dances around bonfires during solstice celebrations.

additionals.title: Reproduction and Growth
additionals.content: The Gorgon reproduces by laying eggs in hidden lairs deep within caves or dense forests. The hatchlings are initially small and vulnerable but grow rapidly thanks to their mother's nourishment provided through her venomous bite. Once they reach maturity, they leave their birthplace to explore the world beyond.

additionals.title: Historical Sightings
additionals.content: Throughout history, there have been numerous sightings of the Gorgon across various continents. Some believe these creatures were once part of an ancient civilization destroyed by magical cataclysms while others think they were created by powerful sorcerers as guardians for long-lost treasures.

monster_instances.name: Grick

special_abilities.name: Stone Camouflage
special_abilities.description: The grick has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide in rocky terrain.

actions.name: Multiattack.
actions.description: The grick makes one attack with its tentacles. If that attack hits, the grick can make one beak attack against the same target.

actions.name: Tentacles.
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack:+4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit:9 (2d6 + 2) slashing damage.

actions.name: Beak.
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit:5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage.

monster_instances.damage_resistances: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical weapons
monster_instances.description: The *Grick* is a *Medium-sized monstrosity* with a **natural armor** that gives it an advantage in *darkvision*. Its **Stone Camouflage** ability allows it to blend into rocky terrain with ease. It has *6 hit points* and is a **challenge rating 2**. The *Grick* is equipped with both *tentacles* and a *beak*, allowing it to inflict significant damage upon its prey. Its **damage resistances** include bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical weapons. Despite its menacing appearance, the Grick is known for its stealthy nature.

additionals.title: Hunting Grounds
additionals.content: The Grick can often be found lurking in rocky terrains such as cliffsides or cavernous regions. They are opportunistic hunters who rely on their Stone Camouflage ability to ambush their prey.

additionals.title: Diet
additionals.content: The Grick primarily feeds on small mammals and birds that inhabit rocky terrains. They have been known to consume larger prey when food sources are scarce.

additionals.title: Reproduction
additionals.content: Gricks reproduce through laying eggs in hidden nests within their rocky habitats. The young Gricks hatch after several weeks and quickly learn to utilize their Stone Camouflage ability for survival.

monster_instances.name: Griffon

special_abilities.name: Keen Sight
special_abilities.description: The griffon has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

actions.name: Multiattack.
actions.description: The griffon makes two attacks: one with its beak and one with its claws.

actions.name: Beak.
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit:8 (1d8 + 4) piercing damage.

actions.name: Claws.
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit:11 (2d6 + 4) slashing damage.

monster_instances.description: The Griffon is a large monstrosity with the body of a lion and the head and wings of an eagle. Its golden fur shimmers in the light, while its piercing eyes hold the wisdom of ages. With powerful wings that allow it to soar through the skies at incredible speeds, the Griffon is a symbol of freedom and majesty. Its keen sight grants it advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight, making it an excellent sentinel in its territory. The Griffon's beak and claws are formidable weapons, capable of inflicting significant damage on its enemies. As a guardian of treasure hoards and sacred places, the Griffon plays a vital role in maintaining balance within its ecosystem.

additionals.title: Habitat
additionals.content: Griffons are typically found in mountainous regions or remote wilderness areas where they can easily hunt for food and avoid human settlements. They are solitary creatures that only come together during mating season or when defending their territories.

additionals.title: Diet
additionals.content: Griffons primarily feed on small mammals, birds, and fish but have been known to consume carrion if food is scarce. Their diet also includes occasional fruits and berries found in their natural habitat.

additionals.title: Role in Ecosystem
additionals.content: Griffons play a crucial role in their ecosystem by controlling populations of prey species and protecting sacred sites from desecration. They are also seen as harbingers of good fortune by some cultures who revere them as symbols of strength and freedom.

monster_instances.name: Grimlock
monster_instances.senses: blindsight 30 ft. or 10 ft. while deafened (blind beyond this radius), passive Perception 13

special_abilities.name: Blind Senses
special_abilities.description: The grimlock can't use its blindsight while deafened and unable to smell.

special_abilities.name: Keen Hearing and Smell
special_abilities.description: The grimlock has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing or smell.

special_abilities.name: Stone Camouflage
special_abilities.description: The grimlock has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide in rocky terrain.

actions.name: Spiked Bone Club.
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d4 + 3) bludgeoning damage plus 2 (1d4) piercing damage.

monster_instances.description: In a world of darkness and mystery, there exists a race of humanoids known as Grimlocks. These creatures are medium-sized humanoids with a strong affinity for rocky terrain. Their bodies are covered in a thick layer of stone-like skin that provides them with natural armor and camouflage in their rocky environment. With keen hearing and smell, they are able to detect even the faintest sounds or scents from miles away.

additionals.title: Grimlock Culture: A Society Built on Stone
additionals.content: The Grimlocks are a society built on stone. Their culture revolves around their unique ability to blend into rocky terrain. They have developed a deep respect for nature and have learned to live harmoniously with their surroundings. Their homes are carved into the mountainsides, and their tools and weapons are crafted from stones found in their environment.

additionals.title: Grimlock Beliefs: The Call of the Wild
additionals.content: The Grimlocks believe that they were created by a divine entity known as 'The Rock Father.' This being is said to have given them their unique abilities as a testament to their strength and resilience. The Grimlocks revere this entity and believe that they must prove themselves worthy by living up to their potential.

additionals.title: Grimlock Relationships: A Rocky Alliance
additionals.content: The Grimlocks have formed alliances with other creatures who share their love for nature and respect for its power. They are particularly fond of dragons, whom they see as powerful symbols of strength and freedom. However, they maintain a cautious distance from those who would exploit or harm nature for personal gain.

monster_instances.name: Green Hag

special_abilities.name: Amphibious
special_abilities.description: The hag can breathe air and water.

special_abilities.name: Innate Spellcasting
special_abilities.description:
The hag's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 12). She can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

At will: dancing lights, minor illusion, vicious mockery

special_abilities.name: Mimicry
special_abilities.description: The hag can mimic animal sounds and humanoid voices. A creature that hears the sounds can tell they are imitations with a successful DC 14 Wisdom (Insight) check.

special_abilities.name: Hag Coven
special_abilities.description:
When hags must work together, they form covens, in spite of their selfish natures. A coven is made up of hags of any type, all of whom are equals within the group. However, each of the hags continues to desire more personal power.
A coven consists of three hags so that any arguments between two hags can be settled by the third. If more than three hags ever come together, as might happen if two covens come into conflict, the result is usually chaos.

special_abilities.name: Shared Spellcasting (Coven Only)
special_abilities.description:
While all three members of a hag coven are within 30 feet of one another, they can each cast the following spells from the wizard's spell list but must share the spell slots among themselves:

• 1st level (4 slots): identify, ray of sickness
• 2nd level (3 slots): hold person, locate object
• 3rd level (3 slots): bestow curse, counterspell, lightning bolt
• 4th level (3 slots): phantasmal killer, polymorph
• 5th level (2 slots): contact other plane, scrying
• 6th level (1 slot): eye bite

For casting these spells, each hag is a 12th-level spellcaster that uses Intelligence as her spellcasting ability. The spell save DC is 12+the hag's Intelligence modifier, and the spell attack bonus is 4+the hag's Intelligence modifier.

special_abilities.name: Hag Eye (Coven Only)
special_abilities.description:
A hag coven can craft a magic item called a hag eye, which is made from a real eye coated in varnish and often fitted to a pendant or other wearable item. The hag eye is usually entrusted to a minion for safekeeping and transport. A hag in the coven can take an action to see what the hag eye sees if the hag eye is on the same plane of existence. A hag eye has AC 10, 1 hit point, and darkvision with a radius of 60 feet. If it is destroyed, each coven member takes 3d10 psychic damage and is blinded for 24 hours.
A hag coven can have only one hag eye at a time, and creating a new one requires all three members of the coven to perform a ritual. The ritual takes 1 hour, and the hags can't perform it while blinded. During the ritual, if the hags take any action other than performing the ritual, they must start over.

actions.name: Claws.
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit:13 (2d8 + 4) slashing damage.

actions.name: Illusory Appearance.
actions.description: The hag covers herself and anything she is wearing or carrying with a magical illusion that makes her look like another creature of her general size and humanoid shape. The illusion ends if the hag takes a bonus action to end it or if she dies. The changes wrought by this effect fail to hold up to physical inspection. For example, the hag could appear to have smooth skin, but someone touching her would feel her rough flesh. Otherwise, a creature must take an action to visually inspect the illusion and succeed on a DC 20 Intelligence (Investigation) check to discern that the hag is disguised.

actions.name: Invisible Passage.
actions.description: The hag magically turns invisible until she attacks or casts a spell, or until her concentration ends (as if concentrating on a spell). While invisible, she leaves no physical evidence of her passage, so she can be tracked only by magic. Any equipment she wears or carries is invisible with her.

monster_instances.description: The Green Hag is a malevolent fey creature with a sinister allure. Her emerald green skin is slick and smooth to the touch, with a faint sheen that seems to shimmer in the light. Her eyes are an eerie shade of green, filled with cunning intelligence and a hint of malice. Her fingers are long and slender, tipped with sharp talons that are perfect for her deadly attacks. The hag's voice is seductive and hypnotic, capable of casting spells through her speech alone. She is a master of illusion, able to disguise herself as any humanoid or creature of her size. In battle, she is cunning and ruthless, using her magical abilities to control her enemies and bend them to her will.

additionals.title: The Hag's Deadly Art: The Eye Bite
additionals.content: *One of the hag's most feared abilities is the Eye Bite, which can infect victims with a deadly curse that slowly consumes their mind.*

monster_instances.name: Night Hag

special_abilities.name: Innate Spellcasting
special_abilities.description:
The hag's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 14, +6 to hit with spell attacks). She can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

At will: detect magic, magic missile
2/day each: plane shift (self only), ray of enfeeblement, sleep

special_abilities.name: Magic Resistance
special_abilities.description: The hag has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

special_abilities.name: Night Hag Items
special_abilities.description:
A night hag carries two very rare magic items that she must craft for herself If either object is lost, the night hag will go to great lengths to retrieve it, as creating a new tool takes time and effort.
Heartstone: This lustrous black gem allows a night hag to become ethereal while it is in her possession. The touch of a heartstone also cures any disease. Crafting a heartstone takes 30 days.
Soul Bag: When an evil humanoid dies as a result of a night hag's Nightmare Haunting, the hag catches the soul in this black sack made of stitched flesh. A soul bag can hold only one evil soul at a time, and only the night hag who crafted the bag can catch a soul with it. Crafting a soul bag takes 7 days and a humanoid sacrifice (whose flesh is used to make the bag).

actions.name: Claws (Hag Form Only).
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) slashing damage.

actions.name: Change Shape.
actions.description: The hag magically polymorphs into a Small or Medium female humanoid, or back into her true form. Her statistics are the same in each form. Any equipment she is wearing or carrying isn’t transformed. She reverts to her true form if she dies.

actions.name: Etherealness.
actions.description: The hag magically enters the Ethereal Plane from the Material Plane, or vice versa. To do so, the hag must have a heartstone in her possession.

actions.name: Nightmare Haunting (1/Day).
actions.description: While on the Ethereal Plane, the hag magically touches a sleeping humanoid on the Material Plane. A protection from evil and goodspell cast on the target prevents this contact, as does a magic circle. As long as the contact persists, the target has dreadful visions. If these visions last for at least 1 hour, the target gains no benefit from its rest, and its hit point maximum is reduced by 5 (1d10). If this effect reduces the target’s hit point maximum to 0, the target dies, and if the target was evil, its soul is trapped in the hag’s soul bag. The reduction to the target’s hit point maximum lasts until removed by the greater restoration spell or similar magic.

monster_instances.damage_resistances: cold, fire; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical weapons that aren't silvered
monster_instances.description: The Night Hag, a cunning and malevolent fiend, is a Medium-sized creature with a natural armor class of 17. With a hit point total of 112, she is formidable in combat. Her deception and stealth abilities make her an elusive foe, allowing her to evade detection and strike from the shadows. She possesses darkvision with a radius of 120 feet and has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects due to her magic resistance ability. As a fiend, she has cold and fire damage resistances, as well as immunity to being charmed. Her innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 14, +6 to hit with spell attacks). She can cast detect magic, magic missile, plane shift (self only), ray of enfeeblement, sleep (2/day each), and hold person, locate object (1st level); hold person (2nd level); bestow curse, counterspell (3rd level); phantasmal killer, polymorph (4th level); eye bite (5th level); contact other plane, scrying (6th level) (5th-level spells). In addition to her innate spellcasting abilities, she carries two rare magic items: a heartstone that allows her to become ethereal while it is in her possession and cures any disease; and a soul bag that traps one evil humanoid soul at a time.

additionals.title: Night Hag Coven
additionals.content: When hags must work together, they form covens consisting of three hags of any type. Each hag within the coven is equal in power but continues to desire more personal power. The covens work together when they must face greater threats or when they wish to share resources or knowledge. When within 30 feet of one another, members of a coven can share certain spells but must split their spell slots among themselves.

additionals.title: Hag Eye
additionals.content: A hag eye is a magic item crafted by a hag coven that allows one member to see through the eyes of another member who possesses the item. The item can be entrusted to a minion for safekeeping but if it is destroyed or stolen by an enemy all three members take significant damage.

monster_instances.name: Sea Hag

special_abilities.name: Amphibious
special_abilities.description: The hag can breathe air and water.

special_abilities.name: Horrific Appearance
special_abilities.description:
Any humanoid that starts its turn within 30 feet of the hag and can see the hag's true form must make a DC 11 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature is frightened for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, with disadvantage if the hag is within line of sight, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the hag's Horrific Appearance for the next 24 hours.
Unless the target is surprised or the revelation of the hag's true form is sudden, the target can avert its eyes and avoid making the initial saving throw. Until the start of its next turn, a creature that averts its eyes has disadvantage on attack rolls against the hag.

actions.name: Death Glare.
actions.description: The hag targets one frightened creature she can see within 30 feet of her. If the target can see the hag, it must succeed on a DC 11 Wisdom saving throw against this magic or drop to 0 hit points.

actions.description: The hag covers herself and anything she is wearing or carrying with a magical illusion that makes her look like an ugly creature of her general size and humanoid shape. The effect ends if the hag takes a bonus action to end it or if she dies. The changes wrought by this effect fail to hold up to physical inspection. A beast, humanoid, giant, or monstrosity can become a half-dragon. It keeps its statistics, except as follows.

actions.name: Challenge.
actions.description: To avoid recalculating the creature’s challenge rating, apply the template only to a creature that meets the optional prerequisite in the Breath Weapon table below. Otherwise, recalculate the rating after you apply the template.

actions.name: Senses.
actions.description: The half-dragon gains blindsight with a radius of 10 feet and darkvision with a radius of 60 feet.

actions.name: Resistances.
actions.description: The half-dragon gains resistance to a type of damage based on its color.

actions.name: Languages.
actions.description: The half-dragon speaks Draconic in addition to any other languages it knows.

actions.name: New Action: Breath Weapon.
actions.description: The half-dragon has the breath weapon of its dragon half. The half-dragon’s size determines how this action functions.

monster_instances.description: The Sea Hag is a Medium-sized fey creature with an unsettling appearance that strikes fear into the hearts of those who witness it. Its greenish skin is covered in warts and scales, giving it an otherworldly look that is both repulsive and mesmerizing. Its eyes are sunken deep within its head, surrounded by long strands of unkempt hair. This grotesque visage is only made worse by its horrific appearance, which can leave victims frightened and begging for their lives.

additionals.title: The Art of Manipulation
additionals.content: The Sea Hag is a master manipulator, using its charm and illusion magic to control others and bend them to its will. It can easily disguise itself as a beautiful humanoid or even transform into a monstrous creature to instill fear in its victims. The hag uses these abilities to lure unsuspecting prey into its lair or trick them into revealing valuable information.

additionals.title: The Dark Magic of the Sea Hag
additionals.content: The Sea Hag wields dark magic that can turn even the strongest-willed individual into her puppet. Her spells range from powerful curses that can cripple her enemies to devastating attacks like lightning bolt that can shatter defenses and deal massive damage. She also has access to powerful utility spells such as identify and locate object, which she uses to gather information on her prey.

additionals.title: A Coven of Terror
additionals.content: When three Sea Hags form a coven, they become an unstoppable force of terror. Working together, they can cast powerful spells such as hold person, scrying, and counterspell that can control their enemies or reveal their secrets. They also share their eye through a magical artifact called a hag eye, allowing them to see through each other's eyes and coordinate their attacks more effectively.

monster_instances.name: Half-Red Dragon Veteran
monster_instances.senses: blindsight 10 ft., darkvision 60 ft., passive Perception 12

actions.name: Multiattack.
actions.description: The veteran makes two longsword attacks. If it has a shortsword drawn, it can also make a shortsword attack.

actions.name: Longsword.
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) slashing damage, or 8 (1d10 +3) slashing damage if used with two hands.

actions.name: Shortsword.
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage.

actions.name: Heavy Crossbow.
actions.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, range 100/400 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d10 + 1) piercing damage.

actions.name: Fire Breath (Recharge 5-6).
actions.description: The veteran exhales fire in a 15--foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw, taking 24 (7d6) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

monster_instances.damage_resistances: fire
monster_instances.description: The Half-Red Dragon Veteran is a seasoned warrior, with a body adorned in the scales of a young red dragon. Its humanoid features hint at a life filled with adventure and hardship, while its dragon heritage lends it an air of mystique and power. The Veteran is a formidable combatant, wielding both melee and ranged weapons with deadly precision. Its heavy plate armor bears the scars of countless battles, while its eyes hold the wisdom of a thousand tales. The Veteran's fire breath weapon is a fearsome asset in combat, capable of decimating entire groups of enemies with ease. Despite its fearsome appearance and abilities, the Veteran is not without compassion, having seen firsthand the devastation that war can bring.

additionals.title: A Life of Adventure
additionals.content: The Half-Red Dragon Veteran has led an extraordinary life, filled with tales of heroism and daring deeds. It has fought alongside great heroes and faced terrible villains, leaving its mark on the world through its actions.

additionals.title: The Dragon Within
additionals.content: The Veteran's dragon heritage gives it access to abilities beyond those of ordinary humans. It can communicate telepathically with dragons within 1000 feet and has resistance to fire damage due to its innate draconic nature.

additionals.title: The Art of War
additionals.content: The Veteran has honed its combat skills over many years, becoming an expert in both melee and ranged weapons. It is well-versed in various fighting styles and tactics, making it a formidable opponent in any situation.

monster_instances.name: Harpy

actions.name: Multiattack.
actions.description: The harpy makes two attacks: one with its claws and one with its club.

actions.name: Claws.
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit:6 (2d4 + 1) slashing damage.

actions.name: Club.
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 3 (1d4 + 1) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Luring Song.
actions.description: The harpy sings a magical melody. Every humanoid and giant within 300 feet of the harpy that can hear the song must succeed on a DC 11 Wisdom saving throw or be charmed until the song ends. The harpy must take a bonus action on its subsequent turns to continue singing. It can stop singing at any time. The song ends if the harpy is incapacitated. While charmed by the harpy, a target is incapacitated and ignores the songs of other harpies. If the charmed target is more than 5 feet away from the harpy, the target must move on its turn toward the harpy by the most direct route, trying to get within 5 feet. It doesn’t avoid opportunity attacks, but before moving into damaging terrain, such as lava or a pit, and whenever it takes damage from a source other than the harpy, the target can repeat the saving throw. A charmed target can also repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns. If the saving throw is successful, the effect ends on it. A target that successfully saves is immune to this harpy’s song for the next 24 hours.

monster_instances.description: The Harpy is a cunning and deceptive creature, with a strong build and the ability to fly at impressive speeds. Its primary weapon is its Luring Song, which can charm victims into following it without resistance. This song serves as both an offensive and defensive tool, allowing the Harpy to lure its prey closer or escape from dangerous situations. Despite its chaotic nature, the Harpy is not without intelligence, as evidenced by its ability to use stealth and deception in addition to its physical attacks.

additionals.title: The Allure of the Luring Song
additionals.content: The Harpy's Luring Song is not just a tool for attracting prey but also serves as a means of communication among harpies themselves. They use their melodic abilities to convey information about potential threats or food sources. This ability has led some scholars to believe that harpies may have their own form of language, one that is deeply ingrained in their very nature.

additionals.title: The Dance of Predator and Prey
additionals.content: In ancient times, harpies were revered as symbols of freedom and beauty by many civilizations. However, their chaotic nature often led them into conflict with humans and other creatures. Over time, these encounters have shaped the way both humans and harpies perceive each other. While some humans still view harpies as dangerous predators to be feared or hunted, others see them as complex beings with their own motivations and desires.

additionals.title: Harpy Society
additionals.content: Harpies are known for their solitary nature but occasionally gather in groups called 'flocks.' These flocks are typically composed of mates or family members who work together to hunt and defend their territory from rival groups or predators. Flocks are led by the oldest or strongest member, who makes decisions on behalf of the group.

monster_instances.name: Hell Hound

special_abilities.name: Keen Hearing and Smell
special_abilities.description: The hound has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing or smell.

special_abilities.name: Pack Tactics
special_abilities.description: The hound has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the hound's allies is within 5 ft. of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

monster_instances.languages: understands Infernal but can't speak it

actions.name: Bite.
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) piercing damage plus 7 (2d6) fire damage.

actions.name: Fire Breath (Recharge 5-6).
actions.description: The hound exhales fire in a 15--foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 12 Dexterity saving throw, taking 21 (6d6) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

monster_instances.description: The Hell Hound is a terrifying creature, a loyal servant of the dark forces that dwell in the depths of the underworld. Its fiery breath and keen senses make it a formidable opponent, capable of striking fear into the hearts of even the bravest warriors. The Hell Hound's origin is shrouded in mystery, but it is believed to have been created by ancient demon lords as a weapon against their enemies. Over time, the Hell Hound has become an iconic symbol of evil and destruction, striking terror into the hearts of all who cross its path.

additionals.title: The Creation of the Hell Hound
additionals.content: The exact origins of the Hell Hound are unknown, but it is believed that these fearsome creatures were created by ancient demon lords as part of their endless quest for power. The process of creating a Hell Hound was long and painful, involving dark rituals and sacrifices that bound the creature's soul to its demonic masters. The resulting creatures were fierce and loyal servants, capable of wreaking havoc on their masters' enemies.

additionals.title: The Loyalty of the Hell Hound
additionals.content: The loyalty of a Hell Hound is unwavering, bound by dark magic to serve its master until death. These creatures are fiercely protective of their masters and will do whatever it takes to defend them from harm. In battle, they fight with ferocity and cunning, using their keen senses to track down their prey and their fire breath to incinerate anything that stands in their way.

additionals.title: The Terror of the Hell Hound
additionals.content: The mere presence of a Hell Hound can strike terror into the hearts of even the most seasoned warriors. With its fiery breath and sinister appearance, this creature inspires fear in all who encounter it. Those who have faced off against a Hell Hound often speak of an overwhelming sense of dread that permeates their very souls. The legend of these fearsome beasts has spread far and wide, making them one of the most feared creatures in all the realms.

monster_instances.name: Hippogriff

special_abilities.name: Keen Sight
special_abilities.description: The hippogriff has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

actions.name: Multiattack.
actions.description: The hippogriff makes two attacks: one with its beak and one with its claws.

actions.name: Beak.
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack:+5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit:8 (1d10 + 3) piercing damage.

actions.name: Claws.
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack:+5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit:10 (2d6 + 3) slashing damage.

monster_instances.description: The Hippogriff is a majestic creature, combining the features of an eagle and a horse into a single awe-inspiring form. Its large wings allow it to take to the skies with ease, soaring above the ground with grace and agility. Its keen sight is one of its most prominent features, granting it an advantage in detecting potential threats or prey from afar. This advantage is not just limited to its eyesight; it also reflects in the way it navigates through the skies with unmatched precision. The Hippogriff's flight abilities are not only limited to speed; it can also maneuver with incredible agility, making it difficult for its opponents to target it effectively. Despite its ferocity in battle, the Hippogriff has been known to form bonds with humans, often serving as mounts or guides for those who are able to earn their trust.

additionals.title: The Bond Between Hippogriffs and Humans
additionals.content: Hippogriffs are known for their ability to form strong bonds with humans. These relationships are built on trust and respect, as both parties must learn to understand each other's strengths and weaknesses. Through training and shared experiences, a human can earn the trust of a Hippogriff, which can lead to a lifelong partnership.

additionals.title: The Role of Hippogriffs in Society
additionals.content: In some societies, Hippogriffs are revered as symbols of freedom and independence. Their ability to take flight at will has inspired many tales of adventure and courage. Some individuals even dedicate their lives to studying these magnificent creatures, seeking to unlock their full potential as mounts or companions.

monster_instances.name: Hobgoblin

special_abilities.name: Martial Advantage
special_abilities.description: Once per turn, the hobgoblin can deal an extra 7 (2d6) damage to a creature it hits with a weapon attack if that creature is within 5 ft. of an ally of the hobgoblin that isn't incapacitated.

actions.name: Longsword.
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack:+3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit:5 (1d8 + 1) slashing damage, or 6 (1d10 +1) slashing damage if used with two hands.

actions.name: Longbow.
actions.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. Hit:5 (1d8 + 1) piercing damage.

monster_instances.description:
"*The hobgoblin stands tall with a menacing air about it. Its armor gleams in the light, reflecting a cold determination that emanates from within. A fierce warrior by nature, it moves with an air of authority and discipline that is almost palpable.*

*Hailing from a militaristic society, hobgoblins are known for their unwavering loyalty to their commanders and their ruthless efficiency on the battlefield.*

*With a keen intellect and a natural aptitude for strategy, hobgoblins are often found serving as officers or tacticians within larger forces.*

*In combat, they wield their weapons with deadly precision, striking fear into the hearts of their enemies with each swift stroke.*

*Despite their intimidating appearance, hobgoblins are not without honor. They respect strength and courage in others and are known to form alliances with those who prove themselves worthy.*

*Yet beneath this veneer of discipline lies a ruthless ambition that drives them to conquer and dominate all who stand in their way.*

additionals.title: Hobgoblin Society
additionals.content: "The society of hobgoblins is built upon strict military discipline and order. They live in well-organized settlements where each individual has a specific role to play. Hierarchies are clear-cut, with strong leaders guiding their people towards common goals."

additionals.title: Martial Traditions
additionals.content: "Hobgoblins have developed various martial traditions over time. They value physical prowess above all else and dedicate much of their lives to honing their combat skills."

additionals.title: Motivations
additionals.content: "Hobgoblins are driven by ambition and desire for power. They seek out challenges that test their abilities and relish opportunities to prove themselves against formidable foes."

monster_instances.name: Homunculus

special_abilities.name: Telepathic Bond
special_abilities.description: While the homunculus is on the same plane of existence as its master, it can magically convey what it senses to its master, and the two can communicate telepathically.

monster_instances.languages: understands the languages of its creator but can't speak

actions.name: Bite.
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 1 piercing damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 10 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned for 1 minute. If the saving throw fails by 5 or more, the target is instead poisoned for 5 (1d10) minutes and unconscious while poisoned in this way.

monster_instances.description: The Homunculus, a tiny construct of magical origin, is a marvel of alchemical engineering. Its small, fragile frame belies its resilience and adaptability, as it has been designed to withstand the harshest of conditions. Its wings allow it to navigate the skies with ease, while its sharp teeth and poisonous bite make it a formidable foe for creatures of its size. The Homunculus is a neutral creature, meaning it can be found in various settings and may have different motivations. It is a creation of its master, and it serves as a loyal guardian and protector, using its telepathic bond to keep its master informed of any dangers or threats. The Homunculus is a symbol of the power of alchemy and the potential for life to be created from the most unlikely of materials.

monster_instances.name: Hydra

special_abilities.name: Hold Breath
special_abilities.description: The hydra can hold its breath for 1 hour.

special_abilities.name: Multiple Heads
special_abilities.description:
The hydra has five heads. While it has more than one head, the hydra has advantage on saving throws against being blinded, charmed, deafened, frightened, stunned, and knocked unconscious.
Whenever the hydra takes 25 or more damage in a single turn, one of its heads dies. If all its heads die, the hydra dies.
At the end of its turn, it grows two heads for each of its heads that died since its last turn, unless it has taken fire damage since its last turn. The hydra regains 10 hit points for each head regrown in this way.

special_abilities.name: Reactive Heads
special_abilities.description: For each head the hydra has beyond one, it gets an extra reaction that can be used only for opportunity attacks.

special_abilities.name: Wakeful
special_abilities.description: While the hydra sleeps, at least one of its heads is awake.

actions.name: Multiattack.
actions.description: The hydra makes as many bite attacks as it has heads.

actions.name: Bite.
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit:10 (1d10 + 5) piercing damage.

monster_instances.description: The Hydra is a colossal, monstrous creature with multiple heads that twist and writhe menacingly atop its enormous serpentine body. Its scales are a mosaic of dark greens and blacks, adorned with intricate patterns that shimmer in the light. Each head is unique, bearing a sinister grin that exudes raw power and cunning. The Hydra's eyes are cold and calculating, their piercing gaze reflecting the ancient wisdom of countless battles fought and won. This fearsome creature is unaligned in nature, reflecting its ability to adapt to any situation or environment it encounters. Its immense size and strength are matched only by its cunning tactics and strategic prowess.

additionals.title: The Hydra's Heads
additionals.content: Each head of the Hydra is more than just a weapon; it is a living, breathing entity with its own personality and will. They communicate telepathically with one another, allowing them to coordinate their actions and react swiftly to threats. The Hydra's heads are not only deadly but also incredibly resilient, capable of regenerating from even the most grievous wounds.

additionals.title: The Art of Strategy
additionals.content: The Hydra is known for its cunning tactics and strategic prowess in battle. It can use its multiple heads to surround enemies, making it difficult for them to target or escape. The Hydra's ability to regrow heads after taking significant damage only serves to increase its fearsome reputation.

additionals.title: A Monster of Legend
additionals.content: Throughout history, the Hydra has been a symbol of fear and destruction. Its legend has been passed down through generations, inspiring tales of bravery and heroism as adventurers seek to confront this monstrous creature.

monster_instances.name: Invisible Stalker

special_abilities.name: Invisibility
special_abilities.description: The stalker is invisible.

special_abilities.name: Faultless Tracker
special_abilities.description: The stalker is given a quarry by its summoner. The stalker knows the direction and distance to its quarry as long as the two of them are on the same plane of existence. The stalker also knows the location of its summoner.

monster_instances.languages: Auran, understands Common but doesn't speak it

actions.name: Multiattack.
actions.description: The stalker makes two slam attacks.

actions.name: Slam.
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack:+6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit:10 (2d6 + 3) bludgeoning damage.

monster_instances.damage_resistances: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical weapons
monster_instances.condition_immunities: exhaustion, grappled, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned, prone, restrained, unconscious
monster_instances.description: The Invisible Stalker is a medium-sized elemental creature with a sleek, almost ethereal appearance. Its body is translucent, allowing it to blend seamlessly with the surroundings, and its eyes glow with an eerie, otherworldly light. The Stalker's stealth ability is unmatched, allowing it to move silently and quickly through any environment. Despite its ethereal appearance, the Stalker is a formidable combatant, wielding two powerful slam attacks that can deal significant damage to its enemies. The Stalker's faultless tracking ability, granted by its summoner, makes it relentless in pursuit of its quarry, and its resistance to nonmagical weapons adds an extra layer of challenge to any encounters.

additionals.title: The Creation of the Invisible Stalker
additionals.content: The Invisible Stalker is a creature of myth and legend, summoned by powerful sorcerers to serve as a relentless hunter. The process of creating an Invisible Stalker is a complex and dangerous ritual, requiring the caster to draw upon their own life force to bind an elemental spirit to a physical form. This bond of life and death creates a creature that is as loyal as it is deadly, a living weapon that will stop at nothing to fulfill its master's commands.

additionals.title: The Summoner's Bond
additionals.content: The Invisible Stalker is bound to its summoner by a powerful magical bond, one that transcends the boundaries of life and death. The Stalker will follow its summoner's commands without question, serving as a relentless hunter and protector. This bond is a double-edged sword, however, as the Stalker's life is tied to that of its summoner. If the summoner should fall, the Stalker's existence may be threatened, and the creature may become uncontrollable, its loyalty to its fallen master driving it to wreak havoc on the world.

additionals.title: The Invisible Stalker in Combat
additionals.content: The Invisible Stalker is a master of stealth and ambush, using its invisibility and faultless tracking to stalk its prey from the shadows. It attacks with deadly precision, striking from the darkness with its powerful slam attacks. Despite its ethereal appearance, the Stalker is a formidable combatant, able to withstand significant damage from nonmagical weapons. Its resistance to such attacks, combined with its stealth and tracking abilities, make it a terrifying opponent, capable of striking from anywhere and disappearing before its enemies even know it was there.

monster_instances.name: Kobold

special_abilities.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
special_abilities.description: While in sunlight, the kobold has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

special_abilities.name: Pack Tactics
special_abilities.description: The kobold has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the kobold's allies is within 5 ft. of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

actions.name: Dagger.
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) piercing damage.

actions.name: Sling.
actions.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) bludgeoning damage.

monster_instances.description: The kobold is a small, humanoid creature with a scaly greenish-gray skin that resembles that of a lizard. Standing at only 3 feet tall, it has a slender build and sharp claws on its hands and feet. Its head is triangular with large, almond-shaped eyes that seem to always be watching for potential threats or opportunities. Despite its small size, the kobold's dark eyes are filled with cunning and malice. Its ears are pointed and upright, while its mouth is filled with sharp teeth that seem ready to bite at any moment. The kobold's tail is long and whip-like, which it uses to maintain balance or strike at enemies from behind cover. It typically wears simple clothing made of animal hides or rags.

additionals.title: Kobold Society
additionals.content: Kobolds live in underground lairs that they share with other creatures such as goblins or hobgoblins. These communities are usually led by a council of elders or a powerful warlord who rules with an iron fist. Kobolds are known for their strict hierarchy and adherence to tradition, which often leads to internal conflicts and power struggles.

additionals.title: Kobold Warriors
additionals.content: Kobolds are often employed as soldiers by more powerful creatures due to their cunning tactics and ability to cause significant damage despite their small size. They are known for their pack tactics, using their agility and speed to flank enemies effectively. Kobolds also have a natural resistance to magic, making them formidable opponents for spellcasters.

additionals.title: Kobold Cunning
additionals.content: Despite their small size and seemingly cowardly nature, kobolds are highly intelligent creatures with an innate ability for strategy and deception. They are known for their ability to infiltrate enemy ranks undetected and sabotage their operations from within. This makes them valuable allies for those who can control them or fearsome enemies for those who underestimate them.

monster_instances.name: Kraken

special_abilities.name: Amphibious
special_abilities.description: The kraken can breathe air and water.

special_abilities.name: Freedom of Movement
special_abilities.description: The kraken ignores difficult terrain, and magical effects can't reduce its speed or cause it to be restrained. It can spend 5 feet of movement to escape from nonmagical restraints or being grappled.

special_abilities.name: Siege Monster
special_abilities.description: The kraken deals double damage to objects and structures.

monster_instances.languages: understands Abyssal, Celestial, Infernal, and Primordial but can't speak, telepathy 120 ft.

actions.name: Multiattack.
actions.description: The kraken makes three tentacle attacks, each of which it can replace with one use of Fling.

actions.name: Bite.
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +17 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit:23 (3d8 + 10) piercing damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature grappled by the kraken, that creature is swallowed, and the grapple ends. While swallowed, the creature is blinded and restrained, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the kraken, and it takes 42 (12d6) acid damage at the start of each of the kraken’s turns. If the kraken takes 50 damage or more on a single turn from a creature inside it, the kraken must succeed on a DC 25 Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or regurgitate all swallowed creatures, which fall prone in a space within 10 feet of the kraken. If the kraken dies, a swallowed creature is no longer restrained by it and can escape from the corpse using 15 feet of movement, exiting prone.

actions.name: Tentacle.
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +17 to hit, reach 30 ft., one target. Hit:20 (3d6 + 10) bludgeoning damage, and the target is grappled (escape DC 18). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained. The kraken has ten tentacles, each of which can grapple one target.

actions.name: Fling.
actions.description: One Large or smaller object held or creature grappled by the kraken is thrown up to 60 feet in a random direction and knocked prone. If a thrown target strikes a solid surface, the target takes 3 (1d6) bludgeoning damage for every 10 feet it was thrown. If the target is thrown at another creature, that creature must succeed on a DC 18 Dexterity saving throw or take the same damage and be knocked prone.

actions.name: Lightning Storm.
actions.description: The kraken magically creates three bolts of lightning, each of which can strike a target the kraken can see within 120 feet of it. A target must make a DC 23 Dexterity saving throw, taking 22 (4d10) lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The kraken can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature’s turn. The kraken regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

monster_instances.damage_immunities: lightning; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical weapons
monster_instances.description: The Kraken is a gargantuan titan of chaos, a monstrous amalgamation of tentacles and terror that lurks beneath the waves. Its massive form dwarfs even the largest vessels, its tentacles reaching out to ensnare prey or hurl objects with deadly precision. This colossal creature is not to be trifled with; it deals double damage to objects and structures, reflecting its ability to lay waste to anything in its path. Its truesight allows it to see through deception and subterfuge, while its freedom of movement ensures that no mere mortal can restrain it. With a bite that can swallow even large creatures whole, the Kraken is a force of nature that strikes fear into the hearts of all who encounter it.

additionals.title: Kraken Lore
additionals.content: The Kraken has been a symbol of terror in both mythology and reality. These ancient beings are said to dwell in the darkest depths of the ocean, waiting for unsuspecting prey or ships to come within striking distance. They are known for their immense size, their powerful tentacles, and their ability to summon deadly storms.

additionals.title: Hunting Grounds
additionals.content: The Kraken's preferred hunting grounds are vast underwater caverns or deep trenches where it can easily ambush unwary prey or hide from potential foes. It is also known to dwell near shipwrecks or other sunken treasures, where it can feast on marine life while keeping an eye out for opportunistic intruders.

additionals.title: Rituals and Behavior
additionals.content: Krakens are solitary creatures by nature but have been known to form temporary alliances with other monstrous sea creatures for mutual benefit. They are territorial and will fiercely defend their lairs from intruders. They are also known for their cunning and adaptability, using their environment to their advantage in both hunting and evasion tactics.

monster_instances.name: Lamia

special_abilities.name: Innate Spellcasting
special_abilities.description: The lamia's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 13). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components. At will: disguise self (any humanoid form), major image 3/day each: charm person, mirror image, scrying, suggestion 1/day: geas

actions.name: Multiattack.
actions.description: The lamia makes two attacks: one with its claws and one with its dagger or Intoxicating Touch.

actions.name: Claws.
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit:14 (2d10 + 3) slashing damage.

actions.name: Dagger.
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit:5 (1d4 + 3) piercing damage.

actions.name: Intoxicating Touch.
actions.description: Melee Spell Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit:The target is magically cursed for 1 hour. Until the curse ends, the target has disadvantage on Wisdom saving throws and all ability checks.

monster_instances.description: The Lamia is a creature of dark myths and legends, her alluring beauty hiding a sinister nature. With her large frame and deadly claws, she is a formidable adversary. Her ability to cast spells without the need for material components adds an extra layer of danger to any encounter with this *monstrous* being. In her natural habitat, she can be found lurking in the shadows of dark caves or deep forests. She uses her charm and guile to lure unsuspecting victims into her grasp before striking with deadly force. Her **Intoxicating Touch** can curse those who fall prey to it, leaving them at a disadvantage when it comes to their Wisdom saving throws and ability checks.

additionals.title: Lamia Society
additionals.content: In the twisted realms where Lamias dwell, they form secretive societies known as *Coven*. These covens are ruled by powerful Lamia queens who wield their influence over their subjects through fear and manipulation. The members of these covens are bound together by their shared desire for power and control over others.

additionals.title: Lamia Lairs
additionals.content: The lairs of Lamias are often hidden deep within the darkest corners of the world. They prefer locations that allow them to blend into their surroundings easily - such as dense forests or underground caverns - so they can lure their prey into traps with ease. These lairs are filled with treasures stolen from their victims, which serve as both a testament to their power and a constant reminder of their conquests.

additionals.title: Lamia Hunting Techniques
additionals.content: Lamias are known for their cunning hunting techniques that rely on deception and manipulation rather than brute strength. They use their charm and allure to lure victims into close proximity before revealing their true nature. Once they have ensnared their prey in this way, they use their deadly claws or **Intoxicating Touch** to strike.

monster_instances.name: Lich

special_abilities.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
special_abilities.description: If the lich fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

special_abilities.name: Rejuvenation
special_abilities.description: If it has a phylactery, a destroyed lich gains a new body in 1d10 days, regaining all its hit points and becoming active again. The new body appears within 5 feet of the phylactery.

special_abilities.name: Spellcasting
special_abilities.description:
The lich is an 18th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save DC 20, +12 to hit with spell attacks). The lich has the following wizard spells prepared:

• Cantrips (at will): mage hand, prestidigitation, ray of frost
• 1st level (4 slots): detect magic, magic missile, shield, thunderwave
• 2nd level (3 slots): detect thoughts, invisibility, Melf's acid arrow, mirror image
• 3rd level (3 slots): animate dead, counterspell, dispel magic, fireball
• 4th level (3 slots): blight, dimension door
• 5th level (3 slots): cloudkill, scrying
• 6th level (1 slot): disintegrate, globe of invulnerability
• 7th level (1 slot): finger of death, plane shift
• 8th level (1 slot): dominate monster, power word stun
• 9th level (1 slot): power word kill

special_abilities.name: Turn Resistance
special_abilities.description: The lich has advantage on saving throws against any effect that turns undead.

monster_instances.languages: Common plus up to five other languages

actions.name: Paralyzing Touch.
actions.description: Melee Spell Attack: +12 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 10 (3d6) cold damage. The target must succeed on a DC 18 Constitution saving throw or be paralyzed for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. The lich can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature’s turn. The lich regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

monster_instances.damage_immunities: poison; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical weapons
monster_instances.damage_resistances: cold, lightning, necrotic
monster_instances.description: The Lich is a creature of _dark magic_ and _ancient power_. With its *skeletal form* covered in *ancient runes*, it exudes an aura of _death_ and _decay_. Its *eyes_, filled with a _cold_, *unearthly light_, seem to pierce through time and space itself. The Lich is an embodiment of _undying evil_, its *will* bent on domination and destruction. It is said that the Lich's *soul_ has been so corrupted by its own ambition that it has transcended into something beyond mortal comprehension.

additionals.title: Beliefs and Rituals
additionals.content: The Lich believes in the supremacy of undeath over all other forms of existence. It follows ancient rituals that involve the sacrifice of living beings to maintain its power. The Lich is particularly fond of rituals that involve summoning other undead creatures or casting spells that drain life energy.

additionals.title: Reproduction and Growth
additionals.content: The Lich does not reproduce or grow in the traditional sense. However, it can transfer its consciousness into new bodies using its _Rejuvenation_ ability. This process requires a powerful artifact known as a phylactery, which stores the Lich's soul.

additionals.title: Historical Sightings
additionals.content: Historical sightings of Liches are rare but terrifying. They are often associated with powerful necromancers who have succumbed to their own dark magic. These beings are usually defeated only by powerful artifacts or divine intervention.

special_abilities.description: The lizardfolk can hold its breath for 15 minutes.

monster_instances.description: The lizardfolk, a reptilian humanoid creature, is a natural survivor with a deep connection to nature. Their scales shimmer in various shades of green and brown, blending seamlessly with their surroundings. With a keen sense of survival and an innate ability to hold their breath for extended periods, these beings are well-suited to aquatic environments. Their agility and stealth skills make them formidable opponents in the wild. The lizardfolk speak Draconic, a language that reveals their ancient lineage and wisdom.

additionals.title: Lizardfolk Culture
additionals.content: The lizardfolk have a rich culture that revolves around their connection to nature. They live in close-knit communities near bodies of water and have developed a symbiotic relationship with the environment. Their society is matriarchal, with women holding positions of authority and leadership. The lizardfolk are known for their intricate body tattoos, which hold deep spiritual significance and represent their personal history and achievements.

additionals.title: Lizardfolk Hunting Techniques
additionals.content: The lizardfolk are skilled hunters who rely on stealth and ambush tactics to take down their prey. They are adept at using the terrain to their advantage, often hiding in shallow water or among rocks and vegetation to remain hidden from view. When they strike, they use their powerful jaws and sharp claws to deliver swift and deadly blows.

additionals.title: Lizardfolk Role in Ecosystem
additionals.content: The lizardfolk play a crucial role in maintaining the balance of their ecosystem. As predators, they help control the population of smaller creatures in the area. Additionally, they serve as guardians of sacred sites and ancient artifacts that hold power over the natural world.

Its statistics, other than its size and AC, are the same in each form. Any equipment it. is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

special_abilities.name: Keen Smell
