monster_instances.damage_immunities: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical weapons that aren't silvered
monster_instances.description:
"*The werebear, a creature of both strength and cunning, is a shapechanger capable of transforming between its humanoid form, a Large bear-humanoid hybrid, and a Large bear. Its humanoid form is that of a muscular human with a bear-like appearance, while its bear and hybrid forms are fearsome and powerful.*

*In its humanoid form, the werebear is a formidable warrior, wielding a great axe with deadly precision. Its keen sense of smell gives it an advantage in detecting danger or tracking prey.*

*In its bear and hybrid forms, the werebear is a force of nature, its massive size and raw power making it a terrifying opponent.*

*Its lycanthropy, a curse that transforms any humanoid who dares to bite it, only adds to its fearsome reputation.*

*The werebear is a creature of the wild, its existence inextricably linked to the natural world. It is a guardian of the forest, a predator of the weak, and a symbol of the primal instincts that drive all living things.*

*Its humanoid form allows it to blend into society, hiding its true nature and biding its time until the moment is right to unleash its full power.*

*The werebear is a creature of legend, a symbol of the untamed wilderness and the raw power that lies within all living things.*

additionals.title: The Lycanthropy Curse
additionals.content: The curse of lycanthropy that plagues the werebear is a powerful and dangerous affliction. Those who are bitten by a werebear must make a DC 14 Constitution saving throw or be cursed with the same lycanthropy that plagues the beast. The curse is a terrible burden to bear, transforming the victim into a monstrous creature of the night. The curse is not only a physical transformation but also a mental one, driving the victim to embrace their primal instincts and abandon their humanity. The curse is a living nightmare, a constant reminder of the werebear's deadly power.

additionals.title: The Werebear's Diet
additionals.content: The werebear's diet is a varied one, consisting of both meat and vegetation. In its humanoid form, it prefers the taste of fresh meat, hunting down deer, boar, and other large game. In its bear and hybrid forms, it has a more omnivorous diet, consuming both meat and vegetation. It is particularly fond of berries, nuts, and other fruits, which it gathers during the warmer months. The werebear's diet is not only a source of nourishment but also a way for it to connect with the natural world around it.

monster_instances.name: Wereboar
monster_instances.armor_class: 10 in humanoid form, 11 (natural armor) in boar or hybrid form

special_abilities.name: Shapechanger
special_abilities.description: The wereboar can use its action to polymorph into a boar-humanoid hybrid or into a boar, or back into its true form, which is humanoid. Its statistics, other than its AC, are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

special_abilities.name: Charge (Boar or Hybrid Form Only)
special_abilities.description: If the wereboar moves at least 15 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with its tusks on the same turn, the target takes an extra 7 (2d6) slashing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 13 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

special_abilities.name: Relentless (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
special_abilities.description: If the wereboar takes 14 damage or less that would reduce it to 0 hit points, it is reduced to 1 hit point instead.

actions.name: Multiattack (Humanoid or Hybrid Form Only).
actions.description: The wereboar makes two attacks, only one of which can be with its tusks.

actions.name: Maul (Humanoid or Hybrid Form Only).
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Tusks (Boar or Hybrid Form Only).
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit:10 (2d6 + 3)slashing damage. If the target is a humanoid, it must succeed on a DC 12 Constitution saving throw or be cursed with wereboar lycanthropy.

monster_instances.damage_immunities: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical weapons that aren't silvered
monster_instances.description:
"*The wereboar, a shape-shifting humanoid, roams the lands in search of prey and territory. In its humanoid form, it appears as a normal human, but when the moon is full, it transforms into a fearsome boar-humanoid hybrid or a terrifying boar. The wereboar's transformation is not only a physical change but also a mental one, as its humanoid mind is replaced with a primal, feral consciousness.*

*The wereboar's life is a constant struggle for survival. It must feed on human flesh to maintain its shape-shifting abilities and avoid the curse of lycanthropy. The wereboar's diet consists of both human and boar, as it craves the taste of its own kind. This insatiable hunger drives the wereboar to hunt and kill, leaving a trail of destruction in its wake.*

*The wereboar's place in the food chain is unique. It is both predator and prey, hunted by those who fear its power and sought after by those who wish to harness its abilities. The wereboar's transformation is a double-edged sword, granting it strength and speed but also marking it as an outcast in both human and boar society.*

*The wereboar's impact on the world is significant. Its presence in a region often leads to chaos and conflict, as it preys on the local population and disrupts the balance of power. The wereboar's curse is a symbol of the darker side of nature, a reminder that even the most civilized beings can be overcome by primal instincts.*"

additionals.title: A long dated Curse
additionals.content: The curse of lycanthropy, which affects any creature bitten by a wereboar's tusks, is a terrifying affliction. The victim's body begins to transform into a boar-humanoid hybrid, a process that is both painful and mentally distressing. The transformation occurs every full moon, and the victim's humanoid mind is replaced with a feral consciousness that drives them to hunt and kill. The only way to break the curse is to kill the wereboar that inflicted it, a task that is nearly impossible due to the creature's strength and cunning.

additionals.title: The Wereboar's Society
additionals.content: Their is a secretive and dangerous one, as its members are hunted by both humans and other creatures. They gather in hidden locations, away from the prying eyes of the world, to share their knowledge and experiences. The wereboar's culture is a mix of human and boar, with its own unique customs and traditions. They revere the full moon as a sacred time, when their true power is unleashed. The wereboar's place in the food chain is a constant struggle, as they must balance their need for human flesh with their desire to avoid detection.

Its statistics, other than its size, are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

monster_instances.description: The Wererat, a shapechanger with a cunning mind, can transform into a rat-humanoid hybrid or a giant rat. Its true form is humanoid, but it is in its rat forms that it truly excels in stealth and subterfuge. With advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell, the Wererat is an elusive foe that can easily slip through the grasp of its enemies. Its bite is poisonous, capable of infecting humanoids with wererat lycanthropy, cursing them with a monstrous transformation. Despite their monstrous nature, Wererats are known to form small communities and even have their own hierarchy.

additionals.title: Wererat Lycanthropy
additionals.content: Being cursed with wererat lycanthropy is a terrible fate. The infected individual gradually transforms into a Wererat over the course of one month. During this time, they experience uncontrollable rage and an insatiable hunger for flesh. The curse also grants them limited shapechanging abilities, allowing them to transform into a rat-humanoid hybrid or a giant rat.

additionals.title: Social Interactions
additionals.content: Wererats are known to be cunning and manipulative creatures. They often form small communities in secluded areas, far from human settlements. They are skilled thieves and assassins, using their shapechanging abilities to infiltrate enemy strongholds and carry out their nefarious deeds.

monster_instances.damage_immunities: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical weapons that aren't silvered
monster_instances.description: The Weretiger is a rare and enigmatic creature that dwells in the dense forests of this world. It is a shapechanger by nature, able to transform between its humanoid form and that of a fearsome tiger or hybrid form. This transformation grants it incredible agility and strength, making it a formidable adversary to those who cross its path. The origin of the Weretiger is shrouded in mystery, with some believing them to be cursed by ancient magic while others speculate they are descendants of divine beings. Regardless of their origin, their presence has left an indelible mark on the history of these lands.

content.title: The Curse of the Weretiger
content.content: The Weretiger's transformation is the result of a powerful curse, one that has been passed down through generations. This curse, believed to have been cast by a vengeful sorcerer, binds the Weretiger to a cycle of transformation, forcing them to live a life of duality. The curse is a heavy burden, one that has shaped the Weretiger's character and driven them to seek a way to break free from its grasp.

content.title: The Weretiger's Transformation
content.content: The Weretiger's transformation is a process of immense power and danger. As the moon rises and sets, the Weretiger's body undergoes a dramatic change, its humanoid form melding into that of a tiger or hybrid. This transformation is not without its risks, as the Weretiger's body is pushed to its limits, and the strain can lead to severe injury or even death. Despite the dangers, the Weretiger's transformation is a source of pride, a testament to their strength and resilience.

content.title: The Hunter and the Hunted
content.content: The Weretiger's existence is one of constant struggle, as they are both hunter and hunted. They are feared and revered by those who encounter them, their powerful form and mysterious nature making them a symbol of both danger and awe. The Weretiger's life is a constant battle for survival, as they must navigate a world that is both in awe of their power and terrified of their potential wrath.

Its statistics, other than its AC, are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

monster_instances.damage_immunities: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical weapons that aren't silvered
monster_instances.description: The *moonlit shadows* shimmer as a *werewolf* emerges from them, its _humanoid_ form twisted into something primal and feral. Its **sharp claws** are ready to rip apart any creature that dares to cross its path. The werewolf's **keen hearing** allows it to detect even the faintest sounds, giving it a significant advantage in its underworld domain. Its **blindsight** ability allows it to navigate the darkest depths with ease, making it a formidable predator that can strike fear into the hearts of even the bravest adventurers.

additionals.title: The Curse of Lycanthropy
additionals.content: *The Curse of Lycanthropy* is a mysterious affliction that affects those who have been bitten or scratched by a werewolf. The curse causes its victims to transform into werewolves themselves during the night or when exposed to moonlight. This transformation is not only physical but also psychological, as victims often find themselves consumed by an insatiable hunger for human flesh.

additionals.title: Lunar Influence
additionals.content: *Lunar Influence* plays a significant role in the life of a werewolf. During full moons, werewolves become more powerful and aggressive. Their senses are heightened, their speed increases, and their strength becomes nearly supernatural. However, this power comes at a cost: during these times, werewolves are more susceptible to being controlled by malevolent forces or losing control over their human form.

additionals.title: Werewolf Society
additionals.content: *Werewolf Society* is a complex web of relationships among those who bear the curse of lycanthropy. They live in secret communities where they try to maintain some semblance of normalcy while grappling with their monstrous nature. Within these communities, there are strict rules governing behavior during both human and wolf forms. The society is ruled by an ancient council of powerful werewolves who seek to protect their kind from discovery while also attempting to find a cure for their curse.

monster_instances.name: Magmin

special_abilities.name: Death Burst
special_abilities.description: When the magmin dies, it explodes in a burst of fire and magma. Each creature within 10 ft. of it must make a DC 11 Dexterity saving throw, taking 7 (2d6) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Flammable objects that aren't being worn or carried in that area are ignited.

special_abilities.name: Ignited Illumination
special_abilities.description: As a bonus action, the magmin can set itself ablaze or extinguish its flames. While ablaze, the magmin sheds bright light in a 10-foot radius and dim light for an additional 10 ft.

actions.name: Touch.
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack:+4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit:7 (2d6) fire damage. If the target is a creature or a flammable object, it ignites. Until a creature takes an action to douse the fire, the target takes 3 (1d6) fire damage at the end of each of its turns.

monster_instances.damage_resistances: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical weapons
monster_instances.description: The Magmin is a small yet fierce elemental creature, its body covered in *sizzling* magma that constantly threatens to boil over. Its eyes *burn with an inner fire*, a testament to its chaotic nature. The Magmin is notorious for its ability to ignite its surroundings with ease, setting fire to anything flammable in its vicinity. Its *ignited illumination* ability allows it to set itself ablaze or extinguish its flames as a bonus action, making it a formidable foe in dark environments. When cornered or defeated, the Magmin explodes in a deadly burst of fire and magma known as *death burst*, dealing significant damage to all within range.

additionals.title: The Flame Within
additionals.content: *The Magmin's inner fire is not only destructive but also a source of life. It can use this fire to heal itself when injured or even resurrect itself after being slain.*

additionals.title: The Elemental Dance
additionals.content: *In times of great danger or when feeling particularly mischievous, the Magmin can dance among the flames it has created, weaving between them with incredible agility and leaving trails of molten destruction behind.*

additionals.title: The Inferno's Lullaby
additionals.content: *When not engaged in combat or causing havoc, the Magmin can create a soothing melody with its sizzling body that lulls those nearby into a deep slumber.*

monster_instances.name: Manticore

special_abilities.name: Tail Spike Regrowth
special_abilities.description: The manticore has twenty-four tail spikes. Used spikes regrow when the manticore finishes a long rest.

monster_instances.description: In the shadows of ancient myths and legends lies a creature of terror and beauty: the Manticore. With its large frame covered in scales, it stands as a majestic guardian of forgotten realms. Its lion-like body is adorned with the wings of a dragon, while its fearsome tail ends in a row of razor-sharp spikes. The Manticore's eyes hold an air of intelligence and cunning that belies its ferocious nature. As it soars through the skies on powerful dragon wings or stalks its prey across the land, it embodies both grace and brutality.

additionals.title: The Art of Regeneration
additionals.content: The Manticore's remarkable ability to regrow its tail spikes after each battle is a testament to its resilience and adaptability. This unique trait has allowed it to survive in environments where other predators would perish.

additionals.title: The Dance of Shadows
additionals.content: In ancient times, Manticores were believed to be harbingers of doom or omens of impending disaster. Many tales speak of their elusive nature, describing them as creatures that move like shadows across the landscape, leaving only whispers behind.

additionals.title: Guardians of Forgotten Realms
additionals.content: Once revered as protectors by ancient civilizations, Manticores were said to have been tasked with guarding sacred temples or hidden treasures. These creatures were believed to be imbued with divine power, making them nearly invincible.

monster_instances.name: Medusa

special_abilities.name: Petrifying Gaze
special_abilities.description:
When a creature that can see the medusa's eyes starts its turn within 30 ft. of the medusa, the medusa can force it to make a DC 14 Constitution saving throw if the medusa isn't incapacitated and can see the creature. If the saving throw fails by 5 or more, the creature is instantly petrified. Otherwise, a creature that fails the save begins to turn to stone and is restrained. The restrained creature must repeat the saving throw at the end of its next turn, becoming petrified on a failure or ending the effect on a success. The petrification lasts until the creature is freed by the greater restoration spell or other magic.
Unless surprised, a creature can avert its eyes to avoid the saving throw at the start of its turn. If the creature does so, it can't see the medusa until the start of its next turn, when it can avert its eyes again. If the creature looks at the medusa in the meantime, it must immediately make the save.
If the medusa sees itself reflected on a polished surface within 30 ft. of it and in an area of bright light, the medusa is, due to its curse, affected by its own gaze.

actions.name: Multiattack.
actions.description: The medusa makes either three melee attacks-one with its snake hair and two with its shortsword-or two ranged attacks with its longbow.

actions.name: Snake Hair.
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit:4 (1d4 + 2) piercing damage plus 14 (4d6) poison damage.

actions.name: Shortsword.
actions.description: MeleeWeapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit:5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage.

actions.name: Longbow.
actions.description: Ranged Weapon Attack:+5 to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. Hit:6 (1d8 + 2) piercing damage plus 7 (2d6) poison damage.

monster_instances.description: The Medusa, a creature of ancient myth and legend, is a terrifying sight to behold. With its serpentine hair and piercing gaze, it is a symbol of fear and dread. But beneath its monstrous exterior lies a complex creature, bound by a curse that has shaped its very existence. The Medusa's petrifying gaze is its most feared ability, capable of turning even the bravest of hearts to stone. But it is not just a mindless killer, it is a creature of cunning and strategy, using its gaze as a weapon to subdue its enemies. The Medusa's world is one of darkness and danger, where it must constantly be on guard against those who would seek to destroy it. Yet, despite its monstrous appearance, it is a creature of great intelligence and wisdom, capable of learning and adapting to its surroundings. The Medusa's story is one of tragedy and sacrifice, a creature cursed by the gods and forced to live a life of solitude and fear. Yet, it is also a story of survival and resilience, a creature that has learned to adapt and thrive in a world that fears and despises it.

additionals.title: The Curse of the Gorgon
additionals.content: The Medusa's petrifying gaze is the result of a curse placed upon it by the gods. According to legend, the Medusa was once a beautiful maiden, but was transformed into a monster as punishment for her vanity. The curse has not only transformed her appearance, but also granted her the power to petrify those who look upon her. The curse is a heavy burden to bear, and the Medusa is constantly tormented by the knowledge that it is a monster feared by all.

additionals.title: The Medusa's Diet
additionals.content: The Medusa is a carnivorous creature, with a preference for meat. Its diet consists of a variety of animals, from small rodents to larger prey such as deer and even humans. The Medusa is also known to be a cannibal, consuming the flesh of its own kind in order to gain their power. The Medusa's diet is not only a source of nourishment, but also a means of survival. By consuming the flesh of its enemies, the Medusa is able to gain their strength and abilities, making it a formidable foe.

monster_instances.name: Dust Mephit

special_abilities.name: Death Burst
special_abilities.description: When the mephit dies, it explodes in a burst of dust. Each creature within 5 ft. of it must then succeed on a DC 10 Constitution saving throw or be blinded for 1 minute. A blinded creature can repeat the saving throw on each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

special_abilities.name: Innate Spellcasting (1/Day)
special_abilities.description: The mephit can innately cast sleep, requiring no material components. Its innate spellcasting ability is Charisma.

monster_instances.description: In the shadowy corners of ancient ruins and haunted forests, a sinister presence lurks - the Dust Mephit. This small elemental being is covered in a cloud of swirling dust that conceals its true form. Its eyes glow with an eerie light, reflecting its malignant nature. The mephit moves with unnatural grace, its claws leaving barely visible trails in the air as it darts through the darkness. Its innate spellcasting ability allows it to cast sleep with a mere thought, lulling victims into a deep slumber before striking. When faced with danger, the mephit can unleash a deadly burst of dust upon its foes, leaving them blinded and vulnerable to further attacks. Adventurers who encounter this cunning creature must be cautious and prepared for an ambush from an unexpected source.

additionals.title: The Dust Mephit's Origins
additionals.content: The Dust Mephit is an elemental being born from the remnants of ancient magic left behind by powerful sorcerers of old. These creatures are often found near sites of great arcane power or within haunted locations where their sinister abilities can go unnoticed by those who wander too close.

additionals.title: Death in the Shadows
additionals.content: The Dust Mephit is known for its stealthy approach to combat, using its cloud of dust to obscure its movements and strike unsuspecting victims from hiding. These creatures have been known to stalk their prey for days, biding their time until they can strike at just the right moment.

additionals.title: Sleep Tactics
additionals.content: The mephit's innate ability to cast sleep gives it a significant advantage when hunting prey or defending itself against potential threats. By lulling enemies into a deep slumber, it can then use its deadly burst of dust to incapacitate them further or even finish them off.

monster_instances.name: Ice Mephit

special_abilities.name: Death Burst
special_abilities.description: When the mephit dies, it explodes in a burst of jagged ice. Each creature within 5 ft. of it must make a DC 10 Dexterity saving throw, taking 4 (1d8) slashing damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

special_abilities.name: False Appearance
special_abilities.description: While the mephit remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from an ordinary shard of ice.

special_abilities.name: Innate Spellcasting (1/Day)
special_abilities.description: The mephit can innately cast fog cloud, requiring no material components. Its innate spellcasting ability is Charisma.

actions.name: Claws.
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 3 (1d4 + 1) slashing damage plus 2 (1d4) cold damage.

actions.name: Frost Breath (Recharge 6).
actions.description: The mephit exhales a 15--foot cone of cold air. Each creature in that area must succeed on a DC 10 Dexterity saving throw, taking 5 (2d4) cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

monster_instances.description: Frosty and mischievous, the Ice Mephit is a small yet treacherous elemental creature. Its icy form shimmers with an otherworldly glow, blending seamlessly into its surroundings when motionless. With a cunning mind and innate magical abilities at its disposal, this elusive creature can strike with surprising ferocity. Its breath is like a frigid gale, capable of freezing the hearts of its enemies with a mere whisper. The Mephit's icy claws are sharp as razors, tearing into its foes with ease. Despite its small size, this cunning elemental is not to be underestimated.

additionals.title: The Frostbitten Trickster
additionals.content: The Ice Mephit is known for its deceptive nature and love of playing pranks on unsuspecting travelers. It delights in causing confusion and chaos, using its illusionary powers to hide in plain sight or confuse its enemies.

additionals.title: The Elemental Dance
additionals.content: The Mephit's innate magical abilities allow it to manipulate the very elements around it. It can create whirlwinds of ice or summon fog clouds to obscure its movements and confuse its enemies.

additionals.title: The Frozen Heart
additionals.content: Legend has it that the Ice Mephit's heart is as cold as the icy winds it calls forth. This heart is said to be imbued with immense power, granting the creature an unparalleled connection to the elements.

monster_instances.name: Magma Mephit

special_abilities.name: Death Burst
special_abilities.description: When the mephit dies, it explodes in a burst of lava. Each creature within 5 ft. of it must make a DC 11 Dexterity saving throw, taking 7 (2d6) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

special_abilities.name: False Appearance
special_abilities.description: While the mephit remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from an ordinary mound of magma.

special_abilities.name: Innate Spellcasting (1/Day)
special_abilities.description: The mephit can innately cast heat metal (spell save DC 10), requiring no material components. Its innate spellcasting ability is Charisma.

actions.name: Claws.
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack:+3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit:3 (1d4 + 1) slashing damage plus 2 (1d4) fire damage.

actions.name: Fire Breath (Recharge 6).
actions.description: The mephit exhales a 15--foot cone of fire. Each creature in that area must make a DC 11 Dexterity saving throw, taking 7 (2d6) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

monster_instances.description: The Magma Mephit is a small elemental creature with a malevolent nature. Its body is covered in sizzling magma, giving it a menacing appearance. Despite its small size, it possesses a fearsome set of claws that can inflict both slashing and fire damage upon its enemies. This mephit has the ability to innately cast heat metal once per day, making it even more dangerous in combat situations. When cornered or defeated, the Magma Mephit unleashes a deadly burst of lava that can cause significant damage to nearby creatures. With its false appearance ability, it can blend seamlessly into its surroundings when motionless, making it difficult for enemies to detect it.

additionals.title: Mephit Society
additionals.content: The Magma Mephit belongs to a diverse group of elemental beings known as mephits. Each type of mephit is associated with a different element: air, earth, fire, or water. These creatures are known for their mischievous nature and often engage in pranks or acts of sabotage against other creatures or adventurers.

additionals.title: Mephit Lifecycle
additionals.content: Mephits are born from the very essence of their respective elements. They do not reproduce in the traditional sense but are instead created when large amounts of elemental energy coalesce into solid form. When a mephit dies, it releases its elemental energy back into the world, potentially giving rise to new mephits or causing natural phenomena related to its element.

additionals.title: Mephit Habitats
additionals.content: Mephits are found in various environments across the world. The Magma Mephit specifically prefers volcanic regions or areas with intense heat sources. These creatures are adaptable and can survive in extreme temperatures as long as they have access to their elemental energy source.

monster_instances.name: Steam Mephit

special_abilities.name: Death Burst
special_abilities.description: When the mephit dies, it explodes in a cloud of steam. Each creature within 5 ft. of the mephit must succeed on a DC 10 Dexterity saving throw or take 4 (1d8) fire damage.

special_abilities.name: Innate Spellcasting (1/Day)
special_abilities.description: The mephit can innately cast blur, requiring no material components. Its innate spellcasting ability is Charisma.

actions.name: Claws.
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +2 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 2 (1d4) slashing damage plus 2 (1d4) fire damage.

actions.name: Steam Breath (Recharge 6).
actions.description: The mephit exhales a 15--foot cone of scalding steam. Each creature in that area must succeed on a DC 10 Dexterity saving throw, taking 4 (1d8) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

monster_instances.description: The Steam Mephit is a small, malevolent creature that inhabits the steamy depths of volcanic caverns and scorching geothermal vents. Its body is covered in thick, oily scales that shimmer with an eerie iridescence, while its eyes burn with an intense, unnatural heat. The Mephit's breath exhales in a cloud of scalding steam, capable of inflicting severe burns on any creature caught within its range. Despite its small size, the Mephit's claws are tipped with sharp bone spurs that can deliver painful slashing and fire damage to its foes. When faced with mortal danger, the Mephit can unleash a deadly burst of steam upon its demise, further punishing those who would seek to harm it.

additionals.title: The Birth of the Steam Mephits
additionals.content: Steam Mephits are born from the volatile mixture of magma and water deep within the earth's core. As these two elements collide and react, they give rise to these twisted creatures. The Steam Mephits are a testament to the raw power of nature when left unchecked.

additionals.title: Habitat
additionals.content: Those articulated nature phenomena dwell in the extreme environments where magma and water meet - places like volcanic caverns and geothermal vents. These locations provide them with both heat and moisture, which they need to survive. Their bodies have adapted to these harsh conditions over time.

additionals.title: Smoke Behavior
additionals.content: Steam Mephits are solitary creatures by nature but can form temporary alliances with other elementals or monsters when it suits their purposes. They are known to be cunning and manipulative, often using their innate spellcasting abilities to gain an advantage over their enemies.

monster_instances.name: Merfolk

special_abilities.name: Amphibious
special_abilities.description: The merfolk can breathe air and water.

actions.name: Spear.
actions.description: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack:+2 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit:3 (1d6) piercing damage, or 4 (1d8) piercing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack.

monster_instances.description: The Merfolk are a race of aquatic humanoids that have adapted to life beneath the waves. They possess a sleek, fish-like appearance with scales that shimmer in *deep blue* and *emerald green*. Their eyes are large and _luminous_, adapted to the _darkness_ of their underwater realm. They wield _spears_ as their primary weapon, capable of inflicting lethal damage both in melee and at range. As they breathe both air and water, they can venture above the surface to observe the world from a unique perspective. In addition to their aquatic prowess, Merfolk are known for their intelligence and curiosity. They maintain a complex culture with intricate rituals and traditions that reflect their connection to the ocean.

additionals.title: Amphibious Nature
additionals.content: The Merfolk's ability to breathe both air and water grants them unparalleled freedom in exploring both land and sea. This duality allows them to observe two worlds from different perspectives, shaping their understanding of life.

additionals.title: Underwater Communication
additionals.content: Merfolk communicate through a combination of verbal speech and body language while underwater. Their voices carry vibrations through the water, allowing them to communicate over great distances.

additionals.title: Merfolk Society
additionals.content: Merfolk society is organized into tight-knit communities known as 'pods.' Each pod is led by an elder who is respected for their wisdom, experience, and leadership skills.

monster_instances.name: Merrow

special_abilities.name: Amphibious
special_abilities.description: The merrow can breathe air and water.

actions.name: Multiattack.
actions.description: The merrow makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its claws or harpoon.

actions.name: Bite.
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack:+6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d8 + 4) piercing damage.

actions.name: Claws.
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack:+6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit:9 (2d4 + 4) slashing damage.

actions.name: Harpoon.
actions.description: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack:+6 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit:11 (2d6 + 4)piercing damage. If the target is a Huge or smaller creature, it must succeed on a Strength contest against the merrow or be pulled up to 20 feet toward the merrow.

monster_instances.description: In the dark depths of the ocean, a sinister creature lurks - the *Merrow*. Its scaly green skin glistens in the dim light, its eyes filled with malice and cunning. This chaotic evil creature is not to be trifled with; it is known for its ruthless nature and cunning tactics. The Merrow's amphibious nature allows it to move with ease between air and water, making it a formidable adversary both above and below the waves. It wields its bite, claws, and harpoon with deadly precision, striking fear into the hearts of those who dare cross its path.

additionals.title: The Merrow's Lair
additionals.content: The Merrow has made its lair in a hidden underwater cave system, deep within the ocean's abyss. The caverns are filled with sharp rocks and twisted coral formations, providing natural cover for this cunning predator.

additionals.title: The Merrow's Prey
additionals.content: The Merrow is known to hunt a variety of prey in both water and on land. Its diet consists mainly of fish and marine mammals but has been known to attack larger creatures that venture too close to its territory.

additionals.title: Merrow Society
additionals.content: The Merrows are part of a complex society that resides deep within the ocean. They communicate through a unique combination of bioluminescent signals and low-frequency vocalizations. Their society is hierarchical, with older and more experienced members holding positions of power.

monster_instances.name: Mimic

special_abilities.name: Shapechanger
special_abilities.description: The mimic can use its action to polymorph into an object or back into its true, amorphous form. Its statistics are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn 't transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

special_abilities.name: Adhesive (Object Form Only)
special_abilities.description: The mimic adheres to anything that touches it. A Huge or smaller creature adhered to the mimic is also grappled by it (escape DC 13). Ability checks made to escape this grapple have disadvantage.

special_abilities.name: False Appearance (Object Form Only)
special_abilities.description: While the mimic remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from an ordinary object.

special_abilities.name: Grappler
special_abilities.description: The mimic has advantage on attack rolls against any creature grappled by it.

actions.name: Pseudopod.
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) bludgeoning damage. If the mimic is in object form, the target is subjected to its Adhesive trait.

actions.name: Bite.
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) piercing damage plus 4 (1d8) acid damage.

monster_instances.description: The Mimic, a creature of pure adaptability and cunning, has mastered the art of deception. Its amorphous form allows it to blend seamlessly into its surroundings, appearing as an ordinary object to the untrained eye. However, beneath its deceptive exterior lies a ravenous predator, ready to strike at the unsuspecting. With a single touch, it can adhere to its prey, pulling it closer for a deadly bite that delivers a potent blend of bludgeoning and acid damage. The Mimic's ability to change forms not only aids in its survival but also fuels its insatiable curiosity. It delights in exploring new shapes and objects, constantly evolving and adapting to its environment. As a creature of the shadows, the Mimic is a master of stealth, using its abilities to stalk its prey and strike without warning. Its cunning and adaptability make it a formidable foe, one that must be approached with caution and respect.

additionals.title: The Art of Deception
additionals.content: The Mimic's ability to change forms and blend into its surroundings is not just a survival mechanism, but also a testament to its cunning and adaptability. It has mastered the art of deception, using its abilities to manipulate and control its environment. The Mimic is known to mimic not just objects, but also sounds and even scents, making it nearly impossible for its prey to detect its true intentions.

additionals.title: The Mimic's Diet
additionals.content: The Mimic's diet consists primarily of small creatures that it can easily overpower and consume. However, it is also known to prey on larger creatures, using its adhesive abilities to keep them close and deliver a deadly bite. The Mimic's diet is not limited to just living creatures, though. It has been known to consume inanimate objects, using their materials to fuel its growth and development.

additionals.title: The Mimic's Society
additionals.content: The Mimic is a solitary creature, preferring to hunt alone. However, it is not without its rivals. Other shapechangers, such as the Disguised Drake, view the Mimic as a threat and a competitor for resources. Despite their rivalry, the Mimic and the Disguised Drake share a mutual respect for each other's abilities, often engaging in fierce but respectful battles.

monster_instances.name: Minotaur

special_abilities.name: Charge
special_abilities.description: If the minotaur moves at least 10 ft. straight toward a target and then hits it with a gore attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 9 (2d8) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 14 Strength saving throw or be pushed up to 10 ft. away and knocked prone.

special_abilities.name: Labyrinthine Recall
special_abilities.description: The minotaur can perfectly recall any path it has traveled.

special_abilities.name: Reckless
special_abilities.description: At the start of its turn, the minotaur can gain advantage on all melee weapon attack rolls it makes during that turn, but attack rolls against it have advantage until the start of its next turn.

actions.name: Greataxe.
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit:17 (2d12 + 4) slashing damage.

actions.name: Gore.
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack:+6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit:13 (2d8 + 4) piercing damage.

monster_instances.description: The Minotaur is a *towering figure of chaos*, a monstrous amalgamation of _bestial ferocity_ and _human intelligence_ that roams the labyrinthine depths of ancient ruins. Its massive form dwarfs even the largest of its foes, its _horned visage_ radiating an air of _primordial power_. This colossal creature is not to be trifled with; it wields its greataxe with deadly precision, slicing through armor and flesh alike. Its _labyrinthine recall_ allows it to navigate the twisting corridors with ease, while its _reckless charge_ sends enemies reeling before it. With a gore that can pierce even the toughest hide, the Minotaur is a force of nature that strikes fear into the hearts of all who encounter it.

additionals.title: Beliefs and Rituals
additionals.content: *The Minotaur's* beliefs are rooted in primal instincts and ancient rites. These creatures are known for their fierce loyalty to their pack and their deep connection to the land they inhabit. They often perform ritualistic dances around sacred fires, invoking the spirits of their ancestors for guidance and protection.

additionals.title: Reproduction and Growth
additionals.content: Minotaurs are born from *unions between humans* and powerful elemental spirits. These unions produce offspring with a mix of human intelligence and elemental strength. As they grow older, minotaurs develop their unique abilities, such as *labyrinthine recall* or *reckless charging*, which set them apart from other creatures.

additionals.title: Historical Sightings
additionals.content: *Historical accounts* suggest that Minotaurs were once revered as guardians of ancient ruins. However, over time their numbers dwindled due to various factors including warfare and magical mishaps. Today they are often found living on the fringes of society or lurking within forgotten labyrinths.

monster_instances.name: Mummy
monster_instances.languages: the languages it knew in life

actions.name: Multiattack.
actions.description: The mummy can use its Dreadful Glare and makes one attack with its rotting fist.

actions.name: Rotting Fist.
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack:+5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit:10 (2d6 + 3) bludgeoning damage plus 10 (3d6) necrotic damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 12 Constitution saving throw or be cursed with mummy rot. The cursed target can’t regain hit points, and its hit point maximum decreases by 10 (3d6) for every 24 hours that elapse. If the curse reduces the target’s hit point maximum to 0, the target dies, and its body turns to dust. The curse lasts until removed by the remove curse spell or other magic.

actions.name: Dreadful Glare.
actions.description: The mummy targets one creature it can see within 60 feet of it. If the target can see the mummy, it must succeed on a DC 11 Wisdom saving throw against this magic or become frightened until the end of the mummy’s next turn. If the target fails the saving throw by 5 or more, it is also paralyzed for the same duration. A target that succeeds on the saving throw is immune to the Dreadful Glare of all mummies (but not mummy lords) for the next 24 hours.

monster_instances.damage_immunities: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical weapons
monster_instances.description: The *Mummy* is a *Medium* undead creature with a **lawful evil** alignment. Its *natural armor* provides an armor class of 11. It has an impressive hit point total of 58 (9d8 + 18), making it a formidable foe. Its speed is **20 ft.** and it has *darkvision 60 ft.* with a *passive Perception* of 10. It can speak the languages it knew in life. As an undead creature, it is immune to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical weapons but is vulnerable to fire damage. It also has immunity to necrotic and poisoned conditions. Its wisdom save is at a lowly **2**. It possesses the ability to *Multiattack*, using its *Dreadful Glare* and making one attack with its rotting fist.

content.title: Beliefs and Rituals
content.content: The Mummy's beliefs and rituals are deeply rooted in its past life, when it was a mortal being. It is driven by a relentless desire for vengeance against those who wronged it in its mortal existence. The Mummy follows a strict code of honor, adhering to ancient rituals and traditions that have been passed down through the ages. These rituals are performed with great solemnity and reverence, as they are believed to strengthen the Mummy's power and resolve. The Mummy's unwavering devotion to these rituals is a testament to its unyielding determination to fulfill its mission of vengeance.

additionals.title: Curse of the Mummy: A Tale of Undying Vengeance

content.title: Curse of the Mummy: A Tale of Undying Vengeance
content.content: The Curse of the Mummy is a dark and powerful force, one that binds the Mummy's spirit to its mortal remains. This curse is the result of a powerful spell cast by a malevolent sorcerer, who sought to create an unstoppable weapon of vengeance. The Mummy's curse is a double-edged sword, granting it immense power and immortality, but also binding it to a relentless pursuit of vengeance that knows no bounds. The Mummy's curse is a testament to the power of magic and the depths of human ambition, a chilling reminder of the lengths to which some will go to achieve their goals.

additionals.title: The Mummy's Origins: From Mortal Man to Immortal Beast

content.title: The Mummy's Origins: From Mortal Man to Immortal Beast
content.content: The Mummy's origins lie in the distant past, when it was a mortal man who lived a life of great achievement and power. However, a tragic event led to the man's untimely death, and his spirit was bound to his mortal remains by a powerful curse. This curse transformed the man into a Mummy, a creature of immense power and immortality, but also one that was bound to a relentless pursuit of vengeance. The Mummy's transformation is a testament to the power of magic, the depths of human ambition, and the enduring nature of the human spirit. Despite its undead state, the Mummy retains the memories and emotions of its mortal existence, making it a complex and compelling character that is both terrifying and pitiable.

monster_instances.name: Mummy Lord

special_abilities.name: Magic Resistance
special_abilities.description: The mummy lord has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

special_abilities.name: Rejuvenation
special_abilities.description: A destroyed mummy lord gains a new body in 24 hours if its heart is intact, regaining all its hit points and becoming active again. The new body appears within 5 feet of the mummy lord's heart.

special_abilities.name: Spellcasting
special_abilities.description:
The mummy lord is a 10th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save DC 17, +9 to hit with spell attacks). The mummy lord has the following cleric spells prepared:

• Cantrips (at will): sacred flame, thaumaturgy
• 1st level (4 slots): command, guiding bolt, shield of faith
• 2nd level (3 slots): hold person, silence, spiritual weapon
• 3rd level (3 slots): animate dead, dispel magic
• 4th level (3 slots): divination, guardian of faith
• 5th level (2 slots): contagion, insect plague
• 6th level (1 slot): harm

monster_instances.languages: the languages it knew in life

actions.name: Multiattack.
actions.description: The mummy can use its Dreadful Glare and makes one attack with its rotting fist.

actions.name: Rotting Fist.
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack:+9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit:14 (3d6 + 4) bludgeoning damage plus 21 (6d6) necrotic damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 16 Constitution saving throw or be cursed with mummy rot. The cursed target can’t regain hit points, and its hit point maximum decreases by 10 (3d6) for every 24 hours that elapse. If the curse reduces the target’s hit point maximum to 0, the target dies, and its body turns to dust. The curse lasts until removed by the remove curse spell or other magic.

actions.name: Dreadful Glare.
actions.description: The mummy lord targets one creature it can see within 60 feet of it. If the target can see the mummy lord, it must succeed on a DC 16 Wisdom saving throw against this magic or become frightened until the end of the mummy’s next turn. If the target fails the saving throw by 5 or more, it is also paralyzed for the same duration. A target that succeeds on the saving throw is immune to the Dreadful Glare of all mummies and mummy lords for the next 24 hours. The mummy lord can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature’s turn. The mummy lord regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

monster_instances.damage_immunities: necrotic, poison; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical weapons
monster_instances.description:
"*The Mummy Lord is a formidable undead creature that once lived as a powerful priest or sorcerer. Its body is covered in layers of linen bandages, giving it an appearance of both majesty and decay. The Mummy Lord's eyes burn with an unnatural light, reflecting its ancient knowledge and unyielding determination.*

*Its rotting fist is capable of delivering devastating blows that can reduce its foes to dust. The Mummy Lord's Dreadful Glare can strike fear into the hearts of its enemies, causing them to flee or become paralyzed with terror.*

*The Mummy Lord is protected by powerful magic that allows it to resist most forms of damage and heal from wounds that would be fatal to mortal beings.*

*The Mummy Lord is not a mindless zombie but rather a cunning strategist that commands an army of lesser mummies and undead minions. It uses its Rejuvenation ability to reclaim its body when destroyed, ensuring that it remains a constant threat.*

*Despite its monstrous appearance, the Mummy Lord retains some remnants of its past life, making it both a tragic figure and a terrifying adversary.*"

additionals.title: Mummy Lord's Curse
additionals.content: The Mummy Lord's curse is not only deadly but also highly contagious. Any creature that comes into contact with the dust of a cursed target or inhales particles from the disintegration process must succeed on a DC 16 Constitution saving throw or also become cursed with mummy rot.

additionals.title: History: The Fallen Priest
additionals.content: In life, many Mummy Lords were high priests or sorcerers who served ancient Egyptian deities such as Anubis or Osiris. They were often buried with their most powerful spells and rituals, which allowed them to rise again as undead monsters.

additionals.title: Mummy Lords in Society
additionals.content: Mummy Lords are often viewed as cursed beings who have forfeited their souls due to their unholy powers. In some cultures they are seen as harbingers of doom or even agents of divine retribution.

monster_instances.name: Guardian Naga

special_abilities.name: Rejuvenation
special_abilities.description: If it dies, the naga returns to life in 1d6 days and regains all its hit points. Only a wish spell can prevent this trait from functioning.

special_abilities.name: Spellcasting
special_abilities.description:
The naga is an 11th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save DC 16, +8 to hit with spell attacks), and it needs only verbal components to cast its spells. It has the following cleric spells prepared:

• Cantrips (at will): mending, sacred flame, thaumaturgy
• 1st level (4 slots): command, cure wounds, shield of faith
• 2nd level (3 slots): calm emotions, hold person
• 3rd level (3 slots): bestow curse, clairvoyance
• 4th level (3 slots): banishment, freedom of movement
• 5th level (2 slots): flame strike, geas
• 6th level (1 slot): true seeing

actions.name: Bite.
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 10 ft., one creature. Hit:8 (1d8 + 4) piercing damage, and the target must make a DC 15 Constitution saving throw, taking 45 (10d8) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

actions.name: Spit Poison.
actions.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, range 15/30 ft., one creature. Hit:The target must make a DC 15 Constitution saving throw, taking 45 (10d8) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

monster_instances.description: The Guardian Naga is a large monstrosity with a lawful good alignment, making it a fierce protector of its territory. Its thick hide provides excellent protection against physical attacks, while its powerful bite and spit poison are capable of dealing significant damage to any intruders. With keen senses that allow it to detect intruders from far away, the Guardian Naga is a formidable defender of the underground caverns and tunnels it calls home. Its rejuvenation ability ensures that it will always rise again to defend its territory, making it a persistent threat to any who would seek to harm the creatures that dwell there.

additionals.title: Role in Ecosystem
additionals.content: The Guardian Naga plays a crucial role in maintaining the balance of the underground ecosystem. It acts as a guardian for the creatures that live within the caverns and tunnels, protecting them from predators and ensuring their safety. In return, these creatures provide the Guardian Naga with food and shelter.

additionals.title: Rejuvenation
additionals.content: The rejuvenation ability of the Guardian Naga is not only a testament to its resilience but also a symbol of its dedication to protecting its territory. This ability ensures that no matter how great the threat or how severe the damage, the Guardian Naga will always rise again to continue fulfilling its role as protector.

additionals.title: Spellcasting
additionals.content: The Guardian Naga's spellcasting abilities give it an edge in defending its territory. With access to powerful spells such as banishment and geas, it can control or even banish intruders who would seek to harm or disrupt the balance of the underground ecosystem.

monster_instances.name: Spirit Naga

special_abilities.name: Rejuvenation
special_abilities.description: If it dies, the naga returns to life in 1d6 days and regains all its hit points. Only a wish spell can prevent this trait from functioning.

special_abilities.name: Spellcasting
special_abilities.description:
The naga is a 10th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save DC 14, +6 to hit with spell attacks), and it needs only verbal components to cast its spells. It has the following wizard spells prepared:

• Cantrips (at will): mage hand, minor illusion, ray of frost
• 1st level (4 slots): charm person, detect magic, sleep
• 2nd level (3 slots): detect thoughts, hold person
• 3rd level (3 slots): lightning bolt, water breathing
• 4th level (3 slots): blight, dimension door
• 5th level (2 slots): dominate person

actions.name: Bite.
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 10 ft., one creature. Hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) piercing damage, and the target must make a DC 13 Constitution saving throw, taking 31 (7d8) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

monster_instances.description: In the *shadowy corners* of the **Abyss**, a **monstrous snake-like creature** known as the Spirit Naga lurks. This **Large monstrosity** is **chaotic evil** in nature, and its **natural armor** gives it an AC of 15. With **40 ft. speed**, it is a formidable opponent. Its _rejuvenation_ ability allows it to return to life in 1d6 days with all its hit points regenerated, making it a relentless foe. As a 10th-level spellcaster, the Spirit Naga wields powerful abilities, such as _detect magic_, _hold person_, and **_lightning bolt_** spells. It is resistant to poison damage and immune to both charmed and poisoned conditions. Its _bite_ attack can deal significant damage, while its **poison** ability inflicts severe harm on a failed Constitution saving throw. The Spirit Naga is one of the most dangerous creatures in the **Abyss**, and its presence is a terrifying reminder of the chaotic evil that lurks in the shadows.

additionals.title: The Spirit Naga's Origins
additionals.content: The Spirit Naga is a creature of legend, born from the darkest depths of the **Abyss**. It is said that the Spirit Naga was once a powerful sorcerer who sold his soul to a demon lord in exchange for the power to control others. This dark pact transformed him into a monstrous snake-like creature, cursed to wander the **Abyss** forever.

additionals.title: The Spirit Naga's Lairs
additionals.content: The Spirit Naga's lair is a twisted, **shadowy abyssal realm** where darkness and despair reign supreme. This wretched place is filled with **poisonous plants** and **venomous creatures** that serve the Spirit Naga. The lair is said to be protected by powerful enchantments that cause any who enter to become disoriented and lost.

additionals.title: The Spirit Naga's Hunting Grounds
additionals.content: The Spirit Naga's hunting grounds are dark, **treacherous landscapes** where the creature preys on unsuspecting victims. These areas are filled with **traps** and **illusions** designed to ensnare and disorient their prey. The Spirit Naga is known to lure its victims into a false sense of security before striking with its deadly **poison** and **bite** attacks.

monster_instances.name: Nightmare

special_abilities.name: Confer Fire Resistance
special_abilities.description: The nightmare can grant resistance to fire damage to anyone riding it.

special_abilities.name: Illumination
special_abilities.description: The nightmare sheds bright light in a 10-foot radius and dim light for an additional 10 feet.

monster_instances.languages: understands Abyssal, Common, and Infernal but can't speak

actions.name: Hooves.
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) bludgeoning damage plus 7 (2d6) fire damage.

actions.name: Ethereal Stride.
actions.description: The nightmare and up to three willing creatures within 5 feet of it magically enter the Ethereal Plane from the Material Plane, or vice versa.

monster_instances.description: The *Large* Nightmare is a *fiendish* creature with *natural armor*, its body exuding an eerie aura of darkness and evil. Its *hooves* are powerful, capable of delivering devastating blows that inflict both *bludgeoning* and *fire damage*. The Nightmare's eyes gleam with malevolence, reflecting its *neutral evil* alignment. Its wings allow it to fly at an impressive speed of *90 ft.*, making it a formidable foe in the sky. The creature is silent but menacing, its presence alone enough to instill fear in those who encounter it. It can shed *bright light* around itself while also casting a *dim light* further out, making it difficult for enemies to approach without being blinded by its glare. Its **bold** hooves strike fear into the hearts of those who witness their power.

additionals.title: The Nightmare's Origin
additionals.content: The Nightmare is said to originate from the Abyss, a realm of darkness and chaos where fiends are born. These creatures are imbued with dark magic that grants them resistance to fire damage and the ability to grant resistance to others.

additionals.title: Ethereal Stride: A Ticket to Another Plane
additionals.content: The Ethereal Stride ability of the Nightmare allows it and up to three willing creatures within 5 feet of it to magically enter or exit the Ethereal Plane. This ability can be used strategically by both friends and foes alike, making it a valuable asset in combat situations.

additionals.title: Nightmares in Mythology
additionals.content: *Nightmares* have been featured in various mythologies throughout history as symbols of terror and darkness. They are often depicted as steeds ridden by powerful figures or as embodiments of fear itself.

monster_instances.name: Ogre

actions.name: Greatclub.
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack:+6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit:13 (2d8 + 4) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Javelin.
actions.description: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack:+6 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30/120 ft., one target. Hit:11 (2d6 +4) piercing damage.

monster_instances.description: The Ogre, a towering giant of chaos and evil, is a formidable force in the world. With its large frame and immense strength, it wreaks havoc on any who cross its path. Its darkvision allows it to navigate the shadows with ease, while its chaotic nature drives it to sow destruction and chaos wherever it goes. Despite being able to communicate in Common and Giant, the ogre's evil intentions often overshadow any potential for diplomacy.

additionals.title: Tough Society
additionals.content: Ogres are known for their brutish nature and love of violence. They live in tribes led by the strongest or most cunning among them. These tribes often raid human settlements or clash with other monstrous creatures for territory or resources. Despite their savage ways, ogres have been known to form temporary alliances with more powerful beings if it benefits them.

monster_instances.name: Oni

special_abilities.name: Innate Spellcasting
special_abilities.description:
The oni's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 13). The oni can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

At will: darkness, invisibility
1/day each: charm person, cone of cold, gaseous form, sleep

special_abilities.name: Magic Weapons
special_abilities.description: The oni's weapon attacks are magical.

special_abilities.name: Regeneration
special_abilities.description: The oni regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hit point.

actions.name: Multiattack.
actions.description: The oni makes two attacks, either with its claws or its glaive.

actions.name: Claw (Oni Form Only).
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d8 + 4) slashing damage.

actions.name: Glaive.
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 15 (2d10 + 4) slashing damage, or 9 (1d10 + 4) slashing damage in Small or Medium form.

actions.name: Change Shape.
actions.description: The oni magically polymorphs into a Small or Medium humanoid, into a Large giant, or back into its true form. Other than its size, its statistics are the same in each form. The only equipment that is transformed is its glaive, which shrinks so that it can be wielded in humanoid form. If the oni dies, it reverts to its true form, and its glaive reverts to its normal size.

monster_instances.description: The Oni, a large and intimidating giant, is a master of deception and manipulation. Its form is both terrifying and mesmerizing, with a body covered in dark, inky black scales and eyes that glitter with malevolence. As a loyal servant of evil, the Oni uses its innate spellcasting abilities to cast darkness and invisibility, obscuring the battlefield and allowing it to strike from the shadows. The Oni's regeneration ability makes it a formidable foe, as it can recover from even the most devastating wounds. The Oni's true strength lies in its shape-shifting abilities, which allow it to infiltrate enemy ranks and sow chaos from within.

additionals.title: The Oni's Cunning
additionals.content: The Oni is a master of deception and manipulation, using its charm person and invisibility spells to control its enemies and turn them against their allies. It is known to take on the form of a trusted ally or even a loved one to gain the trust of its victims before striking.

additionals.title: The Oni's Dark Secret
additionals.content: In truth, the Oni is a prisoner of its own dark ambitions, cursed to serve evil for all eternity. It is said that if a hero can uncover the truth behind the Oni's curse and offer it a chance for redemption, the Oni may turn from its evil ways and become an ally in the fight against chaos.

additionals.title: The Oni's Shape-shifting Mastery
additionals.content: The Oni's ability to change shape is not just a means of infiltration, but a testament to its mastery over the arcane arts. It can assume the form of any creature, large or small, and even wield a glaive that changes size with it. This flexibility makes the Oni a truly unpredictable and dangerous foe.

monster_instances.name: Black Pudding
monster_instances.senses: blindsight 60 ft. (blind beyond this radius), passive Perception 8

special_abilities.name: Amorphous
special_abilities.description: The pudding can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

special_abilities.name: Corrosive Form
special_abilities.description: A creature that touches the pudding or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 4 (1d8) acid damage. Any nonmagical weapon made of metal or wood that hits the pudding corrodes. After dealing damage, the weapon takes a permanent and cumulative -1 penalty to damage rolls. If its penalty drops to -5, the weapon is destroyed. Nonmagical ammunition made of metal or wood that hits the pudding is destroyed after dealing damage. The pudding can eat through 2-inch-thick, nonmagical wood or metal in 1 round.

special_abilities.name: Spider Climb
special_abilities.description: The pudding can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

actions.name: Pseudopod.
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack:+5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) bludgeoning damage plus 18 (4d8) acid damage. In addition, nonmagical armor worn by the target is partly dissolved and takes a permanent and cumulative −1 penalty to the AC it offers. The armor is destroyed if the penalty reduces its AC to 10.

actions.name: Split.
actions.description: When a pudding that is Mediumor larger is subjected to lightning or slashing damage, it splits into two new puddings if it has at least 10 hit points. Each new pudding has hit points equal to half the original pudding’s, rounded down. New puddings are one size smaller than the original pudding.

monster_instances.condition_immunities: blinded, charmed, deafened, exhaustion, frightened, prone
monster_instances.description:
"*In the darkest, dampest corners of the world, there lurks a creature of pure horror: the black pudding. A mass of writhing, pulsing ooze, it is unaligned in its nature, driven solely by its insatiable hunger.* **The pudding is a relentless predator, seeking out any living creature that dares to cross its path. Its corrosive form and spider climb abilities allow it to navigate its environment with ease, striking with its pseudopod and splitting when faced with significant damage.*

*The black pudding's existence is a constant struggle for survival, as it consumes anything in its path to maintain its form and continue its existence. Its life is a never-ending cycle of hunger and destruction.* **Despite its unthinking nature, the pudding has a certain cunning, using its abilities to their fullest potential and adapting to new challenges as they arise.**

*As a creature of ooze, the pudding is resistant to many forms of damage and immune to certain conditions, making it a formidable foe.* **Its ability to split when damaged only serves to strengthen its resolve, as it grows stronger with each new form it takes.**

*In the end, the black pudding is a creature of pure evil, driven by its hunger and its desire to consume.* **Its presence in the world is a testament to the darkness that lies within all living things, a darkness that can never be truly vanquished.**"

additionals.title: The Unending Feast
additionals.content:
"*The black pudding's hunger is never sated. It consumes not only for sustenance, but for the pure pleasure of destruction. As it consumes its prey, it grows stronger and more powerful, its appetite only increasing.* **In its wake, it leaves a trail of destruction and despair, as the once-thriving ecosystems it once inhabited are reduced to barren wastelands.**

*The pudding's hunger is a testament to the darkness within all living things, a darkness that can never be truly vanquished.* **It is a constant reminder that even the most seemingly innocent of creatures can be driven to horrifying acts of violence and destruction.**

*As long as there is life, there will always be a place for the black pudding. Its existence is a stark reminder of the darkness that lies within all of us, a darkness that can never be truly vanquished.**"

additionals.title: The Pudding's Paradox
additionals.content:
"*The black pudding is a creature of contradictions. Despite its unthinking nature, it possesses a certain cunning that allows it to navigate its environment with ease and adapt to new challenges.* **Its corrosive form and spider climb abilities make it a formidable foe, capable of striking from any angle and leaving its prey with no chance of escape.**

*Yet, for all its power and cunning, the pudding is still a creature of ooze, vulnerable to certain forms of damage and immune to others.* **Its existence is a testament to the fact that even the most seemingly invincible of creatures can still be vulnerable to the right conditions.**

*In the end, the pudding is a creature of pure evil, driven by its hunger and its desire to consume.* **Its existence serves as a constant reminder that even the most seemingly innocent of creatures can be driven to horrifying acts of violence and destruction.**"

monster_instances.name: Gelatinous Cube
monster_instances.senses: blindsight 60 ft. (blind beyond this radius), passive Perception 8

special_abilities.name: Ooze Cube
special_abilities.description:
The cube takes up its entire space. Other creatures can enter the space, but a creature that does so is subjected to the cube's Engulf and has disadvantage on the saving throw.
Creatures inside the cube can be seen but have total cover.
A creature within 5 feet of the cube can take an action to pull a creature or object out of the cube. Doing so requires a successful DC 12 Strength check, and the creature making the attempt takes 10 (3d6) acid damage.
The cube can hold only one Large creature or up to four Medium or smaller creatures inside it at a time.

special_abilities.name: Transparent
special_abilities.description: Even when the cube is in plain sight, it takes a successful DC 15 Wisdom (Perception) check to spot a cube that has neither moved nor attacked. A creature that tries to enter the cube's space while unaware of the cube is surprised by the cube.

actions.name: Pseudopod.
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 10 (3d6) acid damage.

actions.name: Engulf.
actions.description: The cube moves up to its speed. While doing so, it can enter Large or smaller creatures’ spaces. Whenever the cube enters a creature’s space, the creature must make a DC 12 Dexterity saving throw.  On a successful save, the creature can choose to be pushed 5 feet back or to the side of the cube. A creature that chooses not to be pushed suffers the consequences of a failed saving throw.  On a failed save, the cube enters the creature’s space, and the creature takes 10 (3d6) acid damage and is engulfed. The engulfed creature can’t breathe, is restrained, and takes 21 (6d6) acid damage at the start of each of the cube’s turns. When the cube moves, the engulfed creature moves with it.  An engulfed creature can try to escape by taking an action to make a DC 12 Strength check. On a success, the creature escapes and enters a space of its choice within 5 feet of the cube.

monster_instances.condition_immunities: blinded, charmed, deafened, exhaustion, frightened, prone
monster_instances.description: The Gelatinous Cube is a _monstrous_ mass of *acidic ooze* that moves with _silent menace_. Its translucent form shimmers with _deadly potential_, as it _slowly_ advances on its unsuspecting prey. The cube is unrelenting in its pursuit of destruction, leaving a trail of devastation in its wake. The creature's **transparent** nature makes it difficult to detect until it's too late, while its **engulfing** ability can trap victims within its gelatinous confines, leading to a gruesome end.

content.title: Beliefs and Rituals
content.content: The Gelatinous Cubes are believed to be the remnants of ancient magical experiments gone awry. They are often considered cursed, and their existence is a constant reminder of the dangers of meddling with forces beyond mortal comprehension. In some cultures, rituals are performed to appease these creatures, hoping to avoid their wrath. These rituals often involve offerings of food or other valuable items, and are conducted in hushed tones, lest the cubes become aware of the offerings and become enraged.

content.title: Reproduction and Growth
content.content: Gelatinous Cubes reproduce asexually, splitting into multiple smaller cubes when they reach a certain size. These smaller cubes continue to grow until they reach maturity, at which point they can split again. The growth process is slow, taking years to reach maturity. The cubes are not selective in their choice of environment, and can be found in a variety of settings, from the depths of the ocean to the darkest corners of dungeons.

content.title: Historical Sightings
content.content: Historical sightings of Gelatinous Cubes date back to ancient times, with many accounts found in the writings of early explorers and scholars. These accounts often describe the cubes as being a significant threat to both travelers and settlements, causing destruction and loss of life wherever they were encountered. Despite their ancient origins, the cubes remain a constant threat to this day, their existence a testament to the power and unpredictability of magic.

monster_instances.name: Gray Ooze
monster_instances.senses: blindsight 60 ft. (blind beyond this radius), passive Perception 8

special_abilities.name: Amorphous
special_abilities.description: The ooze can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

special_abilities.name: Corrode Metal
special_abilities.description:
Any nonmagical weapon made of metal that hits the ooze corrodes. After dealing damage, the weapon takes a permanent and cumulative -1 penalty to damage rolls. If its penalty drops to -5, the weapon is destroyed. Nonmagical ammunition made of metal that hits the ooze is destroyed after dealing damage.
The ooze can eat through 2-inch-thick, nonmagical metal in 1 round.

special_abilities.name: False Appearance
special_abilities.description: While the ooze remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from an oily pool or wet rock.

actions.name: Pseudopod.
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack:+3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit:4 (1d6 + 1) bludgeoning damage plus 7 (2d6) acid damage, and if the target is wearing nonmagical metal armor, its armor is partly corroded and takes a permanent and cumulative −1 penalty to the AC it offers. The armor is destroyed if the penalty reduces its AC to 10.

monster_instances.damage_resistances: acid, cold, fire
monster_instances.condition_immunities: blinded, charmed, deafened, exhaustion, frightened, prone
monster_instances.description: The Gray Ooze is a formless mass of gelatinous matter, constantly shifting and changing shape. Its amorphous nature allows it to move through the smallest of spaces as if they were nothing, making it a cunning predator in the darkest corners of the world. With a corrosive touch that eats away at metal, this unaligned creature is a relentless foe to those who dare to venture into its domain. When it remains motionless, it appears as an oily pool or wet rock, blending seamlessly into its surroundings. Despite its low challenge rating of 1/2, the Gray Ooze is a dangerous adversary that can quickly disable any metal armor or weapon with its acidic touch.

additionals.title: The Corrosive Menace
additionals.content: The Gray Ooze's corrosive abilities are not limited to metal; it can also dissolve organic materials over time. This slow but relentless dissolution allows the ooze to break down even the strongest structures if given enough time.

additionals.title: A Shape-Shifting Nightmare
additionals.content: As an unaligned creature, the Gray Ooze has no allegiance to any cause or faction. It roams the darkest corners of the world, preying on unsuspecting travelers and leaving nothing but destruction in its wake.

additionals.title: The Unseen Threat
additionals.content: The Gray Ooze's false appearance makes it nearly impossible for enemies to detect it unless they are vigilant. Its ability to blend into its surroundings allows it to strike without warning, leaving its victims with little chance of escape.

monster_instances.name: Ochre Jelly
monster_instances.senses: blindsight 60 ft. (blind beyond this radius), passive Perception 8

special_abilities.name: Amorphous
special_abilities.description: The jelly can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

special_abilities.name: Spider Climb
special_abilities.description: The jelly can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

actions.name: Pseudopod.
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (2d6 + 2) bludgeoning damage plus 3 (1d6) acid damage.

actions.name: Split.
actions.description: When a jelly that is Medium or larger is subjected to lightning or slashing damage, it splits into two new jellies if it has at least 10 hit points. Each new jelly has hit points equal to half the original jelly’s, rounded down. New jellies are one size smaller than the original jelly.

monster_instances.damage_resistances: acid
monster_instances.condition_immunities: blinded, charmed, deafened, exhaustion, frightened, prone
monster_instances.description: The Ochre Jelly is a large, unaligned ooze with a formidable presence. Its amorphous body allows it to move through tight spaces with ease, making it a cunning adversary. Its blindsight ability enables it to detect threats even in total darkness, while its spider climb ability allows it to navigate difficult surfaces with ease. The jelly's pseudopod attack is both powerful and versatile, dealing significant bludgeoning damage and inflicting additional acid damage on its victims. The jelly's unique ability to split into two new jellies when subjected to certain types of damage makes it a resilient foe that can adapt to various situations.

additionals.title: Jelly's Diet
additionals.content: The Ochre Jelly feeds on organic matter, particularly metals and other substances found within its environment. It absorbs these nutrients through its gelatinous body, allowing it to grow stronger over time.

additionals.title: Reproduction and Growth
