additionals.content: Ochre Jellies reproduce by splitting into multiple smaller jellies when their hit points reach a certain threshold. These new jellies are smaller than their parent but possess the same abilities and characteristics.

additionals.title: Historical Sightings
additionals.content: Throughout history, Ochre Jellies have been reported in various locations around the world. They are often found in dark, damp environments where they can easily blend into their surroundings.

monster_instances.name: Orc

special_abilities.name: Aggressive
special_abilities.description: As a bonus action, the orc can move up to its speed toward a hostile creature that it can see.

actions.name: Greataxe.
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (1d12 + 3) slashing damage.

actions.name: Javelin.
actions.description: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30/120 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3)piercing damage.

monster_instances.description: The Orc is a *Medium* humanoid creature with a **chaotic evil** alignment. It has an *armor class* of 13 thanks to its *hide armor*. Its **intimidation** score is 2, making it a formidable adversary. The Orc has *darkvision 60 ft.* and a *passive Perception* of 10. It has access to special abilities such as *Aggressive*, which allows it to move up to its speed toward a hostile creature that it can see as a bonus action. The Orc speaks both **Common** and **Orc**. It has a **challenge rating** of 1/2. In terms of combat abilities, it can wield a *Greataxe* or a *Javelin*. The Greataxe deals 9 (1d12 + 3) slashing damage, while the Javelin deals 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage.

additionals.title: Orcish Society
additionals.content: Orcs are a tribal society with their own unique culture and customs. They live in rough-hewn settlements often located in dense forests or rugged mountains. Orcs value strength, courage, and cunning above all else. They have a complex social hierarchy with chieftains ruling over their tribes and enforcing strict laws to maintain order.

additionals.title: Orcish Warfare Tactics
additionals.content: Orcs are renowned for their skill in warfare using hit-and-run tactics and surprise attacks to overwhelm their enemies. They adapt quickly to suit the battlefield using their environment to their advantage while showcasing resilience against pain.

additionals.title: The Orcish Hunt
additionals.content: The hunt is vital for orcs as it serves as both rite of passage and bonding experience for the tribe. Skilled hunters are respected by their peers while spoils of hunt are shared among tribe members reinforcing community bonds.

monster_instances.name: Otyugh

special_abilities.name: Limited Telepathy
special_abilities.description: The otyugh can magically transmit simple messages and images to any creature within 120 ft. of it that can understand a language. This form of telepathy doesn't allow the receiving creature to telepathically respond.

actions.name: Multiattack.
actions.description: The otyugh makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its tentacles.

actions.name: Bite.
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit:12 (2d8 + 3) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw against disease or become poisoned until the disease is cured. Every 24 hours that elapse, the target must repeat the saving throw, reducing its hit point maximum by 5 (1d10) on a failure. The disease is cured on a success. The target dies if the disease reduces its hit point maximum to 0. This reduction to the target’s hit point maximum lasts until the disease is cured.

actions.name: Tentacle.
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit:7 (1d8 + 3) bludgeoning damage plus 4 (1d8) piercing damage. If the target is Medium or smaller, it is grappled (escape DC 13) and restrained until the grapple ends. The otyugh has two tentacles, each of which can grapple one target.

actions.name: Tentacle Slam.
actions.description: The otyugh slams creatures grappled by it into each other or a solid surface. Each creature must succeed on a DC 14 Constitution saving throw or take 10 (2d6 + 3) bludgeoning damage and be stunned until the end of the otyugh’s next turn. On a successful save, the target takes half the bludgeoning damage and isn’t stunned.

monster_instances.description: The Otyugh is a large, grotesque creature that resembles a giant slug with multiple tentacles protruding from its body. Its skin is covered in slime, which helps it move easily through tight spaces and escape from grapples. The Otyugh's eyes are large and bulging, giving it excellent darkvision but limited sight in bright light conditions. It has a mouth filled with sharp teeth, which it uses to deliver its poisonous bite.

additionals.title: A Slime-Covered Menace
additionals.content: The Otyugh's slime-covered body allows it to move easily through tight spaces and escape from grapples. This makes it difficult for enemies to pin the creature down or keep it at bay.

additionals.title: A Deadly Bite
additionals.content: The Otyugh's poisonous bite can significantly weaken enemies over time by reducing their maximum hit points. This makes the creature particularly dangerous when fighting against groups of enemies, as the cumulative effect of the poison can quickly overwhelm them.

additionals.title: A Master of Constraint
additionals.content: The Otyugh's powerful tentacles allow it to grapple and restrain enemies, limiting their movement and making them easier targets for its other attacks.

monster_instances.name: Owlbear

special_abilities.name: Keen Sight and Smell
special_abilities.description: The owlbear has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight or smell.

actions.name: Multiattack.
actions.description: The owlbear makes two attacks: one with its beak and one with its claws.

actions.name: Beak.
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 10 (1d10 + 5) piercing damage.

actions.name: Claws.
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 14 (2d8 + 5) slashing damage.

monster_instances.description: The Owlbear is a magnificent creature that combines the features of both owls and bears. Its large size and muscular frame are covered in thick fur that ranges from shades of brown to almost white. Its head is adorned with two large wings that resemble those of an owl, giving it an air of mystique and power. Its eyes are sharp and piercing, reflecting its keen sense of sight. The Owlbear's beak is strong and sharp, while its claws are powerful weapons capable of causing significant damage. As it prowls through the forest, its wings create a soft whooshing sound that echoes through the trees.

additionals.title: Owlbear Diet
additionals.content: *The Owlbear's diet consists primarily of small to medium-sized mammals, birds, and fish. Its keen sense of smell and sight allow it to locate prey with ease.* **Its preferred prey often includes rodents, which make up a significant portion of its diet.** *The Owlbear is also known to scavenge when food is scarce,* feeding on carrion *and even smaller Owlbears.*

additionals.title: Owlbear Mating Rituals
additionals.content: *Owlbear mating rituals are a fascinating spectacle,* a dance of power and dominance that plays out in the heart of the forest. *The male Owlbear* displays its prowess by flying high into the air, then plummeting towards the ground in a display of aerial acrobatics. *The female Owlbear,* in turn, will respond with her own displays of agility and strength, leaping and flapping her wings in a mesmerizing display. *These rituals are not only a demonstration of physical prowess but also a test of compatibility,* with the most successful pairings leading to the birth of a new generation of Owlbears.

additionals.title: Legends of Owlbear Encounters
additionals.content: *Throughout history,* there have been countless tales *of encounters with the fearsome Owlbear.* These legends often depict the Owlbear as a guardian of the wilds,* protecting *the forest from intruders* _and maintaining_ _the balance_ _of nature._ **However**, these tales also speak *of* _the_ **Owlbear's ferocity** _and unpredictability,_ with many a brave adventurer meeting their demise at the hands of this formidable beast.* These legends serve as a reminder* _of_ _the dangers that lurk_ _in_ _the wild,_ _and_ _the need for respect_* _and caution_* when venturing into* _the unknown._

monster_instances.name: Pegasus
monster_instances.languages: understands Celestial, Common, Elvish, and Sylvan but can't speak

actions.name: Hooves.
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) bludgeoning damage.

monster_instances.description: The **Pegasus** is a majestic creature, embodying the essence of freedom and purity. With its snow-white wings spread wide against the sky, it is a symbol of hope and inspiration to all who behold it. Its large size and powerful hooves make it formidable in battle, but its true strength lies in its heart. The Pegasus is a loyal ally to those who seek justice and truth, fighting with courage against evil forces that threaten the balance of the world. Its origins are shrouded in mystery, but it is believed to have been created by the gods themselves as a guardian of knowledge and wisdom. Over time, this noble steed has become an iconic figure in mythology and folklore, inspiring tales of heroism and adventure.

additionals.title: The Celestial Bond
additionals.content: *In ancient times*, _Pegasi_ were believed to be bound to their riders by _celestial magic_. This magical bond was said to create an unbreakable connection between horse and rider, allowing them to communicate telepathically over great distances. Some stories tell of _Pegasi_ who chose their riders from among mortals who demonstrated great courage or wisdom.

additionals.title: Guardians of Knowledge
additionals.content: *The Pegasi* are often depicted as guardians of knowledge and wisdom in mythology. It is said that they protect sacred texts and hidden libraries from those who would use them for evil purposes. These creatures are believed to be able to understand any language spoken by their riders, making them invaluable allies on quests for knowledge.

additionals.title: Legendary Flight
additionals.content: *Legend has it* that _Pegasi_ can traverse realms beyond mortal comprehension using their divine flight abilities. They are said to be able to travel between worlds at will, carrying their riders through dimensions unknown to most beings.

monster_instances.name: Pseudodragon
monster_instances.senses: blindsight 10 ft., darkvision 60 ft., passive Perception 13

special_abilities.name: Keen Senses
special_abilities.description: The pseudodragon has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight, hearing, or smell.

special_abilities.name: Magic Resistance
special_abilities.description: The pseudodragon has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

special_abilities.name: Limited Telepathy
special_abilities.description: The pseudodragon can magically communicate simple ideas, emotions, and images telepathically with any creature within 100 ft. of it that can understand a language.

special_abilities.name: Variant: Familiar
special_abilities.description: The pseudodragon can serve another creature as a familiar, forming a magic, telepathic bond with that willing companion. While the two are bonded, the companion can sense what the pseudodragon senses as long as they are within 1 mile of each other. While the pseudodragon is within 10 feet of its companion, the companion shares the pseudodragon's Magic Resistance trait. At any time and for any reason, the pseudodragon can end its service as a familiar, ending the telepathic bond.

monster_instances.languages: understands Common and Draconic but can't speak

actions.name: Bite.
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit:4 (1d4 + 2) piercing damage.

actions.name: Sting.
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit:4 (1d4 + 2) piercing damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 11 Constitution saving throw or become poisoned for 1 hour. If the saving throw fails by 5 or more, the target falls unconscious for the same duration, or until it takes damage or another creature uses an action to shake it awake.

monster_instances.description: The Pseudodragon is a tiny yet fascinating creature that combines the traits of both dragon and magical being. Its small size belies its remarkable abilities, making it a valuable ally for adventurers or an intriguing puzzle for those who encounter it. With its keen senses and magic resistance, this Pseudodragon is well-equipped to navigate the challenges of the world. Its ability to serve as a familiar only adds to its appeal, offering potential companions an invaluable bond with this enigmatic creature.

additionals.title: A Whispering Bond
additionals.content: When a Pseudodragon forms a bond with its companion as a familiar, their connection transcends the ordinary. They share experiences, emotions, and knowledge on an almost telepathic level.

additionals.title: The Guardian of Secrets
additionals.content: As an ancient being with limited telepathy, the Pseudodragon has witnessed countless events throughout history. It stores these memories in its mind like treasures guarded by a wise dragon.

additionals.title: A Dragon's Curiosity
additionals.content: The Pseudodragon's keen senses make it fascinated by the world around it. It delights in exploring new places and learning about different creatures.

monster_instances.name: Purple Worm
monster_instances.senses: blindsight 30 ft., tremorsense 60 ft., passive Perception 9

special_abilities.name: Tunneler
special_abilities.description: The worm can burrow through solid rock at half its burrow speed and leaves a 10-foot-diameter tunnel in its wake.

actions.name: Multiattack.
actions.description: The worm makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its stinger.

actions.name: Bite.
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 22 (3d8 + 9) piercing damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it must succeed on a DC 19 Dexterity saving throw or be swallowed by the worm. A swallowed creature is blinded and restrained, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the worm, and it takes 21 (6d6) acid damage at the start of each of the worm’s turns.  If the worm takes 30 damage or more on a single turn from a creature inside it, the worm must succeed on a DC 21 Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or regurgitate all swallowed creatures, which fall prone in a space within 10 feet of the worm. If the worm dies, a swallowed creature is no longer restrained by it and can escape from the corpse by using 20 feet of movement, exiting prone.

actions.name: Tail Stinger.
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 10 ft., one creature. Hit: 19 (3d6 + 9) piercing damage, and the target must make a DC 19 Constitution saving throw, taking 42 (12d6) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

monster_instances.description: The Purple Worm, a Gargantuan monstrosity, is an unnerving sight to behold. Its immense size and ghastly purple color inspire a sense of dread in those who encounter it. With natural armor and the ability to burrow through solid rock, it is a force of nature that leaves destruction in its wake. Its bite can swallow Large or smaller creatures whole, trapping them in its acid-filled belly and dealing devastating damage over time. A swallowed creature has a slim chance of escaping if the worm dies, but must navigate the corpse's twisted remains to do so. The Purple Worm's tunneling ability is not only a weapon but also a tool for creating extensive tunnel networks, leaving a trail of destruction in its path.

additionals.title: The Worm's Lair
additionals.content: A Purple Worm's lair is typically a vast network of tunnels, filled with the remains of its prey and the bones of those who have been swallowed and regurgitated. These tunnels can stretch for miles, and the worm's presence can cause the ground to shake and tremble as it moves through the earth. The lair is a treacherous place, filled with sudden drops, sharp turns, and the ever-present threat of the worm itself.

additionals.title: The Tunneling Menace
additionals.content: The Purple Worm's tunneling ability is not only a fearsome weapon, but also a terrifying threat to the stability of the world around it. As it burrows through the earth, it can cause cave-ins, landslides, and even earthquakes. This makes the worm a potential hazard to settlements and civilization, as its tunneling can lead to the collapse of buildings and infrastructure. The worm's presence can also lead to the destabilization of entire cave systems, making exploration and travel through such areas incredibly dangerous.

monster_instances.name: Rakshasa

special_abilities.name: Limited Magic Immunity
special_abilities.description: The rakshasa can't be affected or detected by spells of 6th level or lower unless it wishes to be. It has advantage on saving throws against all other spells and magical effects.

special_abilities.name: Innate Spellcasting
special_abilities.description:
The rakshasa's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 18, +10 to hit with spell attacks). The rakshasa can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

At will: detect thoughts, disguise self, mage hand, minor illusion
3/day each: charm person, detect magic, invisibility, major image, suggestion
1/day each: dominate person, fly, plane shift, true seeing

actions.name: Multiattack.
actions.description: The rakshasa makes two claw attacks.

actions.name: Claw.
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit:9 (2d6 + 2) slashing damage, and the target is cursed if it is a creature. The magical curse takes effect whenever the target takes a short or long rest, filling the target’s thoughts with horrible images and dreams. The cursed target gains no benefit from finishing a short or long rest. The curse lasts until it is lifted by a remove cursespell or similar magic.

monster_instances.damage_immunities: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical weapons
monster_instances.damage_vulnerabilities: piercing from magic weapons wielded by good creatures
monster_instances.description: The Rakshasa is a cunning and deceitful creature, its **jet black** skin *shimmering* with a sinister allure. Its *golden eyes* pierce through the darkness with a malevolent glint, reflecting the depths of its deceptive nature. The Rakshasa is known for its *charming voice*, capable of enthralling even the most steadfast of minds. Its *clawed hands* are sharp and deadly, leaving victims cursed with nightmares that consume their sanity.

additionals.title: Beliefs and Rituals
additionals.content: *The Rakshasa believes in maintaining order through deception and manipulation.* They are devoted to their own survival above all else, using their charm and cunning to bend others to their will. They believe that power should be wielded subtly, through manipulation rather than force. In times of need, they are known to perform dark rituals that summon other fiends to aid them.

additionals.title: Reproduction and Growth
additionals.content: *The Rakshasa reproduces through a process known as 'reincarnation'.* When a powerful being dies under circumstances that make them vulnerable to corruption, their spirit may be reborn as a Rakshasa. This process is not only a means of reproduction but also a way for the Rakshasa to gain knowledge from their past lives.

additionals.title: Historical Sightings
additionals.content: *Historical sightings of the Rakshasa often involve tales of enchanting bards or seductive courtesans.* These figures use their charm and wit to gain power over others before revealing their true nature as fiends. The stories often end in tragedy as these enchanting beings reveal their darker sides.

monster_instances.name: Remorhaz
monster_instances.senses: darkvision 60 ft., tremorsense 60 ft., passive Perception 10

special_abilities.name: Heated Body
special_abilities.description: A creature that touches the remorhaz or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 10 (3d6) fire damage.

actions.name: Bite.
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 40 (6d10 + 7) piercing damage plus 10 (3d6) fire damage. If the target is a creature, it is grappled (escape DC 17). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained, and the remorhaz can’t bite another target.

actions.name: Swallow.
actions.description: The remorhaz makes one bite attack against a Medium or smaller creature it is grappling. If the attack hits, that creature takes the bite’s damage and is swallowed, and the grapple ends. While swallowed, the creature is blinded and restrained, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the remorhaz, and it takes 21 (6d6) acid damage at the start of each of the remorhaz’s turns.  If the remorhaz takes 30 damage or more on a single turn from a creature inside it, the remorhaz must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or regurgitate all swallowed creatures, which fall prone in a space within 10 feet of the remorhaz. If the remorhaz dies, a swallowed creature is no longer restrained by it and can escape from the corpse using 15 feet of movement, exiting prone.

monster_instances.description: The Remorhaz, a colossal monstrosity, is a creature of legend and terror. Its massive, scaly body is covered in a layer of thick, insulating fur that retains heat, making it nearly impervious to the frigid temperatures of its icy habitat. Its eyes gleam with a predatory intelligence, while its powerful jaws house a deadly bite that can swallow prey whole. The Remorhaz is a solitary hunter, stalking its prey through the treacherous terrain of the frozen wastes, using its heated body to melt through the ice and snow. Its breath, a torrent of scalding vapor, can incinerate anything in its path. The Remorhaz is a living embodiment of the harsh, unforgiving nature of the polar wilderness, a relentless predator that strikes fear into the hearts of all who encounter it.

additionals.title: Icy Domain
additionals.content: The Remorhaz is native to the coldest, most inhospitable regions of the world. Its natural habitat is a labyrinth of ice caves and frozen tundra, where it hunts for prey among the snowdrifts and glacial crevasses. The Remorhaz is well-adapted to this harsh environment, with its heated body allowing it to survive in temperatures that would freeze other creatures solid.

additionals.title: Diet of a Predator
additionals.content: The Remorhaz is a carnivore, preying on a variety of creatures that inhabit the frozen wastes. Its diet consists mainly of large mammals such as elk, moose, and even smaller Remorhaz. However, its powerful jaws and acidic stomach allow it to consume almost any creature it can catch, from small rodents to large predators. The Remorhaz's diet is not limited to land-dwelling creatures; it has been known to hunt seals and other marine animals that venture too close to its icy lair.

additionals.title: Cultural Significance
additionals.content: In the folklore of the tribes that inhabit the polar regions, the Remorhaz is a symbol of strength, endurance, and the unyielding power of nature. Stories of the Remorhaz are passed down through generations, serving as cautionary tales and warnings to those who dare to venture into the frozen wilderness. The Remorhaz is often depicted as a guardian of the ice, a creature so powerful and fearsome that it can withstand the harshest conditions and still thrive.

monster_instances.name: Roc

special_abilities.name: Keen Sight
special_abilities.description: The roc has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

actions.name: Multiattack.
actions.description: The roc makes two attacks: one with its beak and one with its talons.

actions.name: Beak.
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +13 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 27 (4d8 + 9) piercing damage.

actions.name: Talons.
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack:+13 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 23 (4d6 + 9) slashing damage, and the target is grappled (escape DC 19). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained, and the roc can’t use its talons on another target.

monster_instances.description: The Roc is a *gargantuan* monstrosity with an unnerving presence. Its **feathered wings** span over 40 feet, making it one of the largest flying creatures in existence. Its *powerful beak* is sharp enough to pierce through even the thickest armor, while its *talons* are capable of grappling and restraining its prey. The Roc's *keen sight* allows it to spot potential meals from great distances. Despite its intimidating size, it maintains an air of grace as it soars through the skies.

additionals.title: Hunting Techniques
additionals.content: Rocs are known for their unique hunting techniques. They often swoop down on their prey from great heights, using their immense size and powerful wings to create a devastating impact upon landing. The Roc then uses its talons to restrain its target before delivering a final blow with its beak.

additionals.title: Territory Protection
additionals.content: A Roc's territory can span several miles across. It fiercely protects this area from intruders, using its size and powerful wings to deter any potential threats.

additionals.title: Legendary Encounters
additionals.content: Many tales tell of legendary encounters with Rocs throughout history. These stories often describe fierce battles between heroes and these mighty creatures, with some even recounting instances where humans were able to tame Rocs as mounts or companions.

monster_instances.name: Roper

special_abilities.name: False Appearance
special_abilities.description: While the roper remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a normal cave formation, such as a stalagmite.

special_abilities.name: Grasping Tendrils
special_abilities.description: The roper can have up to six tendrils at a time. Each tendril can be attacked (AC 20; 10 hit points; immunity to poison and psychic damage). Destroying a tendril deals no damage to the roper, which can extrude a replacement tendril on its next turn. A tendril can also be broken if a creature takes an action and succeeds on a DC 15 Strength check against it.

special_abilities.name: Spider Climb
special_abilities.description: The roper can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

monster_instances.description: *The Roper* is a *Large* creature, belonging to the *monstrosity* category. Its *neutral evil* alignment is evident in its predatory nature, often luring unsuspecting victims with its deceptive appearance. The Roper's **natural armor** provides it with a formidable defense against physical attacks. With *darkvision 60 ft.* and a *passive Perception 16*, it can detect threats from afar while remaining hidden from view. Its **False Appearance** ability allows it to blend seamlessly into its surroundings, making it difficult for prey to spot until it's too late. The Roper's most dangerous weapon is its array of **Grasping Tendrils**. These tendrils can strike quickly, each with an AC of 20 and 10 hit points. They are immune to poison and psychic damage, making them formidable opponents in combat. The Roper can also use its **Spider Climb** ability to navigate difficult terrain with ease, giving it an advantage over many of its prey.

additionals.title: Hunting Techniques
additionals.content: The Roper uses a variety of hunting techniques to ensnare its prey. It often uses its **False Appearance** ability to blend into cave formations until a potential victim approaches within striking distance. Once close enough, it extends its tendrils towards the target.

additionals.title: Digestive System
additionals.content: The Roper has an intriguing digestive system that breaks down even the most indigestible materials. This allows it to survive in environments where other creatures would struggle.

additionals.title: Tendril Regeneration
additionals.content: The Roper's tendrils are remarkably resilient. If one is damaged or destroyed, it can regenerate a new tendril on its next turn.

monster_instances.name: Rust Monster

special_abilities.name: Iron Scent
special_abilities.description: The rust monster can pinpoint, by scent, the location of ferrous metal within 30 feet of it.

special_abilities.name: Rust Metal
special_abilities.description: Any nonmagical weapon made of metal that hits the rust monster corrodes. After dealing damage, the weapon takes a permanent and cumulative -1 penalty to damage rolls. If its penalty drops to -5, the weapon is destroyed. Non magical ammunition made of metal that hits the rust monster is destroyed after dealing damage.

actions.name: Bite.
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d8 + 1) piercing damage.

actions.name: Antennae.
actions.description: The rust monster corrodes a nonmagical ferrous metal object it can see within 5 feet of it. If the object isn’t being worn or carried, the touch destroys a 1--foot cube of it. If the object is being worn or carried by a creature, the creature can make a DC 11 Dexterity saving throw to avoid the rust monster’s touch. If the object touched is either metal armor or a metal shield being worn or carried, its takes a permanent and cumulative −1 penalty to the AC it offers. Armor reduced to an AC of 10 or a shield that drops to a +0 bonus is destroyed. If the object touched is a held metal weapon, it rusts as described in the Rust Metal trait.

monster_instances.description: The Rust Monster is a **sinister** creature that lurks in the shadows of ancient ruins and forgotten temples. Its **eerily** glowing eyes pierce the darkness as it stalks its prey with *silent* grace. The Rust Monster is a *ferocious* predator that hunts by scent, using its **sharp antennae** to detect the *irresistible* aroma of *ferrous metal*. It is drawn to weapons like a moth to a flame, using its deadly touch to corrode metal objects and reduce them to *rusting heaps*. The Rust Monster's **victim** must tread carefully in its lair, as one false move could result in their most prized possessions crumbling away before their eyes. The Rust Monster is not just a monster of metal; it is a harbinger of decay, leaving nothing but rusted ruins in its wake.

additionals.title: Beliefs and Rituals
additionals.content: The Rust Monster has an unusual obsession with ferrous metal. It believes that these metals are imbued with some sort of mystical power that it can harness for its own purposes. To this end, it has developed complex rituals involving rusting objects and consuming them. These rituals are believed to grant the monster additional power over rusting metals.

additionals.title: Reproduction and Growth
additionals.content: The Rust Monster reproduces through a process known as 'spore dispersal'. After consuming a large amount of ferrous metal, it releases spores into the air that grow into new monsters over time. These young monsters are initially small but grow rapidly as they consume more metal.

additionals.title: Historical Sightings
additionals.content: Historical sightings of the Rust Monster have been recorded throughout history. Many ancient civilizations have documented encounters with these creatures, often describing them as guardians of hidden treasures or cursed artifacts.

monster_instances.name: Sahuagin

special_abilities.name: Blood Frenzy
special_abilities.description: The sahuagin has advantage on melee attack rolls against any creature that doesn't have all its hit points.

special_abilities.name: Limited Amphibiousness
special_abilities.description: The sahuagin can breathe air and water, but it needs to be submerged at least once every 4 hours to avoid suffocating.

special_abilities.name: Shark Telepathy
special_abilities.description: The sahuagin can magically command any shark within 120 feet of it, using a limited telepathy.

actions.name: Multiattack.
actions.description: The sahuagin makes two melee attacks: one with its bite and one with its claws or spear.

actions.name: Bite.
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack:+3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit:3 (1d4 + 1) piercing damage.

actions.name: Claws.
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack:+3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit:3 (1d4 + 1) slashing damage.

actions.name: Spear.
actions.description: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack:+3 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit:4 (1d6 + 1)piercing damage, or 5 (1d8 + 1) piercing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack.

monster_instances.description: The *Sahuagin*, a malevolent creature of the deep, roams the aquatic realms with a relentless hunger for blood and conquest. With its dark green scales glistening like obsidian in the murky depths, this vicious humanoid hybrid exudes an air of menace. Its piercing eyes hold a cold, calculating glint that belies its ferocity. The Sahuagin's powerful limbs are adapted for both swimming and combat, while its sharp teeth and claws are honed by centuries of carnage. This merciless predator is driven by an insatiable bloodlust and a fanatical devotion to its dark masters. In the eternal twilight of the ocean depths, the Sahuagin reigns supreme as a ruthless enforcer of its underwater empire.

additionals.title: Bloodthirsty Legacy
additionals.content: The Sahuagin's lineage traces back to ancient times when they were mere mortal fishermen cursed by their own hubris. Driven mad by their newfound aquatic forms and thirst for blood, they became ruthless killers who sought to spread their curse across the oceans.

additionals.title: Sacred Rituals
additionals.content: In their submerged cities, Sahuagin priests perform rituals to honor their dark patron gods. These ceremonies involve bloody sacrifices of captured prey or even rival tribesmen who are considered unworthy.

additionals.title: Cunning Tactics
additionals.content: The Sahuagin is not only a formidable warrior but also an adept tactician. They often use their limited telepathy over sharks to manipulate these fearsome predators into attacking their enemies from below.

monster_instances.name: Salamander

special_abilities.name: Heated Body
special_abilities.description: A creature that touches the salamander or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 ft. of it takes 7 (2d6) fire damage.

special_abilities.name: Heated Weapons
special_abilities.description: Any metal melee weapon the salamander wields deals an extra 3 (1d6) fire damage on a hit (included in the attack).

actions.name: Multiattack.
actions.description: The salamander makes two attacks: one with its spear and one with its tail.

actions.name: Spear.
actions.description: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20 ft./60 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) piercing damage, or 13 (2d8 + 4) piercing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack, plus 3 (1d6) fire damage.

actions.name: Tail.
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) bludgeoning damage plus 7 (2d6) fire damage, and the target is grappled (escape DC 14). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained, the salamander can automatically hit the target with its tail, and the salamander can’t make tail attacks against other targets.

monster_instances.damage_resistances: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical weapons
monster_instances.description: In the heart of volcanic caverns lies a fiery foe that embodies both destruction and survival. The *Salamander*, a Large elemental creature with a **challenge rating of 5**, is an ominous presence that lurks in the shadows of molten chasms. With its *Heated Body*, this **neutral evil** being can instill fear into any creature that dares approach it. Wielding its **spear** with deadly precision, it is not only a formidable melee fighter but also a dangerous ranged attacker. Its **tail** is coated in flames, leaving devastation in its wake as it grapples its enemies with ease. The Salamander's **Heated Weapons** ability adds an extra layer of danger as it wields metal weapons that deal additional fire damage upon impact. Its **damage resistances** make it resilient against most physical attacks, while its **damage vulnerability** to cold serves as a weakness that adventurers can exploit.

additionals.title: Salamander Society
additionals.content: The Salamanders are known for their fiery tempers and territorial nature. They are solitary creatures that only gather during mating season when they engage in fierce competitions to determine the strongest and most cunning among them.

additionals.title: Hunting Techniques
additionals.content: These elemental beings have developed unique hunting strategies to survive in their harsh environments. They use their heightened senses to track prey from afar and employ their powerful tails to ensnare their victims before delivering the final blow with their fiery spears.

additionals.title: The Art of Fire Magic
additionals.content: Salamanders are rumored to possess ancient knowledge of fire magic passed down through generations. While they do not actively share this wisdom with others, those who manage to capture or tame a Salamander may learn valuable secrets about harnessing the power of fire.

monster_instances.name: Satyr

special_abilities.name: Magic Resistance
special_abilities.description: The satyr has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

actions.name: Ram.
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack:+3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit:6 (2d4 + 1) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Shortsword.
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack:+5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit:6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage.

actions.name: Shortbow.
actions.description: Ranged Weapon Attack:+5 to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. Hit:6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage.

monster_instances.description: The *Satyr* is a _mischievous_ and _enchanting_ creature that inhabits the _feywild_. With its _goat-like legs_, _sharp horns_, and _dancing grace_, it embodies the spirit of revelry and joy. In its natural state, it is a master of music, able to play any instrument with ease. Its *performance* abilities are unmatched, captivating audiences with its mesmerizing tunes. The Satyr's charm is not without its dangers; it can be unpredictable and mischievous, often leading travelers astray or playing harmless tricks on them. Despite this, there is something undeniably alluring about these fey beings that make them a staple of folklore and legend.

additionals.title: The Enchanted Dance
additionals.content: Once every century, the Satyr holds a grand dance in the heart of the feywild. This event is said to be one of the most magical gatherings in existence. Creatures from all corners of the feywild come together to celebrate life and dance away their worries. The Satyr plays a pivotal role in this event, leading the dance with its enchanting melodies.

additionals.title: The Music of the Ages
additionals.content: Throughout history, many civilizations have attributed their greatest musical achievements to divine inspiration from Satyrs. These beings are believed to have taught humans how to create harmonious melodies that can bring joy or sorrow depending on their nature.

additionals.title: The Satyr's Curse
additionals.content: It is said that when angered or wronged by mortals, some Satyrs may place a curse upon them. This curse causes those affected to become irresistibly drawn towards music but unable to play any instrument themselves.

monster_instances.name: Shadow

special_abilities.name: Amorphous
special_abilities.description: The shadow can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

special_abilities.name: Shadow Stealth
special_abilities.description: While in dim light or darkness, the shadow can take the Hide action as a bonus action. Its stealth bonus is also improved to +6.

special_abilities.name: Sunlight Weakness
special_abilities.description: While in sunlight, the shadow has disadvantage on attack rolls, ability checks, and saving throws.

actions.name: Strength Drain.
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 9 (2d6 + 2) necrotic damage, and the target’s Strength score is reduced by 1d4. The target dies if this reduces its Strength to 0. Otherwise, the reduction lasts until the target finishes a short or long rest.  If a non--evil humanoid dies from this attack, a new shadow rises from the corpse 1d4 hours later.

monster_instances.damage_resistances: acid, cold, fire, lightning, thunder; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical weapons
monster_instances.condition_immunities: exhaustion, frightened, grappled, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned, prone, restrained
monster_instances.description:
"*The Shadow, an amorphous and sinister creature, is a manifestation of darkness itself. Its form is fluid and ever-changing, adapting to its surroundings and blending seamlessly into the shadows. Its stealth is unparalleled, making it a formidable foe in the dim light or darkness. The Shadow is driven by a hunger for power and a desire to spread its darkness across the world.*

*Its Strength Drain attack is a terrifying weapon, reducing its victims' Strength score and potentially causing them to die if it reaches zero. The Shadow is not picky about its targets, often preying on the weak and vulnerable. It is particularly drawn to evil humanoids, as their death can give rise to a new Shadow. In the right conditions, the Shadow can even regenerate its own strength, making it a relentless and persistent threat.*

*The Shadows are a race of undead creatures, bound by a dark magic that keeps them in a state of perpetual existence. They are said to have once been mortal beings, but their souls were corrupted and twisted by dark forces, turning them into the monstrous creatures they are today.*

*Shadows are known to be highly intelligent and cunning, often working in groups to achieve their goals. They are ruthless and merciless, with no regard for the lives of others. Their ultimate goal is to spread their darkness across the world, plunging it into eternal night and enslaving all living beings.*

*The Shadows are a constant reminder of the darkness that lurks within the hearts of men, a symbol of the corruption that can turn even the most noble of souls into monsters.*

monster_instances.name: Shambling Mound
monster_instances.senses: blindsight 60 ft. (blind beyond this radius), passive Perception 10

special_abilities.name: Lightning Absorption
special_abilities.description: Whenever the shambling mound is subjected to lightning damage, it takes no damage and regains a number of hit points equal to the lightning damage dealt.

actions.name: Multiattack.
actions.description: The shambling mound makes two slam attacks. If both attacks hit a Medium or smaller target, the target is grappled (escape DC 14), and the shambling mound uses its Engulf on it.

actions.name: Slam.
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Engulf.
actions.description: The shambling mound engulfs a Medium or smaller creature grappled by it. The engulfed target is blinded, restrained, and unable to breathe, and it must succeed on a DC 14 Constitution saving throw at the start of each of the mound’s turns or take 13 (2d8 + 4) bludgeoning damage. If the mound moves, the engulfed target moves with it. The mound can have only one creature engulfed at a time.

monster_instances.damage_resistances: cold, fire
monster_instances.description:
*Silence dominated the swamp, broken only by an occasional frog's croak or a fish's splash.* **Moonlight struggled to pierce the dense tree canopy, casting an eerie, dim glow.** *An adventurer, armed with sword and torch, navigated the muddy terrain with caution, seeking a safe haven.* **Rumors of a fearsome swamp-dwelling creature, capable of crushing a man in one blow and swallowing him whole, echoed in his mind.** *Skepticism dismissed these tales, yet a sense of danger lingered.*

*Stumbling upon a clearing, he found a small pond mirroring the faint starlight.* **Deeming it a serene spot, he chose to establish his camp there.** *A fire was kindled, dried meat consumed, and water sipped from his flask.* **Exhaustion claimed him as he settled on his bedroll, yearning for sleep.**

*Subtle ripples in the pond went unnoticed, as did the soft rustling of leaves.* **The low growl echoing through the night fell on deaf ears.** *The massive shape emerging from the water, creeping towards him, remained unseen.* **The chilling touch of vines wrapping around his legs, dragging him into the abyss, was unfelt.**

*Awakening to a scream, he found himself ensnared within a monstrous mass of decaying vegetation.* **Blindness enveloped him, movement and breath became impossible.** *A crushing pressure bore down on his chest as the creature squeezed the life from him.* **A thunderclap resounded as lightning struck the creature, causing it to shudder and groan.** *Hope sparked at this potential salvation, but it was fleeting.* **The creature absorbed the lightning, its wounds healed and its grip strengthened.** *His screams morphed into gurgles as his mouth filled with blood.* **Life ebbed away, his body becoming another feast for the shambling mound.**

additionals.title: Reproduction and Growth
additionals.content: *They* reproduce asexually, **splitting off a portion of their body** and leaving it in a suitable environment. The offspring grows slowly, **absorbing organic matter** and incorporating it into its form. A *shambling mound* can also grow by consuming others of its kind, becoming larger and more formidable. It lacks any concept of kinship or loyalty, attacking any creature that crosses its path, including its own offspring or siblings.

additionals.title: Beliefs and Rituals
additionals.content: While *they* lack religion or philosophy, they possess a primal instinct to survive and thrive. They view the world as their domain and all living things as their food. They perform a ritual of offering their most prized kills to the storm god, whom they believe is the source of lightning. The *shambling mound* places the corpses of its victims on high ground, where they can be struck by lightning and absorbed. This act is considered sacred, and the *shambling mound* will defend its offerings from any intruders.

additionals.title: Historical Sightings
additionals.content: Historically, *shambling mounds* have been sighted in various regions, often associated with **ancient ruins or forgotten temples**. They are believed to be guardians of these sacred places, protecting them from intruders. There are tales of brave adventurers who have tried to plunder these ruins, only to be swallowed whole by the *shambling mound*. These stories serve as a warning to those who dare to disturb the peace of these sacred places.

monster_instances.name: Shield Guardian
monster_instances.senses: blindsight 10 ft., darkvision 60 ft., passive Perception 10

special_abilities.name: Bound
special_abilities.description: The shield guardian is magically bound to an amulet. As long as the guardian and its amulet are on the same plane of existence, the amulet's wearer can telepathically call the guardian to travel to it, and the guardian knows the distance and direction to the amulet. If the guardian is within 60 feet of the amulet's wearer, half of any damage the wearer takes (rounded up) is transferred to the guardian.

special_abilities.name: Regeneration
special_abilities.description: The shield guardian regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hit. point.

special_abilities.name: Spell Storing
special_abilities.description: A spellcaster who wears the shield guardian's amulet can cause the guardian to store one spell of 4th level or lower. To do so, the wearer must cast the spell on the guardian. The spell has no effect but is stored within the guardian. When commanded to do so by the wearer or when a situation arises that was predefined by the spellcaster, the guardian casts the stored spell with any parameters set by the original caster, requiring no components. When the spell is cast or a new spell is stored, any previously stored spell is lost.

monster_instances.languages: understands commands given in any language but can't speak

actions.name: Multiattack.
actions.description: The guardian makes two fist attacks.

actions.name: Fist.
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Shield.
actions.description: When a creature makes an attack against the wearer of the guardian’s amulet, the guardian grants a +2 bonus to the wearer’s AC if the guardian is within 5feet of the wearer.

monster_instances.description: The Shield Guardian is a formidable construct designed to protect its charge with unwavering loyalty. Its massive frame is covered in gleaming *platinum armor*, giving it an air of nobility and purpose. Its eyes are like *burnished gold*, reflecting an ancient wisdom that has seen countless battles. The guardian moves with graceful precision, its *giant shield* seemingly an extension of its own body. The Shield Guardian's **regenerative** abilities make it a relentless defender, capable of absorbing damage meant for its charge and recovering quickly from injuries. Its **spell storing** ability adds another layer of protection to its arsenal, allowing it to unleash powerful spells at critical moments. The bond between the Shield Guardian and its amulet-wearing charge is one of unyielding devotion, making it a fearsome opponent for those who would threaten its protector.

content.title: Origins of the Shield Guardians
content.content: The Shield Guardians are ancient constructs, created by master artificers to serve as protectors of the realm. They are imbued with a powerful magical bond, tying them to an amulet worn by their charge. This bond is a testament to the artificer's skill, allowing the guardian to sense the wearer's location and move to their side in an instant. The process of creating a Shield Guardian is a complex ritual, requiring the caster to draw upon their own life force to bind an elemental spirit to a physical form. The guardian's loyalty is unwavering, and its devotion to its charge is a shining example of the power of magic and the art of creation.

content.title: The Art of Binding
content.content: The process of binding a Shield Guardian to an amulet is a delicate and intricate art. The artificer must carefully weave together the guardian's elemental spirit with the physical form, creating a bond that transcends the boundaries of life and death. This bond allows the guardian to sense the wearer's location and move to their side in an instant. The art of binding is a closely guarded secret, passed down from master to apprentice through generations. It requires not only technical skill but also a deep understanding of the magical forces at play. The process is dangerous, and many artificers have lost their lives in the pursuit of this knowledge. But for those who succeed, the ability to create a Shield Guardian is a testament to their mastery of the arcane arts.

content.title: Legends of Fallen Guardians
content.content: The Shield Guardians are revered for their loyalty and devotion, but even these powerful constructs are not immune to the ravages of time and the forces of darkness. Over the centuries, many guardians have fallen in battle, their bodies shattered and their spirits broken. These fallen guardians have become the stuff of legend, their stories passed down through generations as a reminder of the price paid for protection. Some legends speak of guardians who have sacrificed themselves to protect their charges, their bodies destroyed but their spirits lingering to watch over their fallen comrades. Others tell of guardians who have been corrupted by dark magic, their once noble purpose twisted into a tool of destruction. These stories serve as a reminder of the power of the Shield Guardians and the importance of maintaining the delicate balance between protection and destruction.

monster_instances.name: Skeleton
monster_instances.languages: understands all languages it spoke in life but can't speak

actions.name: Shortsword.
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage.

actions.name: Shortbow.
actions.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage.

monster_instances.description: A skeleton is a creature of the afterlife, an undead being brought back to life by nefarious forces. They are bound to serve their masters, no matter how evil or twisted their intentions may be. Their bones, once the remnants of a mortal being, now serve as a chilling reminder of their past life. Skeletons are relentless in their pursuit of their masters' goals, driven by a force beyond their control.

monster_instances.name: Minotaur Skeleton

special_abilities.name: Charge
special_abilities.description: If the skeleton moves at least 10 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a gore attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 9 (2d8) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 14 Strength saving throw or be pushed up to 10 feet away and knocked prone.

actions.name: Greataxe.
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack:+6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit:17 (2d12 + 4) slashing damage.

actions.name: Gore.
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack:+6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit:13 (2d8 + 4) piercing damage.

monster_instances.description: The Minotaur Skeleton is an undead abomination, once a mighty minotaur now animated by dark magic. Its bones are cold to the touch and emit an eerie glow, as if lit from within. The skeleton's eyes are empty sockets, replaced by the darkness of the Abyss. It moves with an unnatural grace and speed, charging towards its enemies with unrelenting ferocity. The Minotaur Skeleton is vulnerable to bludgeoning damage, hinting at the curse or spell that binds it to this world as an instrument of vengeance. The necromancer responsible for its creation remains shrouded in mystery, their motives unknown.

additionals.title: The Cursed Minotaur
additionals.content: The Minotaur Skeleton was once a proud and fierce warrior, but a powerful curse or magical ritual transformed it into an undead creature of darkness. The nature of this transformation is shrouded in mystery, but it is clear that the Minotaur Skeleton now serves as a weapon for some malevolent force.

additionals.title: The Necromancer's Handiwork
additionals.content: The Minotaur Skeleton's creation can be traced back to a powerful necromancer who sought to harness its strength for their own purposes. This enigmatic figure remains hidden in the shadows, pulling strings from afar as they manipulate the undead minotaur for their own ends.

additionals.title: A Relentless War Machine
additionals.content: The Minotaur Skeleton's charge ability makes it a formidable war machine on the battlefield. As it barrels towards its enemies with devastating force, few can stand against its piercing gore attack and the potential to knock them prone with ease.

monster_instances.name: Warhorse Skeleton

actions.name: Hooves.
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack:+6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit:11 (2d6 + 4) bludgeoning damage.

monster_instances.description: The Warhorse Skeleton is a formidable undead creature, its once majestic form now reduced to a twisted, bony shell. Its large size and imposing presence strike fear into the hearts of those who encounter it. The scraps of barding that still cling to its skeletal frame are a testament to its former glory. Its darkvision allows it to see in the darkest of places, making it a relentless hunter. Despite its vulnerability to bludgeoning damage, its powerful hooves can deal devastating blows to its enemies. The Warhorse Skeleton is a creature of the night, its skeletal form blending seamlessly into the darkness. It is driven by an insatiable hunger for flesh and a desire to spread its undead curse. Its haunting, skeletal visage is a chilling reminder of the power of necromancy and the eternal struggle between life and death.

monster_instances.name: Specter

special_abilities.name: Incorporeal Movement
special_abilities.description: The specter can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 (1d10) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

special_abilities.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
special_abilities.description: While in sunlight, the specter has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

monster_instances.languages: understands all languages it knew in life but can't speak

actions.name: Life Drain.
actions.description: Melee Spell Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 10 (3d6) necrotic damage. The target must succeed on a DC 10 Constitution saving throw or its hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the damage taken. This reduction lasts until the creature finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0.

monster_instances.damage_resistances: acid, cold, fire, lightning, thunder; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical weapons
monster_instances.condition_immunities: charmed, exhaustion, grappled, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned, prone, restrained, unconscious
monster_instances.description: The Specter, an ethereal and malevolent being, was once a mortal being filled with chaos and evil. Now an undead creature, it haunts the world as a vengeful spirit seeking to spread its darkness and cause suffering. Its incorporeal form allows it to move through walls and objects with ease, making it difficult to detect or stop. The Specter's Life Drain ability is its most terrifying weapon, as it can reduce a target's hit point maximum with each successful attack. This means that even if the target survives the initial strike, they may not have the same hit points in the future. The Specter is also vulnerable to sunlight, making daylight encounters more dangerous for this sinister creature.

additionals.title: The Haunting
additionals.content: The Specter is known for haunting the places where it once lived or committed atrocities. It torments the living with nightmares and chilling apparitions, often seeking out those who wronged or betrayed it in life.

additionals.title: The Unseen Menace
additionals.content: Despite its ethereal form, the Specter can still be harmed by nonmagical weapons. However, its ability to blend into shadows and move silently makes it a difficult foe to locate or defend against.

additionals.title: The Relentless Pursuit
additionals.content: Once a Specter has set its sights on a target or goal, it will relentlessly pursue it until it achieves its objective or is destroyed.

monster_instances.name: Androsphinx

special_abilities.name: Inscrutable
special_abilities.description: The sphinx is immune to any effect that would sense its emotions or read its thoughts, as well as any divination spell that it refuses. Wisdom (Insight) checks made to ascertain the sphinx's intentions or sincerity have disadvantage.

special_abilities.name: Magic Weapons
special_abilities.description: The sphinx's weapon attacks are magical.

special_abilities.name: Spellcasting
special_abilities.description:
The sphinx is a 12th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save DC 18, +10 to hit with spell attacks). It requires no material components to cast its spells. The sphinx has the following cleric spells prepared:

• Cantrips (at will): sacred flame, spare the dying, thaumaturgy
• 1st level (4 slots): command, detect evil and good, detect magic
• 2nd level (3 slots): lesser restoration, zone of truth
• 3rd level (3 slots): dispel magic, tongues
• 4th level (3 slots): banishment, freedom of movement
• 5th level (2 slots): flame strike, greater restoration
• 6th level (1 slot): heroes' feast

actions.name: Multiattack.
actions.description: The sphinx makes two claw attacks.

actions.name: Claw.
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack:+12 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit:17 (2d10 + 6) slashing damage.

actions.name: Roar (3/Day).
actions.description: The sphinx emits a magical roar. Each time it roars before finishing a long rest, the roar is louder and the effect is different, as detailed below. Each creature within 500 feet of the sphinx and able to hear the roar must make a saving throw.

actions.name: First Roar.
actions.description: Each creature that fails a DC 18 Wisdom saving throw is frightened for 1 minute. A frightened creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

actions.name: Second Roar.
actions.description: Each creature that fails a DC 18 Wisdom saving throw is deafened and frightened for 1 minute. A frightened creature is paralyzed and can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

actions.name: Third Roar.
actions.description: Each creature makes a DC 18 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 44 (8d10) thunder damage and is knocked prone. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and isn’t knocked prone. The sphinx can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature’s turn. The sphinx regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

monster_instances.damage_immunities: psychic; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical weapons
monster_instances.description: The Androsphinx is a magnificent creature with a regal bearing that commands attention. Its body is covered in shimmering scales that seem to change color with every flick of its tail. The sphinx's wings are adorned with intricate patterns that appear to be made of stardust, shimmering with each beat. Its head is a blend of humanoid and feline features, with piercing eyes that seem to see into the very soul. The Androsphinx is known for its enigmatic nature, often posing riddles to those who dare approach it. It possesses great wisdom and magical power, making it a formidable foe or potential ally depending on one's intentions.

additionals.title: Riddles of the Sphinx
additionals.content: The Androsphinx is renowned for its riddles, which are said to hold great wisdom and insight into the workings of the universe. These riddles are not merely puzzles for amusement; they are believed to be tests of intellect designed to challenge those who would seek audience with the sphinx.

additionals.title: The Sphinx's Rituals
additionals.content: The Androsphinx has ancient rituals that it performs daily, which are believed to strengthen its connection to the divine forces that grant it power. These rituals involve intricate dances and chants that echo through the night sky.

additionals.title: Ages of the Sphinx
additionals.content: Throughout history, many have attempted to uncover the secrets of the Androsphinx's incredible longevity. Some believe that their age is tied to their wisdom and connection with divine forces, while others speculate that they possess a hidden source of power that keeps them young.

monster_instances.name: Gynosphinx

special_abilities.name: Inscrutable
special_abilities.description: The sphinx is immune to any effect that would sense its emotions or read its thoughts, as well as any divination spell that it refuses. Wisdom (Insight) checks made to ascertain the sphinx's intentions or sincerity have disadvantage.

special_abilities.name: Magic Weapons
special_abilities.description: The sphinx's weapon attacks are magical.

special_abilities.name: Spellcasting
special_abilities.description:
The sphinx is a 9th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save DC 16, +8 to hit with spell attacks). It requires no material components to cast its spells. The sphinx has the following wizard spells prepared:

• Cantrips (at will): mage hand, minor illusion, prestidigitation
• 1st level (4 slots): detect magic, identify, shield
• 2nd level (3 slots): darkness, locate object, suggestion
• 3rd level (3 slots): dispel magic, remove curse, tongues
• 4th level (3 slots): banishment, greater invisibility
• 5th level (1 slot): legend lore

actions.name: Multiattack.
actions.description: The sphinx makes two claw attacks.

actions.name: Claw.
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack:+8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit:13 (2d8 + 4) slashing damage. The sphinx can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature’s turn. The sphinx regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

monster_instances.damage_resistances: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical weapons
monster_instances.description: The Gynosphinx, a majestic and enigmatic creature, is a testament to the power of knowledge and wisdom. With its large, feline body and the head of a beautiful woman, it exudes an air of mystery and intelligence. Its eyes, filled with ancient wisdom, seem to see through the very soul of those who dare to approach it. The Gynosphinx is a guardian of knowledge, a keeper of secrets, and a master of riddles. Its voice, a haunting whisper, echoes through the ages, challenging the wit of those who dare to face it. The Gynosphinx is not to be underestimated; its powerful claws and magical abilities make it a formidable foe. Yet, it is not a creature of violence, but rather a protector of knowledge, using its powers to test the worthiness of those who seek to learn from the ancient tomes it guards.

additionals.title: The Riddling Guardians
additionals.content: The Gynosphinx is a member of an ancient and noble race of creatures, known for their wisdom, intelligence, and mastery of riddles. They are the guardians of knowledge, protecting the secrets of the ages and challenging those who seek to learn from them. The Gynosphinx, in particular, is known for its unparalleled skill in posing riddles that test the wit and intellect of those who dare to face it. The answers to these riddles are the keys to unlocking the vast stores of knowledge that the Gynosphinx guards.

additionals.title: The Age of Riddles
additionals.content: In the distant past, the Gynosphinx and its kin played a crucial role in shaping the world. They were the keepers of knowledge, the arbiters of wisdom, and the guardians of the secrets of the ages. During the Age of Riddles, the Gynosphinx used their magical abilities and mastery of riddles to test the worthiness of those who sought to learn from the ancient tomes they guarded. Only those who could answer the riddles posed by the Gynosphinx were granted access to the vast stores of knowledge they protected.

additionals.title: The Gynosphinx and the Art of Riddling
additionals.content: The art of riddling is deeply ingrained in the culture of the Gynosphinx. They believe that the ability to pose and solve riddles is a testament to one's intelligence and wisdom. Riddles are not just a means of testing worthiness, but also a way of life. The Gynosphinx, with its vast knowledge and magical abilities, is the embodiment of this belief, using its powers to challenge and inspire those who encounter it.

monster_instances.name: Sprite
monster_instances.description: In the **dense forests** of the **Feywild**, there exists a creature as **tiny** as it is **mighty**. The *Sprite*, with its *gleaming eyes* and *playful demeanor*, is a true embodiment of nature's whimsy. With its **leather armor** adorning its **delicate frame**, it is a sight to behold. The *Sprite*'s **nimble movements** are a testament to its **agility**, allowing it to dart through the trees with ease. Its **sharp ears** are always alert for any sign of danger or adventure, while its **keen eyes** can spot even the smallest of details. The *Sprite* is known for its love of mischief, often using its **invisibility** to play pranks on unsuspecting passersby. Despite its small size, this creature possesses an incredible amount of courage and resilience, making it a formidable foe for any who underestimate it.

additionals.title: The Enchanted Forest
additionals.content: *The Sprite's domain is filled with magic and mystery. This realm is home to countless fey creatures that coexist in harmony with nature itself.*

additionals.title: Guardians of Nature
additionals.content: *Sprites are protectors of their forest homes, using their cunning and agility to keep their lands safe from harm.*

additionals.title: Mischief Makers
additionals.content: *Sprites are known for their love of pranks and tricks, often using their invisibility to play on unsuspecting travelers.*

monster_instances.name: Stirge

actions.name: Blood Drain.
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 5 (1d4 + 3) piercing damage, and the stirge attaches to the target. While attached, the stirge doesn’t attack. Instead, at the start of each of the stirge’s turns, the target loses 5 (1d4 + 3) hit points due to blood loss. The stirge can detach itself by spending 5 feet of its movement. It does so after it drains 10 hit points of blood from the target or the target dies. A creature, including the target, can use its action to detach the stirge.

monster_instances.description: The Stirge is a small but fearsome creature that lurks in the dark corners of the world. Its **bold** eyes gleam with hunger as it seeks out its next victim. *Shadows cling to its _wings_, allowing it to move silently through the night sky. Its **razor-sharp talons** are perfect for grasping onto its prey, while its **jagged beak** delivers a painful bite that can drain its victim of vital life force.

additionals.title: Bloodlust
additionals.content: The Stirge is driven by an insatiable bloodlust that compels it to seek out living creatures as a source of sustenance. It uses its exceptional flying abilities to track down victims from great distances. Once it has attached itself to a target, it becomes relentless in its pursuit of blood.

additionals.title: Nesting Habits
additionals.content: Stirges are known for their unusual nesting habits. They build their nests in dark, hidden locations such as caves or abandoned buildings. The nests are made of twigs, leaves, and other organic materials woven together into a dense mass. Inside the nest, Stirges lay their eggs which hatch into new broods of hungry offspring.

additionals.title: Hunting Techniques
additionals.content: Stirges employ a variety of tactics when hunting prey. They use their excellent stealth skills to approach their victims undetected before swooping down for a surprise attack. Their speed and agility allow them to evade many forms of retaliation while they feed on their prey.

monster_instances.name: Succubus/Incubus

special_abilities.name: Telepathic Bond
special_abilities.description: The fiend ignores the range restriction on its telepathy when communicating with a creature it has charmed. The two don't even need to be on the same plane of existence.

special_abilities.name: Shapechanger
special_abilities.description: The fiend can use its action to polymorph into a Small or Medium humanoid, or back into its true form. Without wings, the fiend loses its flying speed. Other than its size and speed, its statistics are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

actions.name: Claw (Fiend Form Only).
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack:+5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit:6 (1d6 + 3) slashing damage.

actions.name: Charm.
actions.description: One humanoid the fiend can see within 30 feet of it must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw or be magically charmed for 1 day. The charmed target obeys the fiend’s verbal or telepathic commands. If the target suffers any harm or receives a suicidal command, it can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on a success. If the target successfully saves against the effect, or if the effect on it ends, the target is immune to this fiend’s Charm for the next 24 hours. The fiend can have only one target charmed at a time. If it charms another, the effect on the previous target ends.

actions.name: Draining Kiss.
actions.description: The fiend kisses a creature charmed by it or a willing creature. The target must make a DC 15 Constitution saving throw against this magic, taking 32 (5d10 + 5) psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The target’s hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the damage taken. This reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0.

actions.name: Etherealness.
actions.description: The fiend magically enters the Ethereal Plane from the Material Plane, or vice versa.

monster_instances.damage_resistances: cold, fire, lightning, poison; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical weapons
monster_instances.description: The Succubus/Incubus is a medium-sized fiend with a cunning mind and seductive charm. It has the ability to change its shape, allowing it to infiltrate societies and gather intelligence for its demonic masters. Its telepathic abilities grant it insight into the minds of its victims, while its charming presence can lead them to their doom.

additionals.title: The Art of Deception
additionals.content: The Succubus/Incubus is a master of deception, using its charm and shapechanging abilities to manipulate others to its advantage. It can assume the form of anyone it has seen, using this ability to infiltrate high society or blend in with a group of adventurers.

additionals.title: A Feast of Souls
additionals.content: The Succubus/Incubus feeds on the life force of its victims, using its Draining Kiss ability to sap the vitality from those it charms. This can weaken even powerful opponents, leaving them vulnerable to further attacks.

additionals.title: Ethereal Escape
additionals.content: The Etherealness ability allows the Succubus/Incubus to escape danger by slipping between planes of existence. This makes it difficult for enemies to predict or counteract its movements.

monster_instances.name: Tarrasque

special_abilities.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
special_abilities.description: If the tarrasque fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

special_abilities.name: Magic Resistance
special_abilities.description: The tarrasque has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

special_abilities.name: Reflective Carapace
special_abilities.description: Any time the tarrasque is targeted by a magic missile spell, a line spell, or a spell that requires a ranged attack roll, roll a d6. On a 1 to 5, the tarrasque is unaffected. On a 6, the tarrasque is unaffected, and the effect is reflected back at the caster as though it originated from the tarrasque, turning the caster into the target.

special_abilities.name: Siege Monster
special_abilities.description: The tarrasque deals double damage to objects and structures.

actions.name: Multiattack.
actions.description: The tarrasque can use its Frightful Presence. It then makes five attacks: one with its bite, two with its claws, one with its horns, and one with its tail. It can use its Swallow instead of its bite.

actions.name: Bite.
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack:+19 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit:36 (4d12 + 10) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it is grappled (escape DC 20). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained, and the tarrasque can’t bite another target.

actions.name: Claw.
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack:+19 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: 28 (4d8 + 10) slashing damage.

actions.name: Horns.
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack:+19 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit:32 (4d10 + 10) piercing damage.

actions.name: Tail.
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack:+19 to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. Hit:24 (4d6 + 10) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 20 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

actions.name: Frightful Presence.
actions.description: Each creature of the tarrasque’s choice within 120 feet of it and aware of it must succeed on a DC 17 Wisdom saving throw or become frightened for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, with disadvantage if the tarrasque is within line of sight, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature’s saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the tarrasque’s Frightful Presence for the next 24 hours.

actions.name: Swallow.
actions.description: The tarrasque makes one bite attack against a Large or smaller creature it is grappling. If the attack hits, the target takes the bite’s damage, the target is swallowed, and the grapple ends. While swallowed, the creature is blinded and restrained, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the tarrasque, and it takes 56 (16d6) acid damage at the start of each of the tarrasque’s turns. If the tarrasque takes 60 damage or more on a single turn from a creature inside it, the tarrasque must succeed on a DC 20 Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or regurgitate all swallowed creatures, which fall prone in a space within 10 feet of the tarrasque. If the tarrasque dies, a swallowed creature is no longer restrained by it and can escape from the corpse by using 30 feet of movement, exiting prone. The tarrasque can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature’s turn. The tarrasque regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

monster_instances.damage_immunities: fire, poison; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical weapons
monster_instances.description: The Tarrasque, a gargantuan monstrosity of titanic proportions, is an unstoppable force of nature. Its golden carapace shimmers with an otherworldly glow, a testament to its divine lineage. With a wingspan that spans miles and the ability to traverse the heavens at incredible speeds, it brings hope and protection to those in need.
